title: Rock-Star | Appointment Setter
description:
Job Summary:



We are seeking a highly motivated and energetic individual to join our team as an Appointment Setter. As an Appointment Setter, you will be responsible for generating and scheduling qualified leads into new patient consults for our Orthodontic office. Your exceptional communication skills, persuasive abilities, and tenacity will be instrumental in driving business growth and expanding our clinical practice. This position offers an excellent opportunity for career growth and rewards high achievers with performance-based incentives.



Responsibilities:



- Conduct outbound calls to prospective leads with the goal of scheduling appointments for our clinic.

- Utilize a compelling and persuasive communication style to engage prospects, build rapport, and effectively convey the value of our products/services.

- Act as a brand ambassador, representing our company in a professional and positive manner during all interactions with clients.

- Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all client interactions, appointments, and follow-ups in our CRM system, Lead Sigma.

- Collaborate with the sales team to develop effective strategies, messaging, and approaches to maximize appointment-setting success.

- Meet or exceed monthly and quarterly targets for setting qualified appointments.

- Continuously stay informed about industry trends, competitor offerings, and market developments to effectively position our products/services during calls.

- Provide feedback to the marketing and sales teams regarding lead quality and campaign effectiveness.

- Contribute to ongoing process improvements by sharing best practices and innovative ideas.

Requirements:



- High school diploma or equivalent; bachelor's degree preferred.

- Proven experience in a sales or appointment-setting role, preferably in a B2c environment.

- Exceptional verbal communication skills with the ability to engage and persuade prospects.

- Highly motivated and target-driven, with a strong desire to succeed and achieve sales goals.

- Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented environment.

- Excellent organizational skills with the ability to manage time effectively and prioritize tasks.

- Proficient computer skills and experience with CRM software.

- Resilience and ability to handle objections and rejections in a positive and professional manner.

- Demonstrated ability to adapt to changing circumstances and work well under pressure.

- Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to overcoming challenges.



Benefits:



- Competitive salary with performance-based incentives.

- Comprehensive training and ongoing professional development opportunities.

- Opportunity for career growth and advancement within the company.

- A supportive and collaborative work environment.



Join our dynamic team and play a vital role in driving the success of our organization through your high-energy approach to appointment setting. Apply today and unleash your potential!



**IMPORTANT - PLEASE READ FOR SUBMISSION:

- If you are interested in this position please submit a 1:30-second video of why you would be perfect for this position, exemplifying your energy, experience with appointment setting and past achievements. We will ONLY be reviewing applications who submit this video. 



Thank you!

title: Commercial Construction Estimator
description:
Berks Construction Group (BCG) is seeking a skilled Commercial Construction Estimator to join our dynamic team and make a lasting impact in the construction industry. This position is fully remote from the Philippines, with work hours from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM US EST.



Position Summary:

The Commercial Construction Estimator plays a crucial role in the bidding process, accurately assessing project costs from conception through completion. This role requires close coordination with BCG’s corporate office, architects, subcontractors, and clients to ensure that estimates align with design intent, schedules, and budget requirements.



Compensation for this role is negotiable, and we are looking for an expert in construction estimating. Only candidates with extensive experience should apply, as the pay scale is designed to reward expertise and dedication. While a background in engineering is preferred, it is essential to be highly proficient in reading construction plans and conducting quantity estimates and takeoffs. The salary range is between $1,000 and $1,800 per month, contingent upon relevant experience; candidates with at least ten years of experience and native-level English proficiency will qualify for the higher end of the pay scale.



The ideal candidate will excel in estimating responsibilities, including performing detailed quantity takeoffs, preparing cost estimates for various construction projects, and utilizing software such as Procore and Microsoft Excel. Attention to detail and diligence are paramount. The successful candidate must be organized and persistent, with a strong understanding of the requirements for accurately estimating commercial construction projects.



About Us:

Join Berks Construction Group (BCG), a leading U.S.-based commercial construction company with Offices in in the following states: New Jersey, Pennsylvania and Ohio, which is the Northeast area of the united State. BCG is known for our commitment to excellence in building retail stores, restaurants, childcare facilities, and sports venues such as swimming schools and rock-climbing centers.



For over 10 years, we have proudly partnered with Filipino professionals, currently employing 20 + talented Filipino individuals who contribute significantly to our success. Many of our Filipino tea
mbers have been with us for 5-7 years, with almost half celebrating more than 10 years with BCG.

At Berks Construction Group, we believe in creating a supportive work environment where our employees can thrive and develop their careers. We are committed to helping our teams support their families and realize their professional dreams.



Job Responsibilities: 

• Review project plans, drawings, and other construction documents to determine project requirements (Civil, Architectural, and MEPF scopes).

• Create a proposed list of draft RFIs for the client, designer, architect, and engineer.

• Assist in sourcing subcontractors and suppliers and sending ITBs to receive quotes/bids.

• Bid level subcontractors using provided questions to ensure consistency in scope for bids from multiple contractors.

• Follow up regularly with subcontractors regarding bid submissions.

• Address subcontractor RFIs/questions.

• Review and evaluate subcontractor bids to ensure the scope of work is accurate and complete.

• Negotiate scopes of work and pricing with subcontractors and vendors.

• Create quantity takeoffs and estimates for relevant trades.

• Maintain detailed records of cost estimates, bids, and project changes.



Requirements: 

• Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Electrical Engineering (mandatory).

• Minimum of 10 years of experience in Estimating, Procurement, or Construction Management (mandatory).

• Previous experience with a company or general contractor in the U.S. is an advantage.

• Exceptional communication skills and confidence in verbal interactions.

• Strong attention to detail, accuracy, and excellent organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.

• Capacity to perform well under pressure and take initiative in completing tasks effectively.

• Solid work ethic.

• Proficient in software applications and tools, including MS Office, Google Workspace, and cloud-based platforms like SharePoint and Dropbox.



Essential Skills: 

• English Proficiency: Advanced fluency in reading, writing, and speaking, particularly with technical documents.

• Mathematical Skills: Exceptional proficiency in high school-level mathematics.

• Information Technology: Expertise in Microsoft and Google Suite applications.

• Technical Skills: Strong aptitude for technical tasks, with problem-solving and critical thinking abilities, as well as spatial intelligence.



Apply Now:

If you are seeking a rewarding career with a company that values your future and your family's well-being, please send your resume and cover letter

title: Facebook Community Growth Manager
description:

munity Growth Assistant to help grow and engage local

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

munity

- Updating your work information



This is required for authenticity in local community groups.

Requirements

- Comfortable interacting in
 groups daily

 group engagement work



- Familiarity with
 group rules and etiquette

- Fully remote



- Long-term role with potential for additional hours



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Training & Support

- Clear instructions and ongoing support

 groups or social media work

title: Paralegal
description:
Paralegal – Personal Injury & Estate Planning (Remote | U.S. Time Zone)



Are you skilled at managing personal injury cases end-to-end with precision and care?



Do you thrive in a fast-moving legal environment where your work directly impacts case outcomes?



Do challenges energize you—or scare you off?



If you’re the type who leans in, keeps things organized under pressure, and takes pride in doing things right, keep reading.



About the Client



You’ll be supporting one of our VIP legal clients—a highly respected, California-based solo legal practice with nearly 40 years of experience serving personal injury and estate planning clients.



This firm is known for:



Consistently securing favorable personal injury settlements



Efficiently closing complex estates and probate matters



Delivering personalized, hands-on legal service through a sole-practitioner model



Maintaining a strong reputation for integrity, advocacy, and client trust



As the practice continues to grow, the attorney is intentionally building a lean, high-caliber support team that values ownership, accountability, and excellence.



The Role



We’re looking for a dedicated Paralegal to play a critical role in managing personal injury cases (primary focus) while providing secondary support for probate and estate planning matters.



Your work will directly free up the attorney to focus on high-value and complex cases—meaning your organization, accuracy, and follow-through truly matter.



This is not a passive support role. You’ll be deeply involved in real filings, deadlines, and trial preparation.



What You’ll Do



Personal Injury & Litigation Support



Manage smaller PI cases end-to-end through pre-litigation



Draft and organize pleadings, motions, discovery, subpoenas, and litigation documents



Track and calendar deadlines, court dates, discovery schedules, and motion timelines



Trial Preparation



Prepare trial binders, exhibits, witness files, and case materials



Coordinate deposition and hearing prep logistics



Case Management & Filing



Maintain accurate, trial-ready files in Clio



Handle e-filings via One Legal (or similar platforms) and track proofs of service



Client Communication



Serve as a primary or secondary point of contact for clients



Help prep clients for depositions, IMEs, and court appearances



Medical Records & Damages



Request, track, and organize medical records and billing



Assist with medical summaries, chronologies, and damages documentation



Probate / Estate Support (Secondary)



Assist with filings and organization as needed



Flag litigation-adjacent issues such as discovery disputes or property overlaps



What We’re Looking For



2–3 years of personal injury paralegal experience, from intake through pre-lit



Working knowledge of discovery, pleadings, and litigation procedures



Proficiency with Clio; comfort learning new legal tech and AI-enabled tools



Experience with One Legal or similar e-filing systems (strongly preferred)



Interest in innovation and efficiency (tools like Supio are a plus)



Strong written and verbal communication skills



Bilingual ability preferred



Proven success working remotely with minimal supervision



Why This Role Stands Out



Direct attorney collaboration — no layers, no bureaucracy



Real trial prep responsibility — your work impacts outcomes



Growth-oriented environment with plans to expand



Exposure to modern legal technology and AI tools



Meaningful work supporting clients during critical 
nts



Compensation & Setup



$1,500–$2,000/month (global contractor; based on experience)



Work Hours: Core availability 10:00 AM–6:00 PM Pacific Time (flexible as long as deadlines are met)



Tech-forward environment using Apple systems and modern legal tools



Contractor role; retirement options (if available) discussed during offer stage

Objective

Engage with the client’s Substack account to strengthen brand presence, increase audience engagement, grow subscribers, and support the promotion of the client’s content and products in a natural, non-pushy way.

Important!



All applicants must send their applications to 
 – Do not apply via this platform. No applications will be accepted through this platform. 

 

Daily Responsibilities

• Post and schedule client-provided articles and content on Substack

• Follow and engage with new Substack accounts based on criteria provided by the client

• Like 20 comments per day on Substack from targeted creators (criteria provided by the client)

• Engage with and comment on 20 posts per day on Substack using natural, thoughtful, on-brand comments

• Promote the client’s articles and products naturally in no more than one out of every five engagements

• Avoid promoting on the same creator’s content more than once per week to prevent audience fatigue

• Manage the Substack inbox and comment sections

• Refer direct messages to the appropriate channels (procedures provided by the client)

• Complete other tasks as directed by the client

 

Requirements

• Proven experience growing social media or Substack accounts

• Experience in increasing shares, referrals, engagements with ads

• Experience managing direct messages and comments on behalf of a client

• C2 (Native-level) English reading, writing, and listening skills

• High attention to detail and strong written communication skills

• Availability for video calls

 



Hiring Process

The hiring process consists of three phases.





Phase 1 – Application Review

Applicants must carefully review this job advertisement and ensure they meet or exceed all listed requirements. When applying, include the following key phrase in the subject line: Purple Carrots. Ensuring that you first meet all the requirements listed above will increase your chances of being selected for this role. 

 

Phase 2 – Unpaid Task

Shortlisted applicants will be provided with a link to the client’s Substack account and asked to complete the following:

• Review the client’s publicly available content to demonstrate understanding of:

o The client’s niche

o Target audience

o Subscribers

o Products

o Comparable Substack accounts

• Identify five Substack accounts the client should follow to help grow their subscriber base. These accounts should align closely with the client’s brand and audience.

• Provide examples of natural, engaging comments for each of the five accounts.

o Comments must be on-brand

o Comments must align with the original post content

o Comments should feel authentic and non-promotional

• Provide one example of a “plug comment”, where the applicant naturally engages with another creator’s content while subtly promoting the client’s content or products.

o The promotion must align with both the original post and the client’s brand

o It must not feel forced, spammy, or out of context

• Report the total time taken to complete the task

 

Phase 3 – Paid Test

Final shortlisted applicants will complete a paid test task, which may include:

• Identifying larger Substack accounts with strong audience overlap for engagement and subscriber growth

• Engaging on those accounts in a way that draws attention and interest to the client’s Substack

• Writing natural, authentic promotional (“plug”) comments for the clients:

o Articles

o Books

o Products

• Completing all tasks within a time limit set by the client

 

Final Selection

Once all test results have been reviewed, the client will contact the successful applicant with next steps.

description:

Important Location Requirement

We truly appreciate the interest from applicants around the world. However, this position is open exclusively to candidates currently residing in the Philippines due to regional hiring requirements.

Do not apply if you have no prior experience.



How to Apply

=

A link to your resume



A 1-minute video recording describing your relevant experience, sent to: 



Important:

When booking your initial interview or completing your application, please use the exact job title:

Real Estate Property Management VA



About the Role



Are you organized, confident, and ready to take on a key role in property management?



Smartland is seeking a skilled Real Estate Property Management VA / Property Manager Assistant who thrives in a fast-paced environment, communicates with ease, and keeps operations running smoothly. If you enjoy problem-solving, supporting tenants, and ensuring everything stays on track, this opportunity is for you.



Compensation



$280/week



Paid weekly



Long-term, stable role with opportunities to grow



What You’ll Do



You will support our U.S. property management operations by handling key day-to-day tasks, including:



Handle maintenance requests end-to-end (intake, tracking in AppFolio, vendor coordination, follow-ups, and closing tickets)



Coordinate and oversee property maintenance and repairs across multiple units



Support unit turn / make-ready processes including scheduling, checklists, vendor coordination, and quality checks



Manage lease expirations, renewals, and agreements from start to finish to prevent gaps in occupancy



Manage rent collections and payments with accuracy



Communicate clearly with tenants regarding maintenance, lease terms, renewals, and service concerns



Manage tenant move-ins and move-outs and ensure all documentation is complete



Maintain and update property listings across platforms, ensuring accuracy of availability, rent, and unit details



Keep accurate records of inspections, financials, and service requests



Follow SOPs and ensure tasks are completed on time and with attention to detail



What We’re Looking For (Must-Have)



Proficiency in AppFolio is mandatory — applicants without this will not be considered



Proven experience handling:

• Maintenance requests and vendor coordination

• Lease expirations and renewals

• Unit turn / make-ready processes

• Property listings and availability updates



Excellent spoken English



Strong time management and organizational skills



Experience with Google Sheets, Docs, Gmail, and Calendar



Proactive, resourceful, and confident in taking ownership



Ability to work independently and follow processes accurately



Why Join Smartland?



Competitive pay with room for growth



Supportive, professional team



Valuable experience in U.S. real estate property management



Long-term career advancement opportunities

title: Back Office Admin (Billing & Admin Support) | Full Time | 13month Bonus + Yearly Raises
description:
About Our Company:

The Growth Consultant is a leading business consulting company that helps entrepreneurs streamline operations, strengthen internal systems, and reduce daily workload so they can focus on growth and scaling. We support fast-paced, service-based businesses by building efficient workflows, maintaining accurate records, and providing reliable back-office support. As our partner teams continue to grow, we are expanding our internal operations team to ensure billing accuracy, organization, and smooth day-to-day administration.



Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly detail-oriented and dependable Back Office Administrator to support billing accuracy, record management, and administrative operations. This role is primarily focused on managing multiple billing portals, maintaining audit-ready documentation, and ensuring financial records remain accurate and up to date. In addition, the role will provide light creative support, social media assistance, and executive-level administrative support as needed.



This position is ideal for someone who thrives in structured, detail-driven work while remaining flexible and responsive to day-to-day operational needs in a remote environment.



Key Responsibilities:



Billing & Administrative Accuracy (Primary Focus)

- Manage and monitor multiple billing portals on a regular basis

- Ensure invoices, payments, and billing records are accurate and up to date

- Track billing activity and identify discrepancies or issues promptly

- Maintain organized, audit-ready billing documentation

- Coordinate with internal teams to resolve billing-related concerns



CRM Management (Pest Routes)

- Maintain accurate customer and billing records in Pest Routes

- Update customer notes, statuses, and relevant account data

- Ensure CRM information aligns with billing and operational activity



Executive & Back Office Support

- Provide day-to-day administrative support similar to an Executive Assistant

- Assist with reporting, coordination, and internal follow-ups

- Support leadership with ad hoc operational and administrative tasks



Creative & Social Media Support

- Assist with basic design tasks using Canva

- Create simple visuals for internal use or social media

- Schedule and manage social media posts

- Maintain posting consistency and organization

- Coordinate with leadership on messaging and content direction



Requirements:

- 2+ years of experience in back-office administration, billing, or virtual assistant roles

- Strong experience handling billing systems or financial portals with high accuracy

- Exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills

- Familiarity with CRM systems (experience with Pest Routes is a plus)

- Basic experience using Canva and social media scheduling tools

- Strong written and verbal communication skills in English

- Self-motivated, reliable, and comfortable working independently in a remote setup

- Reliable internet connection and professional home office environment



We Offer:

Fully remote position

13th-month pay

Annual salary increases

Supportive and collaborative work environment

Opportunities for long-term growth within the company

title: Full-Time Video Editor — DTC Short Form
description:
Hi!

I'm Lé Fu — 7 years in e-commerce, $5M+ in revenue.

I'm going all-in on a DTC skincare brand selling via Shopify + Meta Ads.

Goal: $1M/month in 2026. You'll work directly with me.



? The Role:

- 3–5 ad concepts per week (short-form).

- Each concept = 1 main angle + 3 variations (hooks, holds, CTAs).

- That's 9–15 video assets/week, 15–60 seconds, optimized for Meta/Instagram.



? You will:

- Turn ad scripts into high-converting video ads — start to end, autonomously

- Create AI voiceovers (ElevenLabs or similar) — this is a must

- Source your own B-roll when it's not provided

- Add subtitles, transitions, and sound effects optimized for DTC marketing

- Keep learning every day with courses and materials we provide or on your own. We are looking for people that want to grow



? Requirements:

- Experienced Video editing in DTC marketing on Meta ads

- Understanding of hooks, pacing, and what makes a short-form ad convert

- Know how to use AI Voiceover

- Resourceful — you solve problems and come up with solutions. You don't wait for me.

- Good level in English



? Compensation

Base: $
/month (grows over time based on results)

Bonus: $100 per ad that hits $1,000 spend at target KPIs — not capped

Perks: Paid daily learning time, creative ownership, direct access to founder, path to creative lead and director as we scale



? How to Apply :

- Start your message with "Brand"

- Portfolio with your best 3 DTC ads (include 1 with AI voiceover) // I won't download anything, it must be on a drive.

- Loom video (1–3 min) walking through your best ad — explain why this is your best ad

- Expected monthly salary + availability



This is a long-term role with real growth potential. If you want to create killer ads and improve every day — we want to hear from you

title: Website Sales Development Representative
description:
Are you tired of campaign-based work that ends every few months or maybe after 1 year?

•Would you like to work at a company with advancement opportunities where you can spend your whole career?

•Do you want to work at a supportive company with a friendly, family culture?

•Do you want to be able to work overtime (but not have it required)?

•Do you want to work for a company where Filipinos are not considered to be outsiders?

•Do you want to work somewhere with no danger they ever ask you to work in person?



Then this is your opportunity.



We build beautiful websites for small businesses across the United States and Canada. Our amazing team of 110 associates has produced incredible results:



We have grown 30%+ each year for the last 8 years.



We have over 2,000 5-star reviews.



100% of our managers and team leads started in entry-level positions with our company.

You will make outbound calls to small business owners using a dialing platform.

You will offer our website services to potential clients.

You may answer inbound calls from potential clients, scheduling them for appointments to speak to a web designer.



What we offer:

Base pay Php 6,350 per week plus night differential (=Php 7,000/wk.)

Weekly incentive pay

Monthly attendance bonus

Monthly technology allowance

Pay is received every Friday

Very stable work

Permanent position (not just a contract)

Overtime is always available (but not required)

Ability to work from home

Respectful, encouraging work culture

Opportunity to grow with the company



APPLY HERE: Upgrade to see actual info/f9aaPs/kd86oiarhx/index

Excellent English language skills, both verbal and written

Experience with appointment setting OR equivalent outbound calling experience

Ability to work from home (Must have good internet access, a computer, and a headset.)

A history of great teamwork

Strong customer-handling skills

Able to work during USA business hours from 7:45 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. Eastern Standard Time with overtime (7:45 p.m. to 4 a.m. Manila Time) Monday through Friday, along with an optional OT that runs through 5:00 a.m. Eastern Standard Time.



This is a permanent work-from-home position. Our workflow is extremely stable.



We are a Christian-led business. You will hear a lot about our faith when you work here. We have adopted 8 orphanages in the Philippines with 164 orphans. None of these kids has a birthday that someone on our staff isn't there to celebrate. We reimburse Financial Peace classes, and some employees meet for a Bible study on the clock. title: We’re Hiring: Virtual Government Contracting & Sourcing Specialist (Remote)
description:
Everstone Industries LLC is a U.S.-based government contracting company specializing in supplying products and components to U.S. federal agencies. We are seeking a highly organized, experienced Virtual Government Contracting & Sourcing Specialist to support our procurement and quoting operations.



This role is ideal for someone with hands-on experience in government contracting or supply chain sourcing who is confident with cold calling vendors, requesting quotes, and negotiating pricing.



Key Responsibilities



Cold call manufacturers, distributors, and suppliers to request pricing and availability



Source and obtain competitive quotes for government solicitations (RFQs/RFPs)



Communicate professionally with vendors via phone and



Negotiate pricing, lead times, and terms to support competitive bids



Research suppliers using online databases, marketplaces, and internal tools



Organize quotes, vendor information, and documentation accurately



Maintain clear records and follow up consistently with suppliers



Support the government contracting process with attention to compliance and detail



Required Qualifications



Proven experience in government contracting, procurement, or supply chain



Strong cold-calling experience and confidence speaking with vendors



Excellent spoken and written English (very important)



Ability to research parts, vendors, and pricing efficiently



Strong negotiation skills and professional communication style



Highly organized with strong attention to detail



Comfortable working remotely and meeting deadlines



Preferred Experience



Experience sourcing for U.S. government contracts (DLA, DoD, federal agencies)



Familiarity with RFQs, NSNs, part numbers, or industrial/aviation components



Background as a virtual assistant, procurement agent, or sourcing specialist



What We Offer



Long-term remote opportunity with a growing U.S. government contractor



Consistent workload and clear processes



Opportunity to grow with the company and take on more responsibility



Competitive compensation based on experience and performance



How to Apply



Please include:



A brief summary of your government contracting or sourcing experience



Your experience with cold calling and vendor negotiations



Your availability and preferred working hours



Only candidates with strong English communication skills and relevant sourcing experience will be considered.



Pay: $150 weekly pay. 6 Hours a day. Monday to Friday. 9 am to 3 PM New York Time Zone.

title: Real Estate Executive Assistant
description:
We are seeking a highly capable Executive Assistant / Operations & Project Coordinator to support a senior operator within a real estate development and construction environment. This is a high-impact role designed to create executive leverage by strengthening daily execution, improving coordination, and supporting the scaling of development and construction operations.



This is not a traditional administrative position. The role offers hands-on exposure to real estate development, construction workflows, and business operations, acting as a true right hand to leadership. The ideal candidate is proactive, highly organized, and comfortable operating across executive support, project coordination, and operational execution.



Responsibilities:



Executive & Operational Support

Manage executive calendars, scheduling, priorities, and daily workflows

Coordinate meetings, site visits, inspections, and travel logistics

Own follow-ups, handoffs, and action items to ensure consistent execution

Handle outbound communications with contractors, vendors, consultants, and service providers

Maintain visibility across active projects, deadlines, and commitments

Reduce operational friction across professional and personal logistics



Project & Construction Coordination

Support multiple development and construction projects simultaneously

Assist with contractor and vendor coordination, scheduling, and documentation

Track project timelines, milestones, and progress updates

Maintain organized project files, scopes, contracts, and communication records

Support permitting processes and preparation of submittal materials

Assist with basic design coordination, selections, and documentation as needed



Financial & Business Support

Support accounts payable and receivable tracking and invoice organization

Assist with project-level budget tracking and expense categorization

Help maintain accurate operational and financial records

Support drafting and organization of contracts, change orders, and invoicing documentation



Development & Analytical Support

Assist with underwriting and evaluation of new real estate opportunities

Support deal pipeline tracking, comps research, and projections

Help prepare internal and external summaries, reports, and updates

Conduct market and policy research related to development opportunities



Requirements:



3+ years of experience supporting an executive, founder, or operator in a fast-paced environment

Strong organizational skills with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through

Ability to coordinate across contractors, vendors, and multiple stakeholders

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

High ownership mindset with the ability to anticipate needs and solve problems proactively

Adaptable, resourceful, and able to remain calm under pressure

Strong interest in real estate development, construction, or operations preferred

Availability to support a remote executive team

title: Full-Time Copywriter
description:
I’m hiring a Copywriter who can help scale a platform where creators around the world buy and sell high-quality digital design assets, focusing on making design beautiful, effective, and accessible. This individual will turn that creative energy into clear, engaging copy across content, campaigns, and community-driven storytelling.



As a Copywriter, you’ll be responsible for:

- Reaching out to shop owners and crafting Behind the Shop interview articles that feel human, thoughtful, and design literate.

- Proofreading, editing, and publishing articles created in collaboration with shop owners and external contributors.

- Turning internal trend research and reports into accessible, editorial-style articles for our blog and channels.

- Writing release articles and press releases for new product launches and major platform updates.

- Updating SEO-prioritized blog articles, based on audit recommendations and flagging pieces to feature in
 campaigns.

- Drafting subject line variations to support
 performance and testing.

- Supporting ad hoc SEO copy needs across our platform, from category pages to evergreen content.



We believe it’s important for you to have:

- Proven experience as a copywriter, content writer, or editor. We’d love to work with someone who has experience with design, tech, or creator-focused platforms.

- Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal.

- A strong editorial instinct and the ability to write for both inspiration and clarity, switching comfortably between storytelling and utility.

- Comfort in collaborating asynchronously with marketers, designers, and community managers in a fast-moving environment.

- Experience applying SEO best practices without sacrificing voice, readability, or flow.

- Excellent editing and proofreading skills with a sharp eye for detail.

- Strong time management skills and the ability to juggle multiple work streams while meeting deadlines.

- Curiosity about design trends, creator culture, and how creative tools shape modern workflows.

- A thoughtful, reliable working style and pride in delivering polished work every time.



To apply:

- Attach your resume

- Attach a 1-minute video intro

- Portfolio or relevant marketing/design writing (mix of short + long)

- Attach a screenshot of your internet speed

- Include the answers to my questions below:

1.) Tell me about a piece of content you’ve written that you’re most proud of. What was the goal, who was the audience, and why did it work?

2.) Describe how you approach updating or refreshing an existing article or piece of copy to improve clarity, performance, or SEO while keeping the original voice intact.

3.) This role involves working asynchronously with marketers, designers, and community teams. How do you typically manage feedback, deadlines, and multiple workstreams in a fast-moving environment?



*** AI-assisted answers are okay, but keep it minimal. Make sure to follow the instructions when sending your application.

We are seeking a reliable and detail-oriented T2 Technical Support Engineer to support our client's customer base with platform-related inquiries and technical assistance. This role centers around helping customers get the most from our

- Familiarity with
 platforms, HTML/CSS for
s, and understanding of how content displays in different

title: Paid Advertising Specialist, Meta and TikTok
description:
Job Title: Paid Media and
 Marketing Specialist, Meta, TikTok, Klaviyo, HubSpot

Location: Remote, Philippines

Employment Type: Part time

Reporting To: Marketing Leadership



?



Position Overview



We are seeking a highly analytical and execution focused Paid Media and
 Marketing Specialist to manage customer acquisition across Meta and TikTok while supporting lifecycle marketing through Klaviyo and CRM visibility through HubSpot.



This role requires proven, real world experience in lowering customer acquisition cost, improving cost per lead, and driving measurable return on ad spend. The ideal candidate is data driven, organized, and capable of producing clear weekly reporting that connects advertising performance directly to revenue and pipeline inside the CRM.



?



Core Responsibilities



Paid Advertising Management, Meta and TikTok

 • Plan, launch, and optimize paid campaigns across Meta and TikTok

 • Demonstrate proven ability to reduce:

 • Customer acquisition cost

 • Cost per lead

 • Cost per review or conversion action

 • Build full funnel campaign structures including awareness, retargeting, and conversion

 • Conduct continuous creative, audience, and offer testing

 • Manage budget pacing and daily optimization to maximize return on ad spend

 • Ensure accurate attribution from click to revenue



 Marketing, Klaviyo

 • Build and manage automated flows:

 • Welcome sequence

 • Abandoned cart

 • Post purchase follow up

 • Review generation

 • Re engagement

 • Launch promotional campaigns aligned with paid media

 • Optimize segmentation, timing, and messaging

 • Monitor deliverability, open rate, click through rate, and revenue per recipient



CRM Integration and Tracking, HubSpot

 • Connect paid media and
 data into HubSpot for full funnel visibility

 • Ensure accurate lifecycle stage tracking from lead to customer

 • Maintain clean pipelines and attribution accuracy

 • Build dashboards showing acquisition cost, conversion rate, and revenue



Reporting, Communication, and KPI Ownership

 • Deliver structured weekly performance reports

 • Present testing roadmap and optimization plan

 • Maintain documentation of campaigns, creatives, and audiences

 • Own the KPI dashboard and ensure all metrics are current, accurate, and actionable



?



KPI Dashboard Requirement



The specialist must build and maintain a live KPI dashboard accessible to leadership at all times.



Dashboard Platform

 • Google Looker Studio, HubSpot dashboard, or equivalent real time reporting tool

 • Must auto update from:

 • Meta Ads

 • TikTok Ads

 • Klaviyo

 • HubSpot CRM



?



Core KPI Categories



Acquisition Metrics

 • Total ad spend by platform

 • Leads generated

 • Cost per lead

 • Customer acquisition cost

 • Conversion rate from lead to customer

 • Return on ad spend



Revenue Metrics

 • Revenue attributed to paid media

 • Revenue attributed to
 marketing

 • Average order value or deal value

 • Customer lifetime value when available



Funnel Health Metrics

 • Click through rate

 • Cost per click

 • Landing page conversion rate

 •
 open rate and click rate

 • Review generation rate or post purchase engagement



Efficiency and Scaling Indicators

 • Month over month CAC trend

 • Budget efficiency by campaign

 • Winning creatives and audiences

 • Scaling recommendations with projected ROI



?



Weekly KPI Deliverables



Every week the specialist must provide:

 1. Updated live dashboard with current data

 2. Written executive summary including:

 • What improved

 • What declined

 • Why it happened

 • What actions will be taken next week

 3. Testing roadmap for creatives, audiences, and offers

 4. Budget recommendation for scaling or reallocating spend



?



Required Qualifications

 • Proven hands on success running Meta and TikTok ads with measurable ROI

 • Demonstrated ability lowering CAC and CPL

 • Strong understanding of attribution, funnels, and conversion tracking

 • Direct Klaviyo automation and campaign experience

 • HubSpot CRM integration and reporting experience

 • Advanced analytical and reporting skills

 • Strong English communication and organization

 • Reliable internet and consistent part time availability



?



Preferred Qualifications

 • Experience with United States brands or agencies

 • Ecommerce or lead generation background

 • Performance creative testing knowledge

 • Ability to forecast scaling scenarios



?



Expected Weekly Deliverables

 • Active paid media optimization

 •
 campaign and automation management

 • Clean and accurate HubSpot CRM tracking

 • Fully updated KPI dashboard

 • One structured weekly performance report with insights and next actions



?



Compensation and Budget Guidance, Philippines Part Time

 • Typical monthly range:

 • Mid level: $600 to $1,000 USD

?



Application Requirements



Candidates must submit:

WhatsApp me
salary: $5 / an hour or more if qualified

title: Executive VA
description:
Are you a high-level professional who thrives on ownership, precision, and high-stakes execution? We aren’t looking for a "helper"—we are looking for a strategic partner to act as the backbone of our operations.

If you are a self-starter who solves problems before they reach the founder’s desk, keep reading. We have zero room for "snowflakes" or those who disappear when the pressure is on. We want a resilient, "A-Player" professional who takes pride in elite-level output.



The Requirements

To be considered for this role, you must meet the following non-negotiable criteria:

Education: Master’s Degree (or equivalent/higher).

Experience: Minimum of 5+ years in a high-level administrative or operational role.

Technical Mastery: Expert-level IT skills, including proficiency with AI tools to optimize workflow, and deep experience with the software listed below.

Personality: Extreme attention to detail, hyper-organized, and a "thick skin" for direct feedback and fast-paced environments.



Key Responsibilities

1. Finance & Bookkeeping

Full management of QuickBooks.

Accurately record receipts, raise invoices, and maintain a rigorous organization system for all financial documentation.

Bonus: Experience with full bank reconciliation.

2. HR & Operations Management

End-to-end recruitment: Sourcing, vetting, and interviewing new staff.

Performance management: Monitoring the team to ensure KPIs are met and projects stay on schedule.

Acting as the "enforcer" to ensure the founder’s vision is executed without delays.

3. Research & Data Analysis

Conducting deep-dive research into markets, competitors, or new software.

The ability to not just find data, but analyze it and present actionable insights.

4. Visual Design & Creative

Producing high-click-rate thumbnails using Canva or Photoshop.

Maintaining brand consistency across all digital assets.

Bonus: Proficiency in Video Editing (Premiere Pro, CapCut, etc.).



Skills & Tools

Category

Required Proficiency

Finance

QuickBooks, Expense Tracking

Management

Project Management Tools (Asana/ClickUp), HR Tech

Design

Canva, Photoshop

General

Advanced AI Prompting, Microsoft Office/Google Suite



How to Apply

We value professionals who follow instructions to the letter. Please start your application/cover letter with the phrase "Happy Days" so we know you have read this description in its entirety.

Note: We are looking for a long-term partner, not a freelancer juggling 10 different clients. If you are easily stressed or require constant hand-holding, this is not the role for you. If you are an A-Player who wants to be compensated for being the best, we want to talk.

title: Inventory Planner
description:
Come join our team to help us create better SKU-driven inventory demand forecast that best predicts future sales trends and maintains in-stock inventory. In this role, you would be responsible for solving the ongoing puzzle of ensuring our global supply chain is well stocked with profitable items that well serve evolving customer and industry trends. This position requires an individual who is a thoughtful, resourceful, positive communicator with a strong interest in data science and always-evolving analytics that also enjoys solving problems under his or her own initiative to help plan our global inventory needs.



Job Responsibilities:

> Utilize historical sales trend and weekly sell-thru reporting to develop and execute weekly demand planning for each of our global sales channels including brick-and-mortal retail, wholesale, and online eCommerce.

> Compile and review weekly reporting on sales performance and inventory distribution metrics.

Forecast and manage global inventory data to ensure all required stock level goals are regularly maintained.

> Manage excess & obsolete (E&O) inventory and propose action plans to mitigate risk, meet and exceed inventory health targets, and ensure maximum profitability.

> Analyze current warehouse capacity constraints and vendor order requirements such as lead-times and minimum order quantity to develop inventory purchasing forecasts.

> Assist the Accounting department with ongoing audits, inventory control, and reconciliations.

> Analyze performance of sales growth, eCommerce PPC campaigns, lead generation, and other advertising campaigns and suggest strategies for improvement based on your ongoing analysis of how these sales activities affect inventory sell-through and the global supply chain.

> Diagnose and assist with time sensitive issues relating to data errors and impact on sales trends.



Basic Requirements:

> Education: College degree in business, finance, data science, or related fields of study.

> At least 2 years experience in consumer goods demand planning or inventory/sales forecasting.

> Deep analytical skills and a strong problem-solving ability.

> Strong bias for action with ability to prioritize, multi-task, tenaciously follow-up, and meet > competing deadlines.

> Advanced skills in Microsoft Office including Excel (Advanced Formulas, Tables & Formatting, Conditional Formatting, Advanced Charting, Pivot tables & Pivot Reporting, VLOOKUP, etc).

> Excellent oral and written communication skills.

> Advanced analytical skills and attention to detail.



Accessory Power is a consumer electronics manufacturer dedicated to providing a diverse range of high quality products for over 30 years. We manufacture and market thousands of products under our four main brands: GOgroove® | ENHANCE® | ReVIVE® | USA Gear® along with a handful of other lines and various accessory products. We would love to grow together!



Visit 
/about to learn a little more about our incredible past and our bright future ahead.

title: Creative Manager (WordPress, Shopify, HTML/CSS)
description:
We’re a U.S.-based consulting and technology company with an international team. We build and manage websites, apps, and brands for clients across many industries. We’re looking for a Creative Manager who can both manage work and do the job.



This is not a junior role and not a social media job.



What You’ll Do

 • Manage and execute website projects from start to finish

 • Build and maintain WordPress and Shopify sites

 • Customize themes, fix layout issues, and improve performance

 • Work directly with internal teams and clients

 • Review and improve design and UX (clean, simple, professional)

 • Jump into HTML/CSS fixes without complaining ????



Required Skills

 • Strong WordPress experience (themes, plugins, troubleshooting)

 • Strong Shopify experience (themes, layout, basic customizations)

 • Solid HTML/CSS

 • Good eye for design and usability

 • Can manage multiple projects and hit deadlines

 • Clear written English and good communication



Nice to Have

 • JavaScript (intermediate or better)

 • Experience managing other designers or developers

 • SEO or performance optimization knowledge



This Role Is For You If

 • You can work independently without hand-holding

 • You take ownership and follow through

 • You enjoy fixing things instead of making excuses

 • You want a long-term, full-time role



This Role Is NOT For You If

 • You only do social media or Canva graphics

 • You need constant instructions

 • You’re looking for a short-term gig



Details

 • Long-term role

 • Remote

 • Competitive pay based on experience

title: Business Analyst / Project Delivery Manager
description:
We need a sharp, organized person who can take client requests, understand what they really mean, turn them into clear tasks, and drive delivery with our dev and QA teams. Your job is to keep projects moving, remove confusion, and make sure what we ship matches what was requested.



What You’ll Do



Review client requests 
, tickets, calls) and identify missing details

Ask the right follow-up questions to remove ambiguity (no guessing, no “we’ll figure it out later”)

Turn requests into clear requirements and tickets (acceptance criteria, edge cases, examples)

Break work into deliverable steps and keep scope under control

Coordinate with developers and QA to ensure the work is built, tested, and delivered correctly

Run day-to-day delivery: status updates, priorities, blockers, timelines, and handoffs

Make sure QA has what they need: test notes, expected results, and “what done looks like”

Confirm fixes with the client (or internal owner) and close the loop cleanly

Keep our tools clean and current (tickets updated, notes added, no ghost tasks)



Project Types You’ll Manage



Simple WordPress websites (content sites, small business sites, landing pages)

Shopify stores (theme work, apps, checkout flows, product/catalog updates)

Custom software development (web apps, integrations, internal tools, APIs)



What “Good” Looks Like (Success Metrics)



Fewer back-and-forth messages due to unclear requirements

Tickets have clear acceptance criteria and don’t get reopened for “not what we meant.”

Dev + QA always know what to work on next

Projects move forward weekly with visible progress

Clients feel informed, not surprised



Skills & Experience



Strong written English (you can write clear, simple requirements)

Great at asking clarifying questions without annoying people

Comfortable working with developers and QA daily

Can manage multiple projects without dropping balls

Understands basic web/software concepts (APIs, UI/UX basics, environments, bugs vs features)

Experience with project tools like Redmine, Jira, Trello, ClickUp, etc. (we currently use Redmine/OSTicket/HubStaff)



Nice to Have



Experience in an agency or outsourced delivery environment

Light QA background (writing test cases, reproducing bugs)

Familiar with hosting / WordPress / Shopify / custom web apps

Experience writing SOPs and improving processes



Work Style



Remote

Part-time to start. Full-time in the near future.

You’ll work with a distributed team across time zones (company operations on New York time)

You must be responsive during agreed working hours and proactive about follow-ups



Kindly attach your résumé when submitting your application.

title: Attorney
description:
We are looking for an attorney with experience in drafting estate planning documents and deeds.  You would be joining a high-performing, collaborative team where your contributions truly matter and make a difference in people’s lives.



Key responsibilities:

- Draft deeds, Wills, Powers of Attorney, and Trusts.

- Communicate with local county offices to gather real estate information to prepare deeds.  



Requirements:

- Extensive knowledge and experience in drafting estate planning documents and deeds.

- Excellent communication skills.

- Ability to be a team player and follow procedures.

- Interact with tea
mbers and attorneys when needed.

- Excellent organizational skills.

- Must have high attention to detail and accuracy.

- Commitment to maintain confidentiality and ethical standards.

- Proficiency with Microsoft Office, specifically Outlook, Word and Excel, as well as Adobe Acrobat.



Why Join Us?

- We are a collaborative and mission-driven team.  Each tea
mber is highly respected and an integral part of the work we do.

- You will be provided with training, mentorship and ongoing support. 

- Long-term, stable, full-time role with growth potential.



How to Apply:

Send the following information in an
 to 

- Your resume

- A short cover letter explaining your experience.  In your cover letter, please include the word tree in the subject line  

- A quick video introduction

- Your salary expectations

title: Website Developer (WooCommerce & Shopify / Elementor & Figma)
description:
Rare Blue Moon Marketing is a fast-growing US-based digital marketing agency delivering innovative, high-performing digital solutions. We're seeking a talented and detail-oriented Website Developer with expertise in eCommerce and front-end design to join our team for exciting client projects.



If you're passionate about building responsive, visually stunning websites that convert visitors into customers—and are highly responsive during work hours—we want to hear from you!



--- What You'll Do: ---



- Develop and maintain custom WordPress and Shopify websites using Elementor and WooCommerce

- Build and manage landing pages, funnels, and website components inside GoHighLevel (GHL)

- Implement Figma designs into fully functional websites with pixel-perfect accuracy

- Write clean, maintainable CSS to customize site layouts, animations, and visual elements

- Collaborate with designers, marketers, and developers to ensure smooth project execution

- Optimize websites for usability, performance, and responsiveness across devices

- Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to WordPress, WooCommerce, or Shopify



--- Requirements: ---



- Strong CSS coding skills and experience with responsive design

- Proficiency in GoHighLevel (GHL), including funnel setup, website pages, and integrations

- Proven experience in WooCommerce and Shopify development

- Expertise in Figma design implementation

- Proficiency in Elementor and WordPress theme customization

- Highly responsive during shifts and able to communicate clearly in English

- Able to work 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM Eastern Time with a 1-hour unpaid break (8 hours total)

- Strong attention to detail, problem-solving skills, and ability to work independently

- Portfolio or examples of past website projects



--- Bonus Points For: ---



- Knowledge of SEO best practices

- Experience working with GoHighLevel (GHL)

- Familiarity with Advanced Custom Fields (ACF)

- Basic graphic design skills



--- Application Instructions ---



Important: Applications must be submitted directly via OnlineJobs.ph.



Subject Line: Website Developer – [Your Full Name]



Please include:



- Your OnlineJobs.ph profile link

- Portfolio of websites you’ve developed (live links preferred)

- Gmail
 address

- (Optional) Short Loom/video introduction



We’re excited to find a skilled developer who can deliver high-quality websites while being highly responsive during their shift. Join Rare Blue Moon Marketing and help us take our projects to the next level!



Best,

Rare Blue Moon Marketing Team

title: Real Estate Photo Editor/Quality Control
description:
We are seeking an individual who thrives in a collaborative team environment, demonstrates enthusiasm, and takes initiative. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to provide effective solutions are essential. The ideal candidate should be organized and capable of enhancing our existing systems.



Responsibilities:

Primary responsibility involves meticulously reviewing each image received from our editing house, ensuring consistency and adherence to our brand standards. This entails identifying mistakes or inconsistencies in the editing process to maintain a unified visual style.



If content falls short of our brand standards, the candidate will be required to either send it back with revision requests or make necessary adjustments, including exposure, color correction, cropping, and other enhancements, to ensure a professional and appealing look.



Proficiency in photo editing software such as Adobe Photoshop and Lightroom is a must. A solid understanding of various editing techniques and tools available in these programs is expected.



Effective communication and collaboration with photographers and the scheduling team are crucial. The candidate will closely work with them to comprehend clients' specific requirements, ensuring that the final images align with their vision.



Management and prioritization of a substantial volume of images within tight deadlines is a key responsibility. The candidate should employ efficient workflows and demonstrate strong time management skills to complete editing tasks punctually.



A keen eye for detail is indispensable in identifying and rectifying imperfections or inconsistencies in the images.



Maintenance of an organized file structure and the use of proper naming conventions for edited images are critical. This facilitates easy access, retrieval, and sharing of files with both clients and tea
mbers.



Reach out to clients in a timely manner and effectively response to clients' revision requests is vital for ensuring customer satisfaction.



Required Experience:

Virtual Staging

Proficient in Photoshop and Lightroom

Exposure blending

Luminosity masks

Layer masking

Color correction and grading

Sky replacement

Virtual dusk

--

Tuesday - Saturday 6am-2pm EST

Dont forget to send link of your CVs and  your portfolio. Other candidate forgets that. So dont miss it! :)



In your message  write "I bring magic" in the first sentence of your application letter. This will be our identifier that you have completely read our job post up to the end because we are seeking for the someone who is very keen to details.

title: Elite Recruiter Role — Only the Best Need Apply — U.S.-Based — $1,200–$1,800 Base + Bonuses
description:
Are you the type of person who refuses to settle? Do you believe you belong at the top — not by luck, but by skill, drive, and results?



We’re hiring for an elite recruiter role in the U.S. executive search industry. This is a phone-based, relationship-driven career — not a project, not a gig, not basic sourcing. You’ll be working with a U.S. search firm that places senior-level talent in construction and infrastructure.



We don’t use job boards. We don’t take shortcuts. This is about building trust with passive candidates — people who aren't looking, but will take your call if you know how to connect with them.



You'll be trained to:

• Make high-volume outbound calls to U.S. professionals

• Build rapport fast — even with people who say “I’m not looking”

• Ask the right questions to uncover hidden career motivations

• Turn cold conversations into warm leads and eventual placements



This is a long-term opportunity with massive upside — if you’re the right fit.



Must-Haves:

• Excellent spoken and written English

• Strong phone confidence

• Experience engaging passive candidates (not just active job seekers)

• Comfortable calling U.S. professionals and working PH night shift

• Reliable internet, backup power, and a quiet home workspace

• Comfortable making a high volume of daily calls to professionals who may not be actively job seeking (cold-calling experience a plus)



Nice-to-Haves:

• Experience with executive search or high-end recruiting

• Familiarity with tools like LinkedIn, ZoomInfo, CRMs, and job boards

• Experience working with U.S.-based teams or staffing firms



What We Offer:

• Competitive salary + bonuses

• Long-term full-time work (not project-based)

• Full training + scripts + tools

• Elite team culture: growth, accountability, and real career upside



We don’t train everyone. We train the elite — like the PMA trains its leaders.



If you think you have what it takes, apply now.



Bonus: Leave a 1–2 minute voice or video recording telling us why you're a great fit. Candidates who do will be prioritized.

title: Shopify / Web Design / Programming
description:
Shopify / Web Design / Programming





As a young, family-run company, we focus on customer communication at eye level. We take the wishes and opinions of our customers extremely seriously and always try to incorporate criticism into our products in order to optimize and perfect them step by step. We do not stand for mass, but for class! Together with our outdoor friends we would like to grow and become even better in the future. Maybe you are the person who wants to support us on this way!



These are some of your tasks if you want to support us as a Team bro in the area of web design / programming:



- Implementation of design changes within our store

- Implementation of new tools & functions on our store page

- Programming of tools, which contribute to the improvement of the conversion rate and improve the user-friendliness of the page

- Co-conception / co-creation of improvements on the store page

- Building interfaces between our different marketplaces

- Creation of various graphics

- Close, daily, fast and reliable exchange / coordination with the marketing manager and the owner



What you should bring with you:



- Experience with Shopify

- Experience with various programming languages

- Excellent knowledge in the field of shopify / web design / programming

- Interest in the activities of an e-commerce company

- Many years of professional experience

- Communication skills, ability to work in a team (work is done completely digitally, nevertheless a high quality exchange via certain tools is essential)

- Fast and at the same time high quality way of doing tasks

- Free capacities / max. 10 hours per week

- reliability

- Quick availability between Monday and Friday



You think you are perfect for the advertised position? Then we look forward to hearing from you by e-mail. Please send your complete application documents.



Thank you, 



Phil

title: Senior Amazon VA with UK experience
description:
Job Opportunity: Experienced Amazon Virtual Assistant (VA) – Full-Time (UK Hours)



We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced Amazon VA to join our existing team to help manage our Amazon UK store. If you have a strong background in Amazon Seller Central, account management, and e-commerce best practices we’d love to hear from you.



What We’re Offering



Full-time position (40 hours per week)

UK working hours: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM

Time tracking via Time Doctor

Long-term opportunity with a UK-based company



What We’re Looking For

Essential Skills & Experience



4+ years as an Amazon VA, with proven success managing Amazon FBA stores

Strong understanding of Amazon Seller Central and compliance requirements

Proficiency in Microsoft Excel

Excellent written and spoken English

Ability to work independently and handle multiple priorities

Strong attention to detail, problem-solving skills, and time management

Experience in team coordination and self-management



Nice-to-Haves



Familiarity with Shopify and social media management

Proficient in Amazon PPC 





Key Responsibilities



Amazon Seller Central & Administration

Manage account health and performance metrics

Monitor reports, analyse data, and recommend strategies to increase sales

Raise and follow up on cases with Seller Support to resolve issues

Ensure compliance with Amazon’s policies and maintain excellent seller ratings

Generate and analyse weekly, monthly, and annual reports

Retrieve supplier invoices for VAT returns



SEO & PPC



Conduct ongoing Amazon SEO research and optimisation

Manage and optimise Amazon PPC campaigns

Leverage tools like Helium 10 for insights and growth

Product Development & Listings

Research market trends and identify opportunities for new products

Launch and manage new product performance

Create and optimise listings (titles, bullet points, descriptions)

Enhance listings with A+ Content and improved product imagery ( canva)



How to Apply



If you’re passionate about e-commerce and have the skills we’re looking for, please send your CV as part of the initial screening process. As part of your application include the phrase 'Today is a great day' in the subject title of your application in addition to providing your CV when you reply,  so we know you have read this entire job advert. If these instructions are not followed, your application will be ignored.



Successful applicants will be invited to progress through our interview stage.

After this, there will be a 1 month trial where you will be going through a paid evaluation before a formal permanent job offer is made based on your performance.

description:

 & Communication Management (25%)

eting notes

title: Real Estate Administrative VA
description:
Job Overview:

We are a real estate company looking for a detail-oriented Property Management Administrative Assistant to provide vital support for our property management operations in the Virginia Beach area. This part-time remote position is primarily focused on managing maintenance requests, coordinating with vendors, and handling property-related administrative tasks using the AppFolio CRM, with secondary responsibilities supporting real estate lead generation efforts.



Key Responsibilities:



Primary Focus - Property Management Administration (80%):

-Manage maintenance requests and work orders through AppFolio CRM

-Coordinate with vendors and contractors for property maintenance and repairs

-Schedule and follow up on maintenance appointments to ensure completion

-Communicate with tenants via AppFolio messaging and WhatsApp

-Process and track all maintenance-related documentation

-Maintain organized records of property management activities

-Handle day-to-day administrative tasks for property operations

-Respond to urgent maintenance requests during and after business hours (on-call availability)





Secondary Focus - Real Estate Lead Support (20%):

-Assist with marketing efforts for property listings

-Support lead conversion activities via GoHighLevel (training provided)

-Manage communication with potential clients and tenants



Mandatory Requirements:

-Basic experience with AppFolio CRM, specifically for maintenance management and communication

-Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

-Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

-Proactive problem-solving ability and the capacity to manage unexpected situations

-Comfortable working in a fast-paced real estate environment

-Reliable internet connection and professional home office setup

-Availability for emergency maintenance issues outside regular business hours (weekends/evenings - paid separately)



Preferred Skills:

-Prior experience in property management or real estate administration

-Familiarity with GoHighLevel platform

-Experience using WhatsApp for business communication

-Knowledge of maintenance coordination and vendor management

-Ability to handle multiple urgent requests simultaneously



Why Join Us?

-Work with a well-established full-service real estate and property management company

-Gain valuable experience in the US property management industry

-Collaborate with a professional team serving the Hampton Roads region

-Flexible remote work arrangement with set core hours

-Opportunity to develop skills in both property management and real estate operations



If you have AppFolio experience and thrive in a dynamic property management environment, we encourage you to apply and become a key member of our team!

title: Credit Repair Lead Sales
description:
This position offers a commission for sales on top of the base pay. Commission is 5% of every sell made directly by you!



The initial setup fee is $249.99 USD for our month to month. thats $12.49 USD for one sale. If we run a promotion the same rule applies based on the promotional value.

We have flat rate options as well which is our 6 month plan $600 USD commission is $30 USD and 12 month plan $800 USD commission is $40 USD. 



I am looking for someone with a background in credit repair. This is a sales position which requires knowledge in understanding how to convert leads into clients. We use ads in order to drive our audience to our DM's in which we begin the conversation about our services. Some phone conversations may be required however we rely on DM communication and having a strong sense of understanding the process of credit repair and following up with leads manualy.



The ideal candidate is organized, confident in reading and interpreting credit reports, and capable of identifying opportunities based on a prospect’s credit profile and stated financial goals. You must be able to read a credit report thoroughly and identify negative items and positive items. You must have an understanding on what a potential prospect can do in order to build their credit based on their profile. This role is performance based with a  expected conversion rate of 30?sed on conversations.



This position begins with a 30 day probation period to evaluate performance, consistency, and overall fit, with clear opportunities for long term growth within the company.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Follow up with warm leads via direct messages on
 and Instagram

Convert conversations into enrollments using a consultative sales approach

Review and interpret consumer credit reports to identify service opportunities

Educate prospects on credit repair solutions clearly and ethically

Maintain accurate lead tracking and follow up sequences within CRM systems

Schedule calls when necessary and close sales via phone

Communicate with internal teams using Slack and ClickUp

Track daily activity, objections, conversions, and outcomes



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Proven sales experience with an understanding of conversion based communication

Working knowledge of credit reports including collections, charge offs, late payments, utilization, and inquiries

Ability to confidently recommend services based on credit analysis

Strong organizational and follow up skills

Comfortable communicating through direct messages and phone calls

Professional written and verbal communication skills



TOOLS AND PLATFORMS USED:

GoHighLevel

Client Dispute Manager

 and Meta Business Suite

Slack

ClickUp



PERFORMANCE EXPECTATIONS:

Maintain a minimum conversion rate of 30?monstrate consistent follow up and accurate CRM tracking

Represent the brand professionally and ethically at all times

Show measurable improvement in engagement and enrollment metrics during the trial period



Probation PERIOD:

30 evaluation period with performance review upon completion



WHO THIS ROLE IS FOR:

This role is ideal for someone who values structure, understands the psychology behind effective sales, and takes ownership of their results. We are seeking a candidate who is committed to growth, consistency, and producing measurable outcomes within the credit repair space. It's important that you show up on time and are very proactive. This position is for someone who is capable of taking ownership in this position and developing structured follow up systems in order to excell.

title: Website Lead Generation & Appointment Setter
description:

•Would you like to work at a company with advancement opportunities where you can spend your whole career?
