title: Commercial Project Manager
description:
Work Hours: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM US EST (9:00 PM - 6:00 AM Philippine Time) 



Berks Construction Group (BCG) is seeking skilled Construction Project Managers to join our dynamic team and make a lasting impact in the construction industry. This position is 100% remote from the Philippines, with work hours from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM US EST.



Position Summary:

The Construction Project Manager oversees construction projects from planning through completion while working remotely. This role requires close coordination with BCG’s (Our Corporate Office), architects, subcontractors, and clients to ensure projects are delivered in alignment with design intent, schedules, and budget requirements.



Compensation for this role is negotiable, and the company is looking for an expert in construction project management. Only candidates with extensive experience should apply, as the pay scale is designed to reward expertise and dedication. While a background in engineering is preferred, it is essential to be highly proficient in reading construction plans and conducting quantity estimates and takeoffs. The salary range is from $1000 to a maximum of $1800 a month, contingent upon relevant experience—candidates with at least ten years of experience and native-level English proficiency will qualify for the higher end of the pay scale.



The ideal candidate will excel in construction management responsibilities, including managing RFI and submittal logs, RFP/RFQ logs, vendor communication, document creation, word processing, scheduling, and utilizing software such as Procore, Microsoft Project, etc. Attention to detail and diligence are paramount. The successful candidate must be organized and persistent, with a strong understanding of the demands of successfully managing a commercial construction project.



About Us:

Join Berks Construction Group (BCG), a leading U.S.-based commercial construction company with Offices in in the following states: New Jersey, Pennsylvania and Ohio, which is the Northeast area of the united State. BCG is known for our commitment to excellence in building retail stores, restaurants, childcare facilities, and sports venues such as swim schools and rock-climbing centers.



For over 10 years, we have proudly partnered with Filipino professionals, currently employing 20 + talented Filipino individuals who contribute significantly to our success. Many of our Filipino tea
mbers have been with us for 5-7 years, with almost half celebrating more than 10 years with BCG.

At Berks Construction Group, we believe in creating a supportive work environment where our employees can thrive and develop their careers. We are committed to helping our teams support their families and realize their professional dreams.



Job Responsibilities: 

• Manage construction activities, including budgeting, scheduling, and progress reporting.

• Coordinate with architects to support design development and construction execution.

• Ensure compliance with applicable building codes, safety regulations, and company standards.

• Review site progress through reports, photos, video updates, and virtual meetings.

• Oversee subcontractor coordination, procurement, and documentation.

• Identify and resolve project issues to maintain cost control and schedule adherence.

• Estimate and takeoffs.

• Send RFQs and RFPs to vendors and subcontractors, following up on pricing before deadlines.

• Use online platforms to solicit bids from vendors.

• Work independently to determine pricing sources for different specialty items and obtain the best prices.

• Prepare submittals and manage data sheets.

• Manage RFI and Submittal Logs.

• Create and maintain project schedules.

• Conduct budget analysis.

• Perform ordering and material quantity takeoffs.

• Write safety plans and other internal documentation, such as the employee handbook.

• Prepare change order letters and other documents as needed, placing them on letterhead and creating PDFs.

• Utilize Procore software (training provided).



Requirements: 

• Preferred background in engineering or architecture, with experience working for U.S.-based firms.

• Must speak excellent English.

• Must have exceptional technical reading and writing skills in English.

• Must be able to read and understand blueprints at an expert level.

• Must be comfortable interpreting specifications.

• Must be patient, quick-thinking, organized, and able to work well under pressure to manage tasks and deadlines.



Apply Now:

If you are looking for a fulfilling career with a company that cares about your future and your family's well-being, send your resume and cover letter.

title: Full-time Google Ads and Tracking Specialist
description:
About the role



I’m hiring a full-time Google Ads & Tracking Specialist to join my performance marketing agency. We manage Google Ads and Meta Ads accounts for a range of service-based and eCommerce clients, and we operate both on and off Fiverr.



You’ll be working Monday–Friday, 9:00 AM–5:00 PM UK time, handling client delivery and collaborating with a small team of three (including me).





**Team structure**

Thania — handles customer communication and internal coordination



Lia — Senior Google Ads & Tracking Specialist (technical lead)



Me — Senior Google Ads & Tracking Specialist; strategy, growth, client oversight



You’ll work closely with Lia on builds, troubleshooting, and best-practice setups.





**What you’ll be responsible for**

Google Ads campaign setup & management



Build and launch Google Ads campaigns (Search, Performance Max, Display/Remarketing as needed)



Do keyword research, structure ad groups, write/implement ad copy, set up assets and extensions



Set budgets, bidding strategies, audiences, locations, schedules, and conversion goals



Perform ongoing optimisation (search terms, negatives, bid adjustments, asset improvements)



Produce clear updates on performance and next steps



Tracking, measurement & troubleshooting



Configure and troubleshoot tracking via Google Tag Manager (GTM) and GA4



Set up and validate conversions (forms, calls, purchases, lead events, etc.)



Ensure conversion accuracy and clean data flow into Google Ads



Debug issues (missing parameters, duplicate events, incorrect attribution, consent mode issues where relevant)



Quality control & internal collaboration



Follow internal SOPs and deliver clean handoffs to the team



Document setups and changes so the team can support accounts smoothly



Coordinate with Thania (client requests) and Lia (technical review + best practices)





**Required skills & experience**

Strong hands-on experience setting up and optimising Google Ads campaigns



Strong understanding of GA4 + GTM setup and debugging



Proven ability to create accurate conversion tracking (leads and/or eCommerce)



Confident communicating progress and blockers internally



Comfortable working at pace and switching between multiple client accounts





**Nice to have**

Experience with Meta Ads



Looker Studio reporting



Shopify / WooCommerce tracking experience



Call tracking setup (CallRail or similar)





**Working hours & expectations**

Full-time: 9:00 AM–5:00 PM UK time (Mon–Fri)



You’ll be handling live client projects, so reliability and responsiveness during these hours is essential.





**Hiring timeline**

I’m interviewing candidates this week and plan to make a decision quickly.





**How to apply (mandatory)**

Please reply with:



A 30-second video introduction of yourself. Who you are and what you’re best at.

title: Inbound Customer Service VA
description:
Position Summary



We’re looking for a reliable and well-spoken Customer Support Representative to handle inbound calls from clients and potential customers. You’ll address inquiries, guide leads through our internal systems, and ensure every interaction is handled professionally and positively. This role suits someone who is tech-savvy, steady under pressure, and comfortable with flexible or shifting work schedules.



Main Responsibilities



 – Handle inbound calls with a confident, friendly, and professional approach

 – Follow provided scripts while accurately entering caller details into the CRM

 – Schedule jobs quickly based on customer needs, giving priority to urgent or emergency cases

 – Adjust tone and pacing to match the caller’s mood and situation

 – Use local knowledge and postcode familiarity to maintain a natural, location-aware conversation

 – Coordinate with internal teams when necessary and escalate issues when required

 – Participate in ongoing training sessions and performance reviews



Required Skills



 – Clear, fluent English with a neutral or soft accent

 – Strong listening and communication skills

 – Ability to remain calm and effective during high-pressure or emotional situations

 – Strong attention to detail and consistency in following procedures

 – Comfortable with CRM systems, call handling tools, and team communication platforms

 – Dependable work ethic, consistent attendance, and openness to coaching



Preferred Qualifications



 – Previous experience in inbound customer service, dispatch, or call center environments

 – Familiarity with lead tracking and CRM software

 – Knowledge of UK or international postcode formats and area names

 – Quick to learn new tools and adapt to updated processes

 – Experience handling urgent or sensitive service inquiries



Technical Setup Needed



 – Reliable primary internet connection (minimum 25 Mbps recommended)

 – Backup internet option (e.g., pocket Wi-Fi or secondary provider)

 – Backup power source (UPS or generator) to avoid service interruptions

 – Personal laptop or desktop computer

 – High-quality noise-cancelling headset

 – Quiet, distraction-free workspace



Why You’ll Love This Role



Be part of a remote team where professionalism and clear communication are valued. You’ll receive structured scripts, ongoing training, and work in a no cold-calling environment, allowing you to focus on providing exceptional service. This role offers the chance to develop your skills in customer interaction and service coordination while working in a supportive, improvement-focused setting.

title: Senior Operations Manager
description:
Job Overview

Required Skills:

-Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple requests simultaneously

-Excellent written English and professional communication skills

-High attention to detail and experience working with structured workflows

-Proficiency in using spreadsheets, trackers, and collaboration tools (e.g., Teams,
)

-Ability to prioritize tasks, follow up, and keep projects moving with minimal supervision

Preferred Skills:



-Experience with Smartsheet (or similar tools like Asana, 
, Trello, Jira)

-Experience supporting creative teams (design, motion, marketing, production)

Why Join Us?

You will play a pivotal role in keeping creative projects organized and on track, gaining hands-on experience working closely with a creative team in a structured, high-output environment.

title: VSL Video Editor — DTC Wellness Brand
description:
We’re looking for a skilled video editor to join our growing DTC wellness brand. You’ll create engaging Video Sales Letters (VSLs) for paid social advertising on Meta and TikTok. These are 3–6 minute vertical videos combining UGC clips, b-roll, text overlays, captions, voiceover, and music - designed to stop the scroll and drive purchases.



What You’ll Do:

Edit 4 - 6 VSLs per month (3 - 5 minute videos)

Create 4 different hook variations per VSL (different opening visuals + captions for the first 3–5 seconds, same body)

Follow provided scripts and reference videos (we’ll give you examples to model)

Add captions, text overlays, transitions, and motion graphics (composite overlays, split-screen layouts, animated icons, glow effects)

Generate AI b-roll using Higgsfield AI or similar tools (product scenes, cinematic visuals, medical visualizations) and composite them into the edit

Sync voiceover with visuals and add background music



Must-Haves:

2+ years of video editing experience (VSL or direct-response ads preferred)

Proficient in Premiere Pro,  Final Cut Pro, or nay of your choice

Strong sense of pacing, storytelling, and visual engagement

Reliable internet (100Mbps+) and own editing equipment

Available for 20 hours/week with potential to go full-time

Responsive communication (reply within 4 hours during working hours)

Experience with AI video generation tools (Higgsfield AI, Kling, Sora) for creating b-roll and product scenes from prompts



Nice-to-Haves:

Experience editing for health/wellness or e-commerce brands

After Effects skills for motion graphics

Understanding of Meta Ads / TikTok creative best practices

Portfolio of AI-generated video clips showing strong prompting ability (Higgsfield, Kling, Runway, etc.)



Compensation

Starting at $800–$1,000/month part-time (20 hrs/wk), with path to full-time at $1,500–$2,500/month. Performance bonuses for ads that scale.



To Apply

Please include: (1) Your portfolio or reel with at least 2 VSL/ad examples, (2) A 2-minute Loom video introducing yourself and walking through your best VSL edit, (3) What editing software you use and your typical turnaround time, (4) Any examples of AI-generated video clips you’ve created (Higgsfield, Kling, Sora, Runway, etc.)

title: Shopify Web Developer - CRO Specialist - Ecommerce Advertising Agency - Full Time 5a
description:
APPLY ON MY WEBSITE TO BE CONSIDERED: 





CRO Shopify Web Developer – Job Overview

I am looking for an experienced shopify web developer to help me upgrade client’s checkout processes and execute CRO tests for various ecommerce brands.

In this role you will update Shopify theme templates, develop landing pages using various page builders and html/CSS frameworks, research/install various checkout/bundle applications, and implement A/B tests using testing tools like intelligems.

You will also report on test performance, and provide suggestions for next steps.

This is a full-time opportunity. Training will be provided and you will work directly with me.



About Zack Miller

My name is Zack Miller, and I’ve been a DTC Ecommerce Growth Marketer since 2019. I’ve done everything fro
dia buying and client strategy, to agency internal operations.

I’ve contributed to the growth of over 200 ecommerce brands in my agency experience. Now, as an independent growth marketing partner, I work closely with a small number of brands on their new customer acquisition strategy.



Note: All Remote Employees Must Be Available To Work During The Following Business Hours:

Monday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Tuesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Wednesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Thursday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Friday: 9am – 5:30pm EST



Roles & Responsibilities

- Develop landing pages using Figma and various WYSYWIG editors including but not limited to Replo and Pagefly.

- Edit product, collection and other page templates using Shopify Liquid template engine, and various HTML/CSS frameworks.

- Install various checkout/tracking applications (aftersell, Zipify OCU, Upstack, etc)

- Install various applications for product bundling when needed, and create product bundles. 

- Install tracking pixels on client’s websites

- Implement A/B tests in intelligems for product price tests, shipping price tests, theme tests, landing page tests, and more. 

- Research new ideas for direct response content marketing strategies.

- Work in my project management system, ClickUp.

- Apply a process-first mentality and provide feedback to help further develop our operating systems.



Required Experience & Education

- Strong verbal and written English language skills (American Dialect)

- Strong knowledge of HTML/CSS/Javascript/Shopify Liquid required. 

- Knowledge of Python and Ruby preferred but not required.

- 1+ years of web development (Shopify) experience required

- 1+ years of backend python (flask/django) development experience preferred but not required

- 1+ years of marketing agency experience preferred but not required

- Must be highly organized and possess strong attention to detail

- All applicants are encouraged to apply, regardless of experience or education



APPLY ON MY WEBSITE TO BE CONSIDERED:

title: YouTube Production Coordinator (AI Operations)
description:
We are a high-volume media company running multiple YouTube channels. We are NOT looking for a creative writer. We are looking for an organized "Operator" to run our production line.



If you are a creative writer who wants to write your own stories, DO NOT APPLY.

If you are a highly organized Project Manager who loves AI tools, checklists, and hitting deadlines, this is for you.



YOUR ROLE:

You will be the "Engine" of our production. You will take ideas, turn them into assets using our AI tools, and manage our team of editors to ensure videos are finished on time.



SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES:

1. AI Script Generation (Daily):

   - You will take approved topics from our Trello board.

   - You will use our specific "Prompt Guide" and Claude AI to generate scripts.

   - You will compile the script sections into Google Docs. (No creative writing required, just precise execution of our system).



2. Voiceover Generation:

   - You will use our TTS tool to generate voiceovers.

   - You will check our 
 "Pinned Messages" to ensure you use the correct Voice ID and settings for each channel.

   - You will audit the audio files to ensure no glitches before sending them to editors.



3. Production Management (Trello & 
):

   - You will assign the Script and Voiceover to our Editors and Thumbnail Designers on Trello.

   - You will ensure the Designer knows which script to follow for the thumbnail.

   - You are responsible for the deadline. You must message editors on 
 daily. If they are late, you chase them.



4. Quality Control & Uploading:

   - When an editor submits a video, you check it using our checklist.

   - If it passes, you upload it to YouTube using our Templates.

   - If it fails, you tag the editor for revisions.



REQUIREMENTS:

- EXTREMELY ORGANIZED: You will manage 5 channels. You must never lose a file or forget to tag a tea
mber.

- TECH SAVVY: You must be comfortable using Trello, 
, Google Drive, and learning new AI tools quickly.

- FAST INTERNET: You will be uploading large video files to YouTube. Slow internet will not work.

- HIGH AVAILABILITY: You need to be online during your shift to unblock editors if they have questions.



HOW TO APPLY (Strict Instructions):

We entirely ignore generic AI written applications. To be considered, you must follow these 3 steps exactly:



1. Record a 60-second LOOM video (screen recording) of your desktop.

   - In the video, show me how you currently organize your files or your daily to-do list. I want to see that you are tidy and organized.

   - Speak in the video so I can hear your microphone quality/English level.

2. In your application or loom video, you must include a screenshot of your internet speed test or show it when recording.

3. Make the Subject Line of your application: "FACTORY OPERATOR - [Your Favorite Color]"



If you do not include the Loom video or the specific subject line, your application will be archived immediately.

title: Shopify Store Builder (Google compliant)
description:
ABOUT THE COMPANY



BJ-Ecom B.V. is a fast-growing e-commerce company running multiple Shopify stores across Europe and North America. We're a fully remote team of 20+ people, and we're scaling fast toward 2026.



We need someone who can build the foundation of every store we launch — accurately, consistently, and on schedule.



-----



THE ROLE



This is NOT a general Shopify, CRO, or marketing role.



Your one job: Build new Shopify stores from scratch that are 100% ready for Google Merchant Center (GMC) approval.



You'll use our templates, SOPs, and checklists. You'll build 5-7 stores per week. Every store must be compliant, complete, and error-free.



If you love structured work and take pride in getting every detail right, this role is for you.



-----



WHAT YOU'LL DO



- Build new Shopify stores from scratch using our templates

- Set up store structure, pages, navigation, policies, and settings based on our checklists

- Ensure every store meets Google Merchant Center requirements

- Prepare stores for GMC submission with zero missing elements

- Follow SOPs exactly and document your work

- Run quality checks before handing off each store



-----



WHO WE'RE LOOKING FOR



- You're extremely detail-oriented — you catch mistakes others miss

- You follow instructions, templates, and checklists precisely

- You're fast, but never at the cost of accuracy

- You work well independently in a remote setup



-----



REQUIREMENTS



- Experience setting up Shopify stores from scratch

- Strong knowledge of Shopify settings, pages, policies, and structure

- Familiarity with Google Merchant Center requirements

- Ability to deliver error-free work consistently and at scale



-----



PERFORMANCE EXPECTATIONS



- 5-7 fully built Shopify stores per week

- Every store passes internal compliance checks

- Every store is GMC submission-ready with no issues



-----



WHAT WE OFFER



- 100% remote position

- Long-term work with a growing company

- Competitive pay based on experience and performance



-----



HOW TO APPLY



Please include:



1. Brief motivation letter

2. A short note on why detail-oriented, structured work suits you

3. Examples of Shopify stores you've built that are GMC compliant

4. Your expected salary (monthly, in PHP or USD)



-----



If you enjoy building things correctly, consistently, and by the book — we want to hear from you.

title: Copywriter / Content Creator - AI and Crypto (X-First)
description:
We’re looking for an AI & Crypto Copywriter/Content creator who can turn raw research, market noise, and half-formed ideas into clear, high-signal content.



This is not a “write threads all day and chase likes” role. This is about building credibility, network, and inbound opportunities through smart content.



If you live on 
, understand narratives before they trend, and can write without sounding like a bot or a shill, keep reading.



You should also have strong AI capabilities. That means you can use AI tools to speed up research, extract key takeaways, and iterate quickly, while keeping the final output sharp, human, and on-brand. You know when to lean on AI and when to ignore it.



What you’ll be doing:

- Turn daily crypto research into concise, engaging X posts and threads

- Find angles, hooks, and second-order insights (not just summarizing news)

- Write content that attracts founders, builders, and serious operators

- Help shape and maintain a consistent voice across posts

- Collaborate closely with the partnerships and research side

- Occasionally adapt content into summaries, notes, or outbound-friendly snippets



What we’re looking for:

- Deep familiarity with crypto narratives (DeFi, infra, AI, markets, cycles)

- Highly skilled content writer: Crypto, AI and more.

- Strong intuition for what works on X (hooks, pacing, formatting)

- Ability to write fast without sacrificing quality

- Comfortable working from rough notes, voice memos, or bullet points

- Self-directed and organized (we run lean systems, not bureaucracy)



Core requirements (non-negotiable):

- Minimum 4 years experience in crypto and content creation / copywriting

- Proof of experience required (published work, accounts, threads, or portfolios)

- Crypto-native: Actively follows markets, narratives, and CT culture

- Proven X experience: Prior copywriting or content creation on X

- Strong AI proficiency: Comfortable using AI tools daily for research, drafting, and iteration

- Ability to write fast without sacrificing quality

- Can work from rough notes, bullets, or voice memos

- High-signal, low-hype writing style

- Prior work that clearly drove engagement or inbound interest



If you don’t understand crypto deeply and can’t use AI effectively, this role won’t be a fit.



Nice to have (not required):

- Experience writing for creators, founders, or crypto brands

- Understanding of partnerships and/or BD content

- Ability to flex between crypto, AI, and business themes



Where this role can expand:

title: Product-Focused Web App Architect / Builder – Recruitment Marketplace (Discovery & MVP Planning)
description:
Hello togheter

I’m looking for an experienced product-minded web app builder / architect to help me evaluate and define the best technical approach for a new recruitment marketplace.



At this stage, I am not committed to any specific platform or tech stack.

My goal is to hear different expert opinions on how this product should be built in the smartest, cleanest, and most scalable way.







 Project Overview (Concept)



The product is a self-service recruitment marketplace, inspired by platforms like 
 (formerly Support Shepherd).



Core idea:

 • Talents (e.g. LATAM / Philippines) can sign up themselves and create profiles

 • Profiles include photo, short intro video, skills, salary expectation, availability, timezone

 • Companies can browse profiles by job category

 • Companies can hire full-time with one click

 • A one-time recruitment fee is paid by the company

 • plattform act only as a recruitment intermediary (no payroll, no employer role)



Think of it as:



Hiring talent as easily as booking a UGC creator or a freelancer.







???? What I’m Actually Looking For (Very Important)



I am not looking for someone to immediately build everything.



I am looking for someone who can:

 • Think in product, UX, and user flows

 • Propose different technical options (e.g. no-code, low-code, custom stack)

 • Explain pros & cons of each option

 • Share realistic timelines, risks, and limitations

 • Help define what a lean MVP should really include



You are encouraged to suggest:

 • No-code tools

 • Low-code stacks

 • Custom builds

 • Hybrid approaches



As long as you can clearly justify your recommendation.



?



???? First Step: Paid Discovery / Test Task



Before any long-term collaboration, I want to start with a small paid discovery task.



The discovery task may include:

 • Your recommended tech stack(s) and why

 • High-level system architecture

 • Core user flows (talent ? profile ? company ? hire)

 • Key trade-offs (speed vs scalability vs cost)

 • Rough MVP timeline & effort estimate



This step is paid, regardless of whether we continue.



???? Ideal Candidate

 • Experience building marketplaces or SaaS products

 • Strong product thinking, not just coding

 • Able to explain technical decisions in simple language

 • Comfortable working independently

 • Honest about limitations and trade-offs







???? To Apply, Please Include

 • Short intro about your background

 • 1–2 similar products you’ve worked on

 • How you would approach this discovery phase

 • Your estimated effort for the first paid test task





The core idea behind this platform is to create a true win-win situation.

A win for talented people from the Philippines, LATAM, and Eastern Europe, who get access to good, full-time job opportunities.

And a win for companies in Europe, who can easily hire reliable, motivated talent in a simple and transparent way.

The goal is to build a platform where both sides benefit, with trust, clarity, and long-term cooperation at the center.



Thank You 



Philipp

title: Maintenance Coordinator - Bilingual
description:
PSB (Pro Services Boston) and Green Ocean Property Management are integrated maintenance + property management teams serving the Greater Boston market. We manage multifamily, single-family, and HOA assets and run an in-house service operation focused on speed, quality, and clear communication.



Role Overview:

The Maintenance Coordinator is the command center for all work orders: intake, triage, scheduling, vendor coordination, tenant communications, and close-out. You’ll prioritize urgent issues, keep preventive maintenance on cadence, and drive down cycle times. This is a performance role with clear SLAs, daily accountability rhythms, and growth into senior coordination/ops leadership.



Core Responsibilities:

Work Order Intake & Triage

Receive requests via portal/phone/email; log with complete scope, photos, access info, and priority tag.

Classify by Priority (P0–P3) and building/owner rules; verify warranty/recall/recurring issues.

Pre-diagnose to reduce truck rolls (simple resets, filter sizes, breaker checks, shutoff guidance).

Scheduling & Dispatch

Assign to the right vendor/tech based on trade, SLA, geography, availability, and cost.

Build and update daily/weekly schedules; confirm tenant access, lockbox codes, pet/alarms, parking.

Create and track Not-to-Exceed (NTE) amounts; obtain approvals when required.

Vendor Management

Coordinate licensed vendors (HVAC, plumbing, electrical, appliance, roofing, etc.).

Ensure COI/W-9/licenses are current; validate arrival/completion, photo proof, and written diagnosis.

Request quotes for >NTE jobs; compare scope/price; route to approval.

Tenant & Owner Communication

Provide clear ETAs, prep steps (water shutoff, clearing access), and progress updates.

Set expectations for parts lead times and follow-ups; confirm satisfaction at completion.

Escalate sensitively when work impacts health/safety or habitability.

Preventive Maintenance (PM)

Maintain seasonal PM calendars (boilers/furnaces, gutters, dryer vents, smoke/CO checks, filter changes).

Batch/schedule PMs to minimize tenant disruption and travel time; track completion.

Invoicing & Close-Out

Ensure work orders have diagnosis, materials, labor, before/after photos, and time stamps.

Match invoices to WOs, verify against NTE, route exceptions, and submit to accounting the same day.

Emergencies & After-Hours Coordination

Follow the P0/P1 emergency SOP (gas/water/electrical hazards, no-heat, lockouts).

Coordinate on-call vendors, city services, and temporary mitigation.

Reporting & Quality

Produce daily/weekly reports on SLA adherence, WIP aging, cost variance, and vendor performance.

Flag repeat issues, recommend root-cause fixes (access hardware, part stocking, vendor changes).

Qualifications:

Fluent in English and Spanish language

Maintenance coordinating experience in a US Property Management company is a must

Knowledgeable in construction engineering is a plus

Has excellent problem solving skill

Good communication skills in English

Outstanding skills in organizing schedules

Experience with property management software Buildium/Property Meld is a plus

Self-driven and can work with little supervision

Extremely organized and can work in a constantly changing and fast past environment

Want to have a stable career with endless potential for learning and growth

Able to work on EST Business hours



IF YOU ARE NOT A BILINGUAL MAINTENANCE COORDINATOR- Please do not Apply or you will not be entertained. Thank you

title: HOA Manager
description:
The HOA Property Manager is responsible for the day?to?day operations, governance support, vendor oversight, and owner/resident experience across an assigned portfolio of homeowner associations. This role requires strong analytical ability, impeccable attention to detail, and exceptional written and verbal communication skills. The manager serves as the primary liaison among the Board of Directors, unit owners, residents, vendors, and internal teams (Maintenance and Finance), ensuring that association operations comply with governing documents, applicable laws, and company standards while meeting service-level and financial targets.



Key Outcomes (What Success Looks Like):



Accurate, timely Board packets and meeting facilitation with clear minutes and action logs

Portfolio-level adherence to budgets, assessments, and reserve funding plans in partnership with Finance HOA

Proactive maintenance planning and on-time completion of preventive and corrective work with Maintenance HOA

High owner/resident satisfaction, timely resolution of requests, and transparent communications

Clean annual audits, renewed insurance policies, and documented compliance with statutes and governing documents

Up-to-date task/project management in Asana and on-time delivery of recurring HOA cycles and filings



Key Responsibilities:

1) Board & Governance Management

Serve as the primary point of contact for Board members; prepare agendas, Board packets, and management reports for regular and special meetings.

Interpret and apply governing documents (CC&Rs, bylaws, rules) and relevant state statutes in daily operations; coordinate with counsel when required.

Facilitate annual meetings, elections, and owner notices in accordance with legal and governing document requirements.

2) Owner & Resident Relations

Maintain responsive, professional communication with trustees/Board, unit owners, and residents via
, phone, and portal.

Issue timely association-wide notices (policy changes, maintenance schedules, community events, compliance reminders).

Manage and resolve escalations, complaints, architectural review requests (ARC), violations, and hearings within established SLAs.

3) Financial Coordination & Reporting 

Support budget development, reserve study implementation, and monthly variance commentary; review financials for accuracy.

Monitor assessment billing, collections, payment plans, and delinquency follow-up in alignment with collection policies.

Review and approve invoices, code expenses to budgets, and validate vendor work completion prior to payment.

4) Maintenance, Projects & Vendor Management (with Maintenance HOA)

Translate Board priorities into annual maintenance calendars; schedule and track preventive maintenance and inspections.

Open, monitor, and close work orders; ensure scope, SLA, and quality standards are met; maintain accurate asset records.

Bid, negotiate, and manage vendor contracts (landscaping, janitorial, security, pools, roofing, elevators, etc.); perform periodic vendor reviews.

Coordinate capital improvement projects (RFPs, proposals, schedules, owner notifications, punch lists, closeout documents).

5) Information Management & Systems

Keep all HOA Asana projects/boards current with daily updates, dependencies, and follow-ups; maintain recurring tasks and automations.

Process resale and lender questionnaire packages accurately and within service timelines; maintain fee schedules.

Maintain organized digital records (governing docs, minutes, contracts, insurance, warranties, architectural files) in the association’s repository.

6) Team Leadership & Development

Train and onboard new APMs/PMs on processes, systems (Asana, accounting/portal), compliance, and customer service standards.

Promote a collaborative, service-oriented culture aligned with company values; escalate staffing/resource needs to the Unit Head.

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):

On-time completion rate for recurring HOA tasks and compliance filings

Work-order first-response and average time-to-close (by priority)

Delinquency rate and collections effectiveness; percent of assessments collected

Budget adherence (OPEX/CapEx) and variance accuracy; invoice cycle time

Owner/resident satisfaction score; complaint resolution time

Board satisfaction score (post-meeting surveys) and action-item closure rate

Qualifications:

3+ years of HOA/condo association management or related property management experience

Demonstrated proficiency with task/project management tools (Asana) and owner portals; strong Excel/Google Sheets skills

Exceptional communication (written and verbal), meeting facilitation, and stakeholder management

Strong analytical, organizational, and time-management skills; high attention to detail

Working knowledge of governing documents, meeting procedures, collections, elections, and common HOA statutes

title: Documentation Specialist (Fully Remote)
description:
Please Read the Whole Job Description Before Applying.



At Meadow, we’re reimagining end-of-life care - a $23B industry untouched by modern software or service thinking. In under a year, we became the largest cremation provider in Los Angeles, with 90+ NPS and hundreds of families served monthly. Now we’re scaling across the U.S. and hiring globally.



We believe great people live everywhere. Our team works across continents and time zones, grounded by shared values: high standards, deep empathy, and a drive to do work that matters.



Why join:

- Remote-first, global team: work from anywhere, be trusted to deliver

- Fair, transparent compensation: competitive pay, benchmarked globally.

- High expectations, high support: we invest in training and growth

- Respect and humanity: no burnout culture, no hero worship

- Real-world impact: your work supports families when it matters most.





About the Role:

As a Documentation Specialist, you will work with doctors, medical facilities, and families to ensure death certificates are completed accurately and filed on time. You’ll follow up to obtain medical details, secure required signatures, and confirm all documentation meets state requirements.



You’ll own key steps of the filing process and collaborate closely with our Filing Specialist and operations team to keep cases moving forward. Throughout the process, you’ll keep families informed and ensure no details are missed.



This role requires persistence, strong attention to detail, and the ability to work independently while coordinating with a distributed team. If you’re organized, professional, and motivated to support families during a sensitive time, this role offers meaningful and impactful work.



A quick note, because many candidates wonder about it:

People often assume this work is emotionally heavy, but our team consistently finds it deeply meaningful and surprisingly uplifting. The role is rooted in hospitality, clarity, and human connection, not sadness. Rather than feeling heavy, the work offers a unique sense of purpose as part of a modern, compassionate company transforming an outdated industry and bringing dignity, transparency, and warmth to families across the country.



What You’ll Do:

- Contact physicians and medical facilities - primarily by phone - to obtain accurate cause-of-death information and required signatures, demonstrating professionalism, persistence, and sensitivity.

- Review, verify, and document medical information in accordance with state regulations, maintaining precise records and providing timely updates to families and internal teams.

- Manage multiple cases simultaneously by proactively identifying and resolving delays, and collaborate closely with the Filing Specialist to meet deadlines and ensure families feel supported throughout the process.



Requirements & Qualifications:

- 2+ years of experience in office administration, deathcare services, or another role involving follow-up and detailed documentation.

- Comfortable making consistent follow-up calls and navigating busy medical offices while maintaining a courteous, professional, and solution-oriented approach.

- Able to manage multiple cases at different stages, meet strict filing deadlines, and keep accurate records.

- Skilled at explaining requirements simply, listening with empathy, and documenting information precisely.

- Quick to learn and use modern tools like Notion, Slack, and Aircall to stay connected and organized.



Details:

- Remote, full-time

- Compensation: $4.50-$7.00/hr USD

- Tools: HubSpot (CRM), Aircall (phone), Slack, and our case management system

- Shift: Monday-Friday, US Business hours 



Why You’ll Love Working With Us:

- Benefits: PTO, 10 Paid Holidays, Paid Training, Fully remote

- Global collaboration: Work with teammates around the world.

- Learn more about our Global teams here: 

- Career Growth in Sales & Tech: A chance to grow your career in sales and tech while helping build something meaningful

- Purpose-driven work: Make a real difference during one of life’s most meaningful transitions

- Supportive, growth-minded team – Bring your sales drive and eagerness to learn; we’ll support you every step of the way



Apply here:

title: Job Title: B2B Media Buyer (High-Performance | Full-Time | $20K+ Monthly Ad Spend) About Us We’re a fast-growing lead ge
description:
We’re a fast-growing B2B lead generation company specializing in performance-driven advertising for home service businesses. Our clients rely on us to generate qualified leads, booked calls, and real revenue—not vanity metrics.

With $20K+ in monthly ad spend and aggressive growth goals, we’re looking for a high-level B2B Media Buyer who knows how to scale cold traffic into predictable results.

If you understand funnels, buyer psychology, and performance metrics—and you thrive in a fast-paced environment—this role is for you.



Role Overview

We’re hiring a results-driven B2B Media Buyer to fully own our advertising ecosystem—from strategy to execution to optimization.

You’ll run campaigns targeting business owners in the home services space (tree services, roofing, landscaping, pavers, and similar industries). This role requires deep experience in B2B funnels, messaging, creative testing, and scaling profitable campaigns.



Key Responsibilities



Plan, launch, and manage B2B campaigns with $20K+ monthly ad spend

Build and optimize funnels designed specifically for business-owner conversion

Create, test, and iterate on high-converting ad creatives (photo, video, AI-based)

Write compelling B2B ad copy, scripts, and angles

Run continuous A/B testing across creatives, copy, audiences, and landing pages

Analyze performance data to lower CPL, improve conversion rates, and scale winners

Manage campaigns across Meta, Google, LinkedIn, and YouTube

Track KPIs, control CAC, and deliver weekly performance reports

Collaborate with internal teams to align ads with overall business goals



Qualifications



Proven experience managing B2B lead generation campaigns

Hands-on experience with $10K–$20K+ monthly ad spend

Strong understanding of B2B buyer psychology and funnel strategy

Ability to produce photo ads and AI-powered video creatives

Excellent copywriting skills for business-owner audiences

Highly analytical with strong decision-making based on data

Self-driven, reliable, and able to work independently

Full-time availability with a long-term mindset



Why Join Us

Manage meaningful budgets and scale real campaigns



Full creative freedom—no corporate red tape



Work with a performance-focused team that values results



Long-term growth with a company expanding into multiple markets



How to Apply



Please submit the following:



A brief introduction outlining your B2B media buying experience



A portfolio of ad creatives (photo ads, video ads, scripts)



Case studies of B2B campaigns you’ve managed

(include ad spend, CPL, CAC, ROAS, or other key metrics)



Only applicants with proven B2B experience will be considered.

title: Versatile Assistant with Advanced Technical and Data Analysis Skills for Property Management Company
description:
================================================================================

              VIRTUAL ASSISTANT - OASIS LIVING (Property Management)

================================================================================



We are looking for a fast learner, versatile assistant with advanced technical, 

numerical and management skills for Property Management Company. You should have 

at least 3 years of experience to work. You will work directly with the CEO of 

Oasis Living and the rest of the team. We are a short term rental manager, 

managing properties on Airbnb, 
 and other similar platforms in UK 

and Spain.





THE ROLE

========



You will be handling an array of day to day administrative, spreadsheet, research 

and
/coordination/organisation related to various projects related to 

property management:



  - Every day will be different with new tasks coming at you, that you need to 

    do with spreadsheets, microsoft word, our company sales CRM software and 

    via other online tools

  - Create and maintain advertisements on rental platforms

  - Constantly monitor the property rental, find out bottlenecks where things 

    are going wrong, devise strategies to fix them

  - Organize, document and maintain business documents in Google Docs, 

    Spreadsheets, Wordpress pages

  - Analyse business data each month in spreadsheets, prepare financial 

    analysis and financial forecasts and report to seniors

  - Use AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini) daily to draft content, summarise 

    data, research topics and accelerate routine tasks -- you should be 

    comfortable treating AI as a core productivity tool, not a novelty

  - Help with several ad-hoc tasks

  - Maintain company websites - HTML, CSS and basic javascript - which if you 

    don't know already you need to be able to learn fast

  - Communicate very clearly in written 
, Slack) and via video (via 

    Loom and other video recording)

  - Attend daily team calls via Zoom video twice daily



Work hours: Monday to Friday, 9am - 6pm UK time with meal break. 

This is a job where you need to be present online during work hours fully.

Option for Performance based compensation in near-term future.





REQUIREMENTS

============



  - Fast learning, non-linear thinker and great in problem solving and 

    mathematics

  - You have to be super organized. Existing degree or certification in project 

    management will be preferred. You should already be very familiar with one 

    project management tool like Asana or Jira and be able to show during 

    interview how you use these, how you keep a track of your todos in your 

    prior roles

  - Versatile in many skills and with proven history of learning new skills 

    fast. Your job will evolve every month over the next 2-3 years. You cannot 

    say "I was hired for doing X, I dont want to do anything other than that". 

    In one day you might be asked to use your Photoshop skills to edit pictures 

    and create advertisments on Airbnb; next week you might be asked to 

    reconcile a spreadsheet for our expenses and summarise them over an
; 

    yet another week you might be asked to create a new Wordpress site from 

    scratch and given minimum guidance and asked to learn the rest from Youtube

  - You can pick up things very fast, and like to think about problems you 

    encounter in your free time and how to solve them better. We will test your 

    problem solving skills and maths/logical analysis skills during interview

  - Ideally you will be between 23-35 years old - with enough experience

  - Familiarity with UK society, UK business practices will be a plus point

  - You have to be trustworthy. We need references from your current/previous 

    employer where you have worked in a similar role

  - A science or maths degree preferred

  - C2 Proficiency in English - Given the nature of the role, you will be 

    directly
ing senior managers and investors and business contacts in UK 

    and you should be able to communicate very fluently in English - orally 

    and in writing

  - Long term thinker. Ideally we are looking for an individual who can work 

    with us for 5-10 years or more





AI & AUTOMATION SKILLS

======================



This is a modern, AI-first team. We expect you to:



  - Be a confident, daily user of AI assistants (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini) for 

    writing, research, data analysis and problem-solving

  - Know how to write effective prompts -- giving clear context, specifying 

    output format, and iterating to get high-quality results

  - Use AI to speed up repetitive work: drafting
s, summarising documents, 

    cleaning data, generating formulas, writing basic code snippets

  - Be able to critically evaluate AI output -- you know when to trust it and 

    when to verify

  - Stay curious about new AI tools and automation workflows. If a new tool 

    can save the team 5 hours a week, we expect you to find it, test it, and 

    propose it

  - Bonus: experience with AI image generation (Midjourney, DALL-E) for 

    property listing visuals, or using AI coding assistants (GitHub Copilot, 

    Claude Code) for web tasks





DOMAIN KNOWLEDGE

================

title: Inbound Sales Representative (Fully Remote)
description:
Please Read the Whole Job Description Before Applying.



At Meadow, we’re reimagining end-of-life care - a $23B industry untouched by modern software or service thinking. In under a year, we became the largest cremation provider in Los Angeles, with 90+ NPS and hundreds of families served monthly. Now we’re scaling across the U.S. and hiring globally.



We believe great people live everywhere. Our team works across continents and time zones, grounded by shared values: high standards, deep empathy, and a drive to do work that matters.



Why join:

- Remote-first, global team: work from anywhere, be trusted to deliver

- Fair, transparent compensation: competitive pay, benchmarked globally.

- High expectations, high support:  we invest in training and growth

- Respect and humanity: no burnout culture, no hero worship

- Real-world impact: your work supports families when it matters most.



About the Role:

As an Inbound Sales Representative, you’ll be the first voice families hear when they reach out. You’ll guide them with clarity and compassion - no cold calls or pushy tactics, just meaningful conversations that help people make one of life’s most important decisions with confidence.



You’ll manage warm, inbound leads from first contact to close, helping families feel confident in their decisions and supported every step of the way. Every call is a chance to make someone’s life a little easier, and every conversation reflects our standard of unmatched hospitality.



A quick note, because many candidates wonder about it:

People often assume this work is emotionally heavy, but our team consistently finds it deeply meaningful and surprisingly uplifting. The role is rooted in hospitality, clarity, and human connection, not sadness. Rather than feeling heavy, the work offers a unique sense of purpose as part of a modern, compassionate company transforming an outdated industry and bringing dignity, transparency, and warmth to families across the country.



What You’ll Do:

- Handle warm inbound calls and close them end-to-end using Meadow’s consultative playbook.

- Guide families through our cremation options and deliver unmatched hospitality in every interaction.

- Follow up consistently via phone, text, and
 so families can make confident decisions.

- Hit revenue targets while maintaining strong close rates and high quality scores.

- Navigate a multi-tool workflow (HubSpot, Aircall, GSuite, Slack, internal case management) with ease.



Requirements & Qualifications:

- 2+ years of B2C sales experience

- Strong written and spoken English.

- Confident, empathetic communicator who explains clearly, listens well, and excels on the phone.

- Self-driven seller motivated by both impact and performance; emotionally steady and highly coachable.

- Comfortable working independently and managing a consistent follow-up rhythm.

- Familiarity with HubSpot or comparable CRMs (Salesforce, Zoho, etc.).



Bonus points if you:

- Have experience selling in high-trust spaces (insurance, healthcare, travel, etc.)

- Speak Spanish -  many of the families we serve do too



Details:

- Remote, full-time

- Compensation: $6-$9/hr USD OTE

- Total compensation includes a base rate plus bonus (tied to  performance and overall team success).

- Tools: HubSpot (CRM), Aircall (phone), Slack, and our case management system

- Shifts: (8h, consistent schedule) We offer several shift options so our team can assist families whenever they need us:

- AM: Start between 6–8am EST

- PM: Start between 2–4pm EST

- Night: Start between 8–10pm EST

(Thursday-Monday or Friday-Tuesday preferred)



Why You’ll Love Working With Us:

- Benefits: PTO, 10 Paid Holidays, Paid Training, Fully remote

- Global collaboration: Work with teammates around the world.

- Learn more about our Global teams here: 

- Career Growth in Sales & Tech: A chance to grow your career in sales and tech while helping build something meaningful

- Purpose-driven work: Make a real difference during one of life’s most meaningful transitions

- Supportive, growth-minded team – Bring your sales drive and eagerness to learn; we’ll support you every step of the way



Apply Now:

We’re just getting started, and we’re looking for people who want to grow with us. If you’re excited about making an impact, building meaningful relationships, and launching a successful career in sales and tech, apply today. Even if you don’t meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply - your passion and potential matter more than checking every box.



Apply here:

title: Customer Service & Marketing Assistant
description:
Customer Service & Marketing Assistant 



About Us



We’re a family owned appliance repair company in Whitinsville, Massachusetts. After a couple of years in business, we’ve built a solid reputation for honest, high quality service. Right now it’s just the two of us, one of us fixing appliances in the field, the other caring for our twins. However, because we’re juggling repairs and family responsibilities, even a few calls,
s and text are too much for us to handle on the side. We need someone who can focus on customer communications and help with marketing during slower periods as we prepare for growth.



What you’ll do





    Answer calls,
s & texts: Be the friendly voice our customers hear. You’ll handle a few calls a day, collect information and schedule service appointments.





    Manage the calendar: Use our scheduling software to book jobs, send confirmations and plan return visits when parts arrive.





    Order parts & track them: Place orders with suppliers, keep track of shipments and coordinate return visits for installations.





    Help with marketing: During slower periods, assist with social?media posts, follow?up
s and simple online ads to keep the phone ringing.





    Keep records tidy: Update customer details, job status and warranty info in our CRM. Light bookkeeping may be needed later.





Our expectations





    Excellent spoken and written English; a friendly, patient manner.





    Experience in customer service or call?center work is a plus.





    Comfortable with
, chat and scheduling tools; able to learn new systems quickly.





    Reliable internet connection and a quiet place to work (U.S. Eastern Time).





    Bonus if you have marketing know?how or experience ordering parts.





Hours & pay





    Approximately 40 hours per week, working U.S. Eastern daytime hours; US?$550–650 per month (about $3.50–4.00 per hour), depending on experience.  Paid Philippine holidays included; potential bonuses based on customer satisfaction and marketing results.



Why this is a great role





    You’ll have a big impact on a growing family business, help us build systems from scratch and watch your responsibilities grow with us.





    We offer a flexible, family friendly environment and value honesty and loyalty.





    Low call volume now means you’ll have time to learn, get organized and shape our marketing efforts. What overwhelms us while juggling other jobs will be a manageable, focused workload for you.





Ready to apply?



Send your resume and a short note explaining why you’re a great fit. To show that you’ve read this posting, please include the word “Cityscape” in the first line of your message this simple instruction helps us see who follows directions (an approach suggested by OnlineJobs.ph’s job seeker tips). We’ll review applications and set up video interviews for candidates.



We’re excited to welcome someone who can help our small business thrive!

title: Ecommerce Operations Manager
description:
Ikigai Cases is hiring for an Ecommerce Operations Manager

Location: Remote

Compensation: $1800 per month + performance-based bonuses



About the Company

Ikigai Cases (
) is a family-owned e-commerce business selling premiu
tal pill cases. Founded in December 2021, the business has been operated by two brothers from Washington, DC since then. After four years, the company has grown to selling thousands of pill cases every month and double-digit tea
mbers, including a thriving remote team.



Our mission is simple: to make exceptional pill cases and provide exceptional customer service. We uphold this commitment by managing our fulfillment operations in-house and offering white-glove service to our customers.



We are looking to hire an Ecommerce Operations Manager to join our growing remote team.



5 Core Responsibilities

1. Launch Execution: Plan and execute all sales, product launches, color launches, and promotional 
nts, ensuring offers, timing, assets, and systems go live correctly.



2. Cross-Functional Launch Coordination: Coordinate all teams involved in launches (Marketing,
, Creative, Website, Ops, CX, Fulfillment), managing timelines and dependencies to ensure aligned execution.



3. Website & Systems Setup for Launches: Set up and configure all website, Shopify, and related systems required for launches, including products, collections, discounts, carts, and launch-specific site changes.



4. Launch QA & System Hygiene: Own pre-launch QA and post-launch cleanup, ensuring accuracy across offers and flows and maintaining clean, current systems with no leftover artifacts.



5. Launch Process Improvement: Improve launch workflows, templates, and safeguards to support increasing launch volume and complexity with reduced risk.



Why You Should Take This Role

title: Recruiting Manager
description:
About the Company

Ikigai Cases is a family-owned e-commerce business selling premiu
tal pill cases. The business was founded in 2021 in Washington DC by two brothers. After four years, the company has grown to selling thousands of pill cases every month and double-digit tea
mbers, including a thriving remote team.



Our mission is simple: to make exceptional pill cases and provide exceptional customer service. We uphold this commitment by managing our fulfillment operations in-house and offering white-glove service to our customers.



We are looking to hire an experienced Recruiter (previous titles may include Executive Recruiter, Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist, Senior Recruiter, Recruiting Manager) to help take our team to the next level. They will personally own all of the day-to-day search & recruiting responsibilities for our company as we continue to scale. The ideal candidate is well versed in outbound recruiting, and takes pride in their ability to close searches from start to finish without help.



About You

You should be self-motivated and looking to work hard - as you will be expected to work hard, contribute and execute without supervision to help the whole team.

You are highly organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to juggle multiple priorities without sacrificing quality.

You take pride in your work and are proactive, anticipating the needs of the company and ensuring smooth day-to-day operations.



Key Responsibilities

-Own and run the full recruiting pipeline for all open roles across the company—track candidates, manage job posts, and maintain hiring dashboards that keep leadership aligned.

-Proactively source and headhunt top talent via LinkedIn and job boards (PH, LATAM, US), writing compelling outreach messages and filtering for A-players who meet our bar.

-Write and manage job descriptions, test projects, and interview workflows to ensure every search is systematized and repeatable—owning speed, quality, and process integrity.

-Communicate with candidates directly at every stage—ensuring timely updates, clear expectations, and a premium candidate experience.

-Build a bench of candidates for key repeated roles, prepare and close searches in advance, and ensure we're always 1–2 months ahead of our hiring needs.

-Support onboarding during the first 90 days post-hire—schedule welcome calls, check progress against the onboarding plan, and ensure handoff to the relevant manager is seamless.



Required Experience & Skills Experience:

-Minimum of 3 years in talent acquisition, recruiting & headhunting roles, preferably searching for e-commerce talent.

-Proven ability to source great candidates, evaluate them, coordinate the interview process with the client, and close searches effectively and independently.

-Excellent English skills & an outgoing personality as you will be required to represent the brand to prospective candidates during screening interviews



Preferred Experiences

-(preferred) E-commerce specific roles in your recruiting history

-(preferred) Has recruited for both US and Philippines based roles



Communication & English Proficiency

-Excellent written and verbal English skills.

-Excellent energy & interview presence to engage candidates with the company.

-Ability to communicate effectively with internal teams and candidates over



Compensation Details

-Compensation: $1,800 per month + performance-based bonuses

-Work Hours: 50 hours per week, Monday through Friday. The hours are 8AM to 6PM EST.

-Paid Holidays: 10 paid holidays per year

-PTO: 1 week earned for every 6 months worked at the company





To Apply

To apply, please submit the following Recruiting Manager Application [Google Form linked below] to apply for the position.



This application includes written questions in order to ensure we hire an outstanding candidate for this position, so please be advised in advance that it will take time to complete.



We will be reviewing applications and inviting qualified candidates to interview on a rolling basis.







Note: Applications on OnlineJobs.ph, DMs, and messages sent via
 will not be reviewed. Only Google Form submissions will be reviewed and considered for this submission.

title: Executive Assistant to the CEO
description:
Join our team and become part of a dynamic, global organization of 40 professionals across Korea, Singapore, Malaysia, and the Philippines. Collaborate closely with our regional teams to grow an exciting portfolio of leading Korean brands, including Beauty of Joseon, Needly, Tirtir, and other top-trending names in the market.



In this role, you won't just manage a calendar; you’ll be an integral part of a team growing Korean brands. We are looking for a proactive professional who treats the CEO’s goals as their own. This is a long-term, full-time commitment for someone who wants to move beyond administrative support and become an integral part of a fast-growing, international organization.



Key Responsibilities:



- Manage and optimize the CEO’s schedule, meetings, and calendar prioritizing engagements across multiple time zones (KR, SG, PH, MY).

- Coordinate domestic, international travel, including visas, multi-city itineraries, and ground logistics for regional brand events.

- Handle confidential information with absolute discretion.

- Prepare reports, presentations, and executive correspondence.

- Serve as a primary point of contact between the CEO and internal/external stakeholders.

- Coordinate board meetings, leadership meetings, and follow-ups.

- Track action items and ensure timely execution of priorities.

- Support strategic initiatives and special projects as assigned.

- Manage expenses, reimbursements, and basic administrative reporting.

- Other adhoc tasks as assigned.



Qualifications:



- 2-5 years of experience as a Personal Assistant, Executive Assistant, or similar role.

- Experience supporting leadership within a Singaporean, Korean or multi-cultural corporate environment.

- Familiar with Korean Top Brands and international retail industries.

- Proficient with International Shopee, Lazada, Tiktok, and Big Seller.

- Advance proficiency in Google Workspace, Canva and project management software.

- Exceptional organizational, time-management, and multitasking skills.

- Strong communication skills with the ability to work effectively in multicultural teams.

- High level of professionalism, discretion, and confidentiality.

- Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment.

- Seeking a dedicated full-time and long term role.



Benefits:

- Stable full time employment with leave benefits, up to 14 days annual leave, public holiday leave, birthday leave.

title: CAD technician
description:
We are looking for a detail-oriented Virtual Assistant CAD Technician whose primary role is to produce high-quality technical drawings. The ideal candidate will be proficient in Revit and Bluebeam Revu and have reliable access to both software applications. This position is focused exclusively on drawing production, without any responsibilities for project coordination, as our team will handle all coordination tasks.



Key Responsibilities:

• Drawing Production:

  - Develop, update, and refine technical drawings and design documents using Revit and Bluebeam Revu.

  - Ensure that all drawings are accurate, clear, and compliant with project specifications.

  - Convert sketches or preliminary designs into precise digital drawings as required.



• Quality Assurance:

  - Review drawing details for consistency and accuracy before submission.

  - Make revisions based on internal feedback and adhere to quality standards.



• Software Proficiency:

  - Utilize Revit for creating and modifying detailed architectural or engineering drawings.

  - Use Bluebeam Revu to annotate, review, and manage digital drawing workflows.



• Documentation:

  - Maintain organized digital files of all drawings with accurate version control.

  - Implement standard operating procedures for file management and archiving.



Qualifications:

• Proven proficiency in Revit and Bluebeam Revu with access to the latest versions.

• Demonstrated experience in producing technical drawings in a fast-paced environment.

• Strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and clarity in all documentation.

• Ability to work independently and manage workload without involvement in project coordination.

• Effective communication skills for clarifying drawing instructions and feedback.



What We Offer:

• A fully remote, flexible work environment focused exclusively on drawing production.

• Opportunities for professional development in advanced CAD techniques and software utilization.

• A clear, focused role that allows you to concentrate on producing high-quality technical drawings without additional coordination responsibilities.



This role is a great fit for a technician who excels in drawing production and is looking to work with industry-standard tools like Revit and Bluebeam Revu. If you are passionate about precision and quality in technical drawings, we encourage you to apply.

title: TikTok Ad Creator - Virtual Assistant (Full-Time)
description:
About the Role



We run a fast-paced digital advertising company that creates TikTok video ads daily. We're looking for a dedicated VA to produce 20+ simple video ads per day using our proven system and AI tools.



This is NOT complex video editing. The work involves taking short TikTok clips, running them through our AI tools to generate captions, and adding text overlays using TikTok's built-in video editor. If you can follow a clear process and have a feel for what sounds natural on TikTok, this role is for you.



What You'll Do



- Source viral TikTok clips that match our ad style

- Use our AI tools (Gemini + Claude) to analyze clips and generate caption options

- Select the best caption and add it as a text overlay in TikTok's video editor

- Submit finished ads for review (expect feedback and revisions early on)

- Produce 20+ ads per day once fully trained



Requirements



- You actively use TikTok and understand the culture/language on the platform

- You can read and write casual English fluently (slang, informal speech)

- iPhone (required - our workflow does not support Android)

- Reliable internet connection

- Available to work full-time (40 hrs/week, flexible schedule)

- Comfortable using AI tools (we'll train you on the specific ones)

- Fast learner who can follow SOPs and take feedback well



Nice to Have



- Experience with social media content creation

- Familiarity with CapCut or TikTok's video editor

- Understanding of what makes content go viral on TikTok



Compensation

$5/h + performance bonuses



How to Apply



Send us:

1. A brief intro about yourself

2. Your experience with TikTok and social media content (if any)

3. Why you think you'd be a good fit for this role

4. Your phone model (e.g. iPhone 13, iPhone 15 Pro)







We'll respond to strong applications within 48 hours.

title: Remote Part-Time MS 365 Administrator (50%, Freelancer)
description:
Hello,



We are looking for a reliable and detail-oriented **Microsoft 365 Administrator** to support our day-to-day IT operations on a **remote, part-time basis (approx. 20 hours per week)**.



This role focuses on **standard Microsoft 365 and Intune administration**, not advanced architecture or security design.



---



### ???? Role Overview



* Position: Microsoft 365 Administrator (Freelance)

* Work type: Remote

* Time commitment: ~50% (around 20 hours/week)

* Contract type: Freelancer

* Compensation: **USD 300 per month**

* Start: As soon as possible

* Long-term cooperation preferred



---



### ???? Responsibilities



**Microsoft 365 / Entra ID**



* Create, update, and disable user accounts

* Assign and manage Microsoft 365 licenses

* Manage groups (security & Microsoft 365 groups)

* Basic role assignments (User Admin, License Admin, etc.)

* Support onboarding and offboarding processes



**Intune (Endpoint Management)**



* Enroll and remove devices (Windows, macOS, iOS, Android)

* Assign configuration and compliance policies

* Deploy standard applications

* Manage device groups

* Basic Intune troubleshooting (policies not applying, enrollment issues)

* Assist users with device-related issues



**Azure (Basic)**



* Basic Azure AD / Entra ID administration

* Subscription overview and access management (RBAC – limited scope)

* Cost awareness and reporting support (no architecture changes)



**General IT Support**



* Follow documented SOPs and checklists

* Keep changes documented

* Communicate clearly about completed tasks and issues

* Escalate complex or security-related topics



---



### ???? Access & Security Model



* No permanent Global Admin access

* Role-based access only (via PIM)

* Separate admin account required

* MFA mandatory

* Work strictly within defined procedures



---



### ? Requirements



* 3+ years experience with Microsoft 365 administration

* Hands-on experience with Intune device management

* Good understanding of Entra ID (Azure AD)

* Reliable internet connection

* Good written English

* High level of trustworthiness and attention to detail



**Nice to have**



* Experience supporting remote users

* Basic IT documentation experience

* Familiarity with SOP-based work



---



### ???? Not Required



* No scripting or automation



---



### ???? What We Offer



* Stable, long-term freelance cooperation

* Clear tasks and responsibilities

* Low-pressure environment

* Respectful communication

* On-time monthly payment



---



If you are interested, please reply with:



* A short summary of your Microsoft 365 and Intune experience

* Your availability (hours per week)

* Your preferred communication times



We look forward to working with you.



Best regards,

IT4EX TEAM

title: Guest Post Assistant
description:
Guest Post Assistant Job Description



Full-Time | Remote (Philippines) | UK Timezone



Location: United Kingdom (Remote)



Hours: 40 hours/week



Salary: $600/month (fixed)



(Full-Time, Remote – Philippines)



Work Hours

- UK timezone

- Full-time, 40 hours/week



---



About the Role



We manage multiple websites and receive daily guest post and backlink inquiries. We’re looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Guest Post Assistant to take full ownership of our guest posting operations.



This role is for someone who understands that guest posting is a business process, not just replying to
s.



You’ll manage multiple website inboxes and guest post requests, ensuring every inquiry is handled professionally, efficiently, and consistently.



This is NOT a basic admin role. You’ll be responsible for handling negotiations, confirming orders, coordinating post uploads, and managing the full guest post workflow from inquiry to publication.



This role is ideal for someone who:



- Can manage high-volume
 inquiries without missing details

- Is comfortable with pricing discussions and objections

- Is organised, structured, and process-driven

- Communicates professionally with external clients

- Can manage multiple websites and workflows at once

- Takes ownership of the entire guest post process



You’ll be trusted to manage daily operations and ensure guest post orders are handled smoothly end-to-end.



---



 **Key Responsibilities**



 **Guest Post Management (Multi-Website)**



- Monitor
 inbox daily for guest post inquiries

- Respond to clients requesting to publish guest posts on our websites

- Negotiate pricing with clients:

    - Handle objections professionally

    - Manage negotiations when clients request lower pricing

- Accept orders by confirming fees and terms with clients

- Post approved content to the correct website accounts

- Send confirmation
s to clients with the published links

- Create and send invoices to clients.

- Manage guest posting service across multiple websites



---

 **Workflow, Accuracy & Performance**



- Ensure inquiries are handled **promptly and professionally**

- Track orders and publication status accurately

- Maintain organised records of inquiries, orders, and live links

- Identify bottlenecks or issues in the guest post workflow

- Suggest improvements to streamline processes



---



 **Ownership & Execution**



- Manage multiple guest post requests without dropping details

- Work independently and take responsibility for daily inbox management

- Flag issues early and escalate when needed

- Keep communication clear, professional, and consistent

- Maintain accuracy when handling pricing, orders, and posting



---



 **Required Skills**



- Fluent in English, with strong written communication skills

- Professional
 communication with external clients

- Highly organised and detail-oriented

- Comfortable handling negotiations and objections

- Reliable with daily inbox monitoring

- Able to manage multiple website accounts



---



 **Tools You Should Be Comfortable Using**



-
 (Gmail or similar)

- Basic CMS posting (WordPress or similar)

- PayPal invoicing

- Google Workspace

- Notion or basic task tracking tools



---



 **Bonus (Not Required)**



- Experience with guest posting or link-building workflows

- Experience managing multiple websites

- Basic understanding of SEO or content publishing



---



**Requirements**



- 1-2 years experience as virtual assistant

- Reliable laptop (minimum **8GB RAM**)

- Stable, fast internet connection

- Ability to work UK hours



---



 **How to Apply**



 **Include the following in your
:**



- A short introduction (Any relevant experience with
 handling or guest posting)

- Confirm that you agree to the fixed salary of $600/month

- A screenshot of your internet speed

- Resume

- Confirm whether you currently have any other jobs

- Include the word “Galaxy” at the bottom of your application



?? Applications missing any of the above steps will not be considered.

Full-Time | Long-Term | Remote)

We own and operate a UK-based advertising and marketing firm serving business clients. Our environment is structured, fast-paced, and performance-driven. We value organisation, accountability, and people who take ownership of their responsibilities.

This role works closely with management to ensure operations run smoothly, tasks are tracked, and nothing falls through the cracks.



Role Overview

We are hiring a highly organised Operations Coordinator to support management and internal operations. This role focuses on coordination, tracking, follow-ups, reporting, and process support, rather than classic executive PA work.

This is not an entry-level role and not suitable for casual applicants. We are looking for someone structured, dependable, and able to manage multiple moving parts calmly.



====================================================================================================



Key Responsibilities

Coordinate daily operational tasks and internal workflows

Track tasks, deadlines, and deliverables across teams

Follow up with staff to ensure work is completed on time

Maintain organised records, documents, and internal systems

====================================================================================================

Strong written and spoken English

Excellent organisational and time-management skills

Reliable, punctual, and consistent

Stable internet connection and professional home setup



====================================================================================================

Monday to Friday

9:00 AM – 5:00 PM

Overtime is essential on some days depending on business needs
