====================================================================================================



What We Offer

Full-time, stable position

12-month renewable contract

Health benefits

Paid annual leave

Performance-based bonuses

Paid overtime and additional shifts

Long-term growth for dependable performers



====================================================================================================



This Role Is NOT Suitable For

Freelancers managing multiple clients

Job hoppers

Applicants who need constant supervision

Anyone looking for short-term or temporary work

Individuals who struggle with structure, follow-ups, or accountability



====================================================================================================



APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS (STRICT)

To apply, copy and answer the questions below in the SAME NUMBERED FORMAT. Applications that do not follow instructions will be rejected without review.

 Address

Only candidates who meet ALL requirements will be contacted

title: Finance Administrator
description:
Accounts Receivable and Payable Management

Process and manage all client invoices in Xero, ensuring accuracy and timely invoicing.

Monitor accounts receivable, following up on overdue accounts and maintaining updated client payment records.

Reconcile accounts payable, processing payments and maintaining accurate financial records for client accounts.



Bank Reconciliation and Cash Flow Management

Perform monthly bank reconciliations for all client accounts in Xero, ensuring accurate records and identifying discrepancies.

Monitor client cash flow and provide updates to the Financial Manager, ensuring all transactions are recorded accurately.

Work with franchisees and SLA clients to address reconciliation issues, supporting clarity and accuracy in cash flow management.



Financial Reporting and Compliance

Prepare monthly financial reports for clients, including Profit & Loss statements, Balance Sheets, and Cash Flow summaries.

Provide detailed financial reports to the Financial Manager and ensure that reports are compliant with industry standards.

Ensure all records meet compliance requirements, maintaining accurate documentation for audits and regulatory reviews.



Client Liaison and Relationship Management

Act as the main point of contact for external clients, addressing questions regarding financial transactions and processes.

Conduct regular financial reviews with clients, discussing financial performance, answering queries, and advising on best practices.

Build and maintain strong client relationships, ensuring a high level of service and financial support.



Process Improvement and Efficiency Optimization

Identify opportunities to streamline bookkeeping processes, suggesting improvements to enhance workflow in Xero.

Collaborate with the Financial Manager to implement process changes that support efficient, accurate financial management.



Data Entry and Record Keeping

Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records in Xero, ensuring proper documentation of all transactions.

Organize and manage client records for easy access and retrieval, supporting transparency and accountability.



Compliance and Tax Preparation Support

Ensure compliance with tax regulations and prepare documentation required for tax filings.

Work closely with the Financial Manager and external accountants to provide necessary information for tax preparation.



Expense Tracking and Budgeting Assistance

Track client expenses, helping franchisees and SLA clients adhere to budget limits.

Prepare budget variance reports and advise clients on expense management best practices.



Self-Management and Professional Development

Manage time effectively to meet deadlines, balancing multiple client accounts and prioritizing tasks.

Participate in professional development opportunities to stay updated on bookkeeping practices, Xero updates, and financial regulations.

title: YouTube Video Editor (Long-form)
description:
[Work Type]

Remote | Flexible Hours | Long-term Contract

You may choose either Part-time(+3hrs/day) or Full-time



[Caution]

You’ll be using plugins in After Effects for motion and transitions, so please continue only if you’re already comfortable and experienced working in After Effects.



[Salary]

-$100 per project

-$300 USD commitment bonus after completing 10 projects (you will be paid $100+$300 for every 10th project you complete)

-You don't have to search for the visual elements such as video clips, images, talking-heads since all the elements will be provided.

-I can provide 1~2 projects each week as long as you can manage (our current editor says he can consistently handle around 1.5–2 projects per week after being fully aligned with the workflow and preferred style).

-Expect the first project will take longer as we need to adjust to the desired working style. But as we get on to the 2nd, 3rd, ... it will take less time as there will be less corrections to make.



[What You’ll Do]

IMPORTANT-> Here's a sample video(you must watch it before applying): 

-All the ingredients(images, video clips, voice-over, talking-head, BGM and script) for the video will be provided.

-You will select images that best match the context from the provided asset folder, place them at the appropriate timestamps, and add motion, transitions, sound effects, and background music.

-Use After Effect plugins such as Mister Horse and Flow to add dynamic motions.

-The images or video clips must match with what's being spoken by the voice-over.

-Collaborate with me or our team to ensure the visuals meet aesthetic and desired output.



*In the beginning, your edits will get a few rounds of feedback for refinement while adjusting to the preferred video style. But as you're aligned and become familiar, you won't need my feedback and refinement as much.



[What We’re Looking For]

The ideal candidate:

-Communicates effectively and values mutual respect.

-Has a creative editing skill for visually appealing videos; to avoid viewer's boredom.

-Has strong time management skills to meet deadlines.

-Is accountable and committed to the role.



*Important Note:

We value respectful communication. What does it mean?

Most importantly, if you need to step away, just let me or your manager know why and when. We understand it, even if you need to leave tomorrow, BUT ghosting is the last thing you'd like to do, since it causes confusion and delays. 

In everyday conversations, our team thrives on mutual respect, no matter your role.



[Why Work With Us?]

-Flexible hours to suit your schedule. (You’re welcome to work at night and submit your draft. While you’re asleep, it will be reviewed and feedback will be ready within 12 hours.)

-Long-term growth opportunities as the channel expands.

-A supportive environment that values creativity and contributions.



[About Us]

We help YouTube creators master storytelling techniques to captivate audiences and achieve viral success. Your role will play a key part in bringing our vision to life and empowering creators worldwide.



[How to Apply]

Subject Line: Start your title with “VIDEO EDIT”, or your application can't be considered.



In your application, include:

1. Portfolio: Share 2-3 of your best projects involving video editing with motion graphic.

2. Work History: Explain any experience or projects involving motion graphics or After Effects.

3. After Effects Skill: Please rate your After Effects skill level on a 5-star scale.

4. Available Hours: Let us know when you are available for our work each day of the week(For example:Monday: 11:00AM - 2:00PM, Tuesday: 3:30PM - 8:00PM, Wednesday: ..., etc)

5. Available Period of Work: Let us know for how long you expect to work with this job. We'd prefer at least 3 months with additional projects forward.

6. Whether or not you're willing to be on a Zoo
eting: We prefer Zoo
eting because this shows your accountability as well as it drives our team to the same goal together.



I will respond to your application in 7 days all at once.

title: Operations & Driver Performance Analyst (Remote)
description:
This role is ideal for someone who enjoys working with data, identifying performance trends, and creating clear daily reporting that helps operations run more efficiently.



We are hiring an Operations & Driver Performance Analyst to support our Delivery Service Partner (DSP) delivery operation by collecting, organizing, and analyzing operational data to provide clear visibility into driver performance and operational trends.



This role exists to remove data collection, reporting, and coaching preparation responsibilities from dispatch so dispatch can focus on daily operational execution. The role focuses on reviewing prior-day performance data, initiating standardized follow-up coaching communication, and maintaining accurate performance tracking so dispatch can remain focused on real-time operations.



Reporting produced in this role is used directly by leadership to guide staffing, coaching, and performance decisions. The goal is to make operational decisions clear and data-driven rather than reactive.



This is a data-driven role focused on reporting, analysis, and operational follow-through — not dispatch or disciplinary decision-making.



Key Responsibilities



Performance Reporting & Analysis

• Collect and maintain daily driver performance data including safety, quality, attendance, pace, rescues, and Delivery Completion Rate (DCR) metrics

• Build and maintain daily and weekly performance reports

• Clearly identify top performers, stable performers, and drivers requiring attention

• Identify trends and recurring performance patterns across the driver group

• Maintain driver performance records and reporting documentation

• Present data in a clear format that allows leadership to make staffing and coaching decisions quickly



Coaching Communication & Follow-Up

• Review daily performance metrics and initiate follow-up coaching communications with drivers using existing LMDmax message templates based on defined performance thresholds

• Send coaching
s or messages related to attendance points, safety events, or quality defects using established templates

• Follow up with drivers to ensure required safety or quality quizzes are completed when applicable

• Track coaching activity and quiz completion for reporting purposes



Compliance & Data Verification

• Verify completion of required safety and quality quizzes prior to routes

• Identify discrepancies or errors in operational data

• Submit and track dispute tickets through the DSP portal when corrections are required

• Maintain documentation and follow issues through to resolution



Requirements

• Experience with data analysis, reporting, or operational performance tracking

• Strong Google Sheets or Microsoft Excel skills

• High attention to detail and consistency

• Strong written and spoken English communication

• Comfortable communicating professionally with drivers using structured templates

• Able to work independently and organize information clearly



Tools & Systems Used

• LMDmax platform for template-based driver coaching communication

• Google Sheets and Microsoft Excel for performance tracking and reporting

• Attendance point tracking system and coaching templates

• DSP portal for dispute tracking and issue resolution



Important Notes

• This is a full-time, long-term role performed remotely

• Paid hourly as an independent contractor (not an employee)

• Work must be performed personally (no subcontracting)

• Single-client role only

• This role provides reporting and operational support; leadership retains final decision-making authority

title: Full-Time Nightlife Content Editor (Reels, Video & Graphics)
description:
About the Role



We are looking for a full-time Content Editor Virtual Assistant to support the social media and content output of a busy nightclub and events brand in Australia.



This role is content-first.



Your primary responsibility is editing high-energy nightlife content — short-form videos, reels, stories, and graphics — that capture the atmosphere of parties, DJs, crowds, and events.



If you do not have experience editing nightclub, party, or event content, this role is not a good fit.



This Role Is Content-First (Important)



This is not a general marketing VA role.



The priority is:



Video editing for Reels / Shorts / TikTok



Nightclub-style graphics and story content



Turning raw footage into engaging social content



Everything else is secondary.



Key Responsibilities

Primary Responsibilities (Core Focus)



Editing short-form videos for Instagram Reels, TikTok, and Stories



Cutting long event footage into multiple short clips



Adding subtitles, captions, emojis, and effects



Editing fast-paced, high-energy nightlife content



Creating simple but bold graphics for events, stories, and promos



Formatting content correctly for each platform



Secondary Responsibilities (Support Tasks)



Organising photos and videos in Google Drive



Tracking content in a content calendar



Preparing content for scheduling



Following briefs and deadlines provided by the marketing team



(No paid ads management. No strategy required.)



Required Experience (Non-Negotiable)



To be considered, you must have:



Experience editing nightclub, party, DJ, festival, or live event content



Strong short-form video editing skills (Reels/TikTok style)



Ability to edit content that feels energetic, modern, and social-first



Experience using tools such as CapCut, Premiere Pro, Final Cut, or similar



Basic graphic design ability (Canva or similar)



If you only have corporate, fitness, real estate, or talking-head content — do not apply.



Tools You’ll Use



CapCut, Premiere Pro, Final Cut, or similar



Canva



Google Drive



ClickUp (task management)



Working Hours & Pay



Full-time role



Some overlap with Australian business hours preferred



Salary: $1,200 AUD per month



Long-term position for the right person



How to Apply (Important – Read Carefully)



To apply, you must include:



A short introduction about yourself



Links to examples of nightclub, party, or event content you have edited



The tools you used to create those examples



Your internet speed and equipment setup



Applications without relevant nightlife/event samples will not be considered.



To confirm you’ve read this job description, include the word “FREQUENCY” in the first line of your application.

title: GTM Engineer (Outbound/Clay/Cold Email)
description:
GTM Engineer - Cold
 & Revenue Operations



About GenFlows Agency

GenFlows Agency is a B2B outbound lead generation agency specializing in GTM engineering and revenue operations. As a Clay Partner, we help ambitious B2B companies scale their outbound efforts through sophisticated data enrichment, workflow automation, and multi-channel campaigns. We operate on a "teach to fish" philosophy - building systems that empower our clients rather than creating dependency.



The Role

We're looking for a GTM Engineer who combines technical automation skills with creative campaign thinking. You'll be responsible for building and executing end-to-end outbound campaigns for our clients - from ICP definition and lead sourcing to Clay table architecture and conversion-optimized copywriting.

This isn't just a "set it and forget it" role. You'll own the full campaign lifecycle, constantly iterating on data sources, enrichment strategies, and messaging to drive qualified pipeline for clients across SaaS, manufacturing, fintech, and professional services sectors.



What You'll Do

Campaign Architecture & Execution

Design and build multi-channel outbound campaigns from scratch using Clay as the central orchestration platform

Structure complex Clay tables with advanced enrichment waterfalls, conditional logic, and data quality controls

Set up and manage
 infrastructure (domain warming, deliverability monitoring, inbox rotation)

Integrate campaigns with client tech stacks (HubSpot, Salesforce, Smartlead, HeyReach, etc.)



Lead Generation & Data Operations

Define and validate ICPs through research and data analysis

Source high-quality leads using Apollo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and other prospecting tools

Build sophisticated enrichment workflows combining 10+ data providers for comprehensive account intelligence

Maintain data hygiene and ensure compliance with
 regulations



Copywriting & Messaging

Write compelling cold
 copy that drives responses (not just opens)

Develop multi-step sequences tailored to specific industries and personas

A/B test subject lines, messaging angles, and CTAs to optimize campaign performance

Adapt voice and tone to match client brands while maintaining conversion focus



Performance Optimization

Monitor campaign metrics (open rates, reply rates, positive response rates, meeting bookings)

Troubleshoot deliverability issues and optimize sender reputation

Iterate on targeting, messaging, and cadence based on performance data

Provide strategic recommendations for campaign improvements



Who You Are



Required Experience

6+ months of hands-on experience with Clay (building tables, not just watching tutorials)

Proven track record running successful cold
 campaigns with measurable results

Strong copywriting skills with portfolio examples of high-performing cold outreach

Experience with B2B lead generation tools (Apollo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo, etc.)

Technical proficiency with APIs, webhooks, and campaign automation tools (Smartlead, Instantly, Lemlist, etc.)

Understanding of
 deliverability, SPF/DKIM/DMARC, and inbox warming strategies



Ideal Background

Experience working with multiple industries and adapting campaigns to different buyer personas

Knowledge of CRM systems (HubSpot, Salesforce) and marketing automation platforms

Familiarity with data enrichment providers (Clearbit, Prospeo, Hunter, People Data Labs, etc.)

Comfortable working directly with clients and explaining technical concepts clearly

Self-directed problem-solver who can navigate ambiguity and find creative solutions



Bonus Points

Experience in revenue operations or sales development roles

Understanding of manufacturing, SaaS, or fintech sectors

Fluent in English

Active in the Clay community or RevOps communities

Experience with AI-powered personalization and enrichment

title: Remote F&B Cost Controller
description:
Here's a professional job description for this position:



FOOD & BEVERAGE COST CONTROLLER

Location:  (Remote)

Reports To: Director of Finance / General Manager

Employment Type: Full-time

Industry: Hospitality / Food & Beverage



POSITION OVERVIEW

We are seeking an experienced Food & Beverage Cost Controller with a strong hospitality background to manage all aspects of F&B cost analysis, vendor sourcing, inventory control, and financial reporting. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience in food and beverage operations, preferably from a quality hotel or resort environment such as Hyatt, Raffles, or similar luxury hospitality brands.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Accounts Payable & Invoice Management



Enter and process all food and beverage invoices with accuracy and timeliness

Maintain organized records of all vendor transactions and payment schedules

Reconcile invoices against purchase orders and delivery receipts



Vendor Management & Strategic Sourcing



Research and identify competitive pricing by soliciting quotes from all approved vendors via

Source quality produce from US, Philippines, and other international markets

Negotiate pricing and terms with suppliers to optimize cost savings

Evaluate new vendor opportunities and maintain strong supplier relationships

Monitor market trends and recommend sourcing alternatives



Recipe Costing & Menu Analysis



Manage and maintain recipe costs in Accounting & Micros POS system

Update ingredient costs regularly based on current vendor pricing

Calculate and analyze menu item profitability

Provide recommendations for menu pricing adjustments based on cost analysis



Cost Analysis & Reporting



Produce monthly theoretical versus actual cost comparison reports for food and beverage

Identify and investigate variances between theoretical and actual costs

Analyze food and beverage cost percentages and prepare detailed variance reports

Generate actionable insights to reduce waste and improve profitability



Liquor Inventory & Control



Collaborate on liquor inventory management and control procedures

Analyze weekly bottle weighing data provided by local team

Prepare monthly liquor cost analysis and variance reports

Identify discrepancies and recommend corrective actions for inventory shrinkage



General



Support the finance team with ad hoc cost analysis and special projects

Ensure compliance with all accounting policies and procedures

Maintain confidentiality of all financial and proprietary information





QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS

Required:



Education: Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Hospitality Management, or Culinary Arts

Experience: Minimum 3-5 years in food and beverage cost control, preferably in a hotel or resort setting

Industry Background: Experience with quality hospitality organizations (Hyatt, Raffles, Marriott, Four Seasons, or equivalent luxury brands strongly preferred)

Technical Skills:



Proficiency in Micros POS system (recipe costing module)

Advanced Microsoft Excel skills (pivot tables, VLOOKUP, formulas)

Strong accounting and bookkeeping knowledge

Experience with accounts payable systems







Highly Preferred:



Former chef or culinary professional with transition to cost control

Certified Public Accountant (CPA) or pursuing CPA certification

Experience in multi-unit food and beverage operations

Knowledge of international food sourcing and import/export processes



Skills & Competencies:



Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities

Excellent attention to detail and accuracy

Superior written and verbal communication skills in English

Ability to work independently with minimal supervision

Proactive mindset with ability to identify cost-saving opportunities

Strong organizational and time management skills

Proficiency in vendor negotiation and relationship management

Understanding of food and beverage operations, purchasing, and inventory management





WHAT WE OFFER



Competitive salary commensurate with experience

Remote work flexibility

Opportunity to work with an established hospitality operation

Professional growth and development opportunities

Collaborative team environment

description:

title: Fashion Brand Curator & Shopify Specialist (French-Inspired Women’s Fashion)
description:
About the Brand



Fashion Coquette is a French-inspired women’s fashion brand focused on effortless elegance, soft femininity, and modern confidence.

We curate chic, wearable pieces that look expensive without luxury prices, inspired by Parisian brands and modern minimalism.



This is not a generic dropshipping store.

This is a carefully curated brand where taste, restraint, and visual consistency matter.



The Role

We are looking for a fashion-minded Shopify specialist who can help execute and protect the Fashion Coquette brand vision.

This role goes beyond technical tasks.

You will be curating a wardrobe, not importing random products.

If you love women’s fashion, aesthetics, and clean design — you’ll thrive here.



Key Responsibilities

1. Product Curation (Core Responsibility)

Select women’s fashion products from Trendsi (U.S. warehouse only)

Approve or reject products based on brand guidelines



Ensure every item fits one of our collections:

Paris Weekend

Coquette Essentials

Minimal Luxe

Night Out in NYC

Vacation Chic



2. Shopify Product & Collection Management

Import products cleanly into Shopify

Organize products into collections and categories

Maintain consistent product titles and descriptions

Ensure product pages look premium and editorial



3. Brand & Visual Consistency

Review product images and reject off-brand visuals

Maintain a clean, minimalist, French-inspired aesthetic

Support homepage and collection layouts with the right products



This Job Is NOT For You If:

You import products just to fill a store

You prefer quantity over curation

You’ve only worked on cheap-looking dropshipping stores

You don’t care about fashion aesthetics



Required Skills & Qualities

Strong eye for women’s fashion & aesthetics

Shopify experience (products, collections, basic theme editing)



Ability to follow brand rules and exercise good judgment

Detail-oriented and organized

Comfortable working with visual guidelines and moodboards

Big Plus (but not required):

Background in fashion, styling, or visual merchandising

Experience with fashion suppliers (Trendsi is a plus)

Ability to write clean, elegant product titles

Work Setup

Remote



Part-time to start (with possibility to grow)

Long-term role for the right person



IMPORTANT: Test Task (Required to Apply)

To apply, please complete this short task:



From an online fashion supplier (example: Trendsi),

choose 3–5 women’s fashion items that you believe fit a French-inspired, feminine, minimalist brand.

Briefly explain why each item fits the brand and which collection it belongs to.

We are building a real brand and value taste and judgment as much as technical skills.

title: Experienced Project Manager (Amazon FBA | Full-Time)
description:
Join a Fast-Growing E-Commerce Brand Based in Singapore



We’re a fast-growing Singapore-based Amazon FBA brand, and we’re looking for a strong Amazon Project Manager to help us scale.



This is not a coordinator role.

You’ll be managing people, systems, and execution across our Amazon operations.



We’re looking for someone who already knows the Amazon backend and can operate independently without being hand-held.



What you’ll be doing



You’ll manage a team of around 6 people across listings, design, and operations.



You’ll coordinate shipping plans with suppliers, freight forwarders, and inspection agents.

You’ll review and improve product listings, making sure keywords, images, and backend data are correct.

You’ll track inventory, sales, and campaigns, and keep our spreadsheets and dashboards accurate.

You’ll work closely with our design, listing, and ops teams to keep launches and updates on track.



You’ll take part in internal training, including AI-powered workflows.

AI is a tool, not a crutch. We expect you to use it to think better, work faster, and improve outcomes, not to blindly paste output.



You’ll help plan projects, improve processes, and make sure details like product size tiers and listing data are correct before they cost us money.



Tools you’ll use



Amazon Seller Central

Google Sheets and Docs

Notion

Helium 10

DataDive

Zoom



What we’re looking for



At least 5 years of relevant experience, ideally in Amazon FBA or e-commerce operations.

Real experience with Amazon listings, inventory tracking, and backend workflows.

Strong attention to detail and the ability to communicate clearly with different teams.

Able to work independently, prioritise well, and adapt when things change.

Strong problem-solving, coordination, and analytical skills.

Proactive, open-minded, and able to work well in a fast-moving team.



Working hours



Monday to Friday, 12 PM to 10 PM Singapore time

1 hour break

Remote, 44 hours per week



How to apply



Please include:



A short introduction about yourself and why you’re a good fit

Links or references to past Amazon FBA work

A brief explanation of your most recent role

A short video introduction if possible

Clear details of your Amazon FBA experience



Important



Only candidates with real Amazon FBA experience will be considered.

Applications without references or relevant background will be ignored.

If you are new to Amazon or need training, this is not the right role for you.

title: Media Buyer / Creative Strategist (Appointment Generation)
description:
PLEASE READ EVERYTHING BELOW CAREFULLY



Media Buyer (Meta Ads) – Lead & Appointment Generation for Medspas



Remote | $1.5K Base (Subject to Experience) + % Commission on Performance



About the Role

We're looking for a Media Buyer with a performance-driven mindset to run Meta 
 & Instagram) ad campaigns that generate high-quality leads and booked appointments for medspas. Beyond just running ads, you'll be responsible for landing page creation (GHL), pixel tracking, and collaborating with the appointment-setting team to maximize conversion rates.



If you're someone who understands not just ad buying but also full-funnel optimization - from ad creative to appointment booking - this role is for you.



Responsibilities



- Plan, launch, and optimize Meta ad campaigns to generate high-quality medspa leads and appointments

- Build, edit, and optimize landing pages in HighLevel (GHL) to improve conversion rates

- Set up and troubleshoot pixel tracking & events (Meta Pixel, Google Tag Manager, UTM tracking, etc.)

- Collaborate with the appointment-setting team to analyze lead quality and refine targeting, ad copy, and funnels

- Optimize CPL, CPA, and booking rates through data analysis and A/B testing

- Create and edit graphics and short-form videos for ads (basic video editing & Canva-level design)

- Stay ahead of Meta's policies, trends, and ad strategies to maintain compliance and improve results





You'll Need to Understand



- Why a $15 CPL that no one answers is worse than a $30 CPL that books 50%

- How ad copy and offer positioning affect lead quality downstream

- The difference between leads who ghost and leads who text in ready to book

- How speed to lead, call timing, and follow-up sequences interact with ad performance

- Why some geographic markets produce high-intent leads and others don't

- How to pre-qualify leads in the ad/funnel to reduce tire-kickers





Requirements



- Proven experience running lead gen & appointment-setting Meta ad campaigns for medspas, health, aesthetics, or similar industries

- Proficiency with GoHighLevel (GHL) for landing page builds and funnel optimization

- Technical ability to install and troubleshoot tracking pixels, UTM parameters, and event tracking

- Experience optimizing for lead-to-appointment conversion, not just cheap leads

- Basic video editing & graphic design skills for ad creatives (e.g., Premiere Pro, CapCut, Canva, Figma)

- Data-driven approach—comfortable analyzing campaign performance and making real-time optimizations

- Excellent communication and ability to collaborate with appointment setters to ensure quality leads convert into bookings

- Available during US business hours (EST) or significant overlap





Ideal Background



- Worked at a lead gen agency where you were accountable for booked calls, not just leads

- Experience with local service businesses (medspa, dental, home services, etc.)

- Managed appointment-setting teams or worked closely with call centers

- Built systems and templates that scale across multiple clients

- Follows direct response marketers like Alex Hormozi or similar





This Role is NOT For You If



- You think your job ends when the lead comes in

- You only know how to follow templates without understanding why they work

- You've only run e-commerce or brand campaigns

- You blame the call center when leads don't convert without investigating why





Compensation & Perks

- $1.5K Base Salary (subject to experience) + % Commission on Performance

- Performance-based incentives: your results directly impact your earnings

- Remote & flexible work environment

- Career growth opportunities in a fast-scaling agency



How to Apply



If you're a full-funnel media buyer who understands that getting leads is just half the battle and optimizing for actual booked appointments is the real game then we want to hear from you - apply here

Part time potential to full time after few weeks



TO APPLY: Please include your resume link. Only candidates with real estate VA experience will be considered.

title: Marketing Virtual Assistant (Lead Generation Focus)
description:
Marketing Operations Support Virtual Assistant (Lead Generation Focus)



Full-Time | Remote | Contract-Based



I’m looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Marketing Operations Support Virtual Assistant with strong lead generation and marketing support experience. This role is critical to supporting day-to-day marketing operations, improving lead flow, and keeping systems running smoothly. You’ll work closely with leadership and the project manager and directly support core growth activities.



This is not a Personal Assistant or Executive Assistant role. It’s a hands-on marketing ops + lead gen support position.



Role Overview



Your primary responsibility will be lead generation through Upwork and LinkedIn, supported by structured workflows, AI-assisted processes, and clear performance targets. You’ll also assist with light backend operations, reporting, and content ideation using documented systems.



Once trained, you’re expected to work independently, think critically, and execute with consistency.



Key Responsibilities (Summary)



1. Upwork Lead Generation (Top Priority)



Monitor Upwork for relevant opportunities aligned with target client profiles



Draft and submit high-quality proposals using provided templates and brand voice



Use AI tools to personalize proposals efficiently (not copy-paste)



Track proposal performance and provide weekly insights on results



2. LinkedIn Engagement & Lead Support



Post thoughtful, AI-assisted comments daily using curated content feeds



Review and refine AI-generated drafts to maintain an authentic voice



Track engagement trends and submit weekly summaries



3. Lead Data Management & Reporting



Clean, verify, and maintain lead data in Google Sheets



Complete follow-up and performance reports with zero missing fields



Flag data or quality issues immediately



4. AI-Assisted Content Ideation (Light Task)



Review shared articles and videos via Slack



Extract insights using guided AI prompts



Create content idea outlines using provided templates



5. Backend Operations Support



Manage personal tasks in the project management system



Provide light operational and workflow support as needed



Tools You’ll Use



Upwork (essential)



LinkedIn



AI Tools: ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, Perplexity



Google Workspace: Google Sheets, Docs, Gmail, Calendar



Slack



Motion (or similar task/project management tool)



Required Skills & Experience



Minimum of 3 years proven work experience as a Virtual Assistant supporting marketing agencies or B2B service-based companies



Hands-on experience in lead generation, marketing operations, and workflow support



Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to think through processes and resolve issues independently



Advanced comfort using AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, Perplexity) for drafting, research, and productivity



Ability to follow documented processes precisely while understanding the purpose behind each workflow



Excellent written English with professional grammar and communication skills



Extremely detail-oriented with high accuracy in data entry, reporting, and submissions



Self-directed work style; able to execute independently after training



Reliable internet connection and professional remote work setup



What Makes You a Strong Fit



You troubleshoot instead of stalling when something isn’t clear



You use AI strategically, not blindly



You notice patterns and suggest small process improvements



You communicate proactively and flag issues early



You value consistency, accuracy, and accountability



Application Requirements (Important)



To be considered, please submit all of the following:



Updated Resume / CV



Portfolio (if applicable to marketing, lead gen, or ops work)



2-minute self-introduction video explaining your experience and why you’re a good fit for this Marketing Operations & Lead Gen VA role



Applications missing any of the above will not be prioritized.

title: Amazon FBA Virtual Assistant (Amazon Account Management & PPC)
description:
Job Title: Amazon FBA Virtual Assistant (Amazon Account Management & PPC)

Company: Woolbuddy

Work Setup: Remote / Work From Home

Employment Type: Full-Time



About the Role

Woolbuddy is looking for an experienced Amazon FBA Virtual Assistant who can fully manage our Amazon account and PPC campaigns from day one.

This role is not for beginners or trainees. We need someone with proven, hands-on experience who can confidently take over account management, optimize listings, and run PPC without close supervision.

If you already know Amazon Seller Central inside and out and can jump in immediately, we’d love to hear from you.



Key Responsibilities

Manage day-to-day operations in Amazon Seller Central

Create, optimize, and improve Amazon listings (SEO-focused)

Set up, manage, and optimize Amazon PPC campaigns

Monitor and manage inventory levels (FBA & FBM)

Coordinate shipping and fulfillment

Assist with product launches and promotions

Analyze sales performance, PPC data, and prepare reports

Stay updated with Amazon policies and best practices

Handle customer messages and basic account support

Complete tasks assigned by the supervisor



Requirements (IMPORTANT – Please Read)

Minimum 2 years of proven experience as an Amazon VA

Strong, hands-on experience managing a US Amazon Seller Central account

Proven experience running and optimizing Amazon PPC campaigns

Experience with inventory management (FBA & FBM)

Proven experience working with Helium 10, Sellerboard,etc.

Excellent communication and time management skills

Highly organized, detail-oriented, and dependable

Able to start immediately and work with minimal supervision



???? Applicants without direct Amazon Seller Central and PPC experience should NOT apply.

We are specifically looking for someone who can take over immediately, not someone who needs training.



What We Offer

Competitive pay based on experience and performance

Long-term, stable employment

Supportive and collaborative work environment

Opportunities for growth and skill development



Trial Period

There will be a paid 90-day trial period for both parties to ensure a good fit. If successful, this will transition into a long-term, full-time role.



How to Apply

Serious applicants only.

If you have solid experience managing Amazon Seller Central and PPC, please complete the application form below:





We’re excited to work with someone who’s ready to jump in and grow with Woolbuddy long-term.

title: Virtual HubSpot Marketing & Sales Operations Assistant
description:
The Virtual HubSpot Marketing & Sales Operations Assistant is responsible for day-to-day execution and management of HubSpot across Marketing Hub Professional, Content Hub Professional, and Sales Hub Professional. This role owns campaign execution, automation, CRM hygiene, and performance reporting to support lead generation, nurturing, and revenue growth.



This is a doer role—not strategy only. The assistant will actively build, publish, automate, track, and optimize HubSpot assets that directly impact marketing ROI and sales pipeline performance.



Core Platforms Managed

HubSpot Marketing Hub Professional

HubSpot Content Hub Professional

HubSpot Sales Hub Professional



Key Responsibilities



1. Marketing Hub Professional (Campaigns & Automation)

Build and manage marketing campaigns inside HubSpot

Connect and manage social media accounts (posting, scheduling, campaign tagging)

Create and maintain automated workflows for:

 -Lead follow-ups

 -Lead nurturing sequences

 -Re-engagement campaigns

Configure and monitor lead scoring models

Track and report on marketing ROI, attribution, and conversion metrics

Ensure proper UTM tracking and campaign organization

Create and update:

 
 templates

 -Marketing
s

Use HubSpot AI tools to assist with copy, subject lines, and content optimization

Ensure brand consistency across all templates and assets

Organize content libraries and naming conventions for scalability

Maintain compliance with CAN-SPAM, unsubscribe rules, and
 best practices

 -Contact, company, deal, and pipeline cleanliness

 -Sales pipelines

Build and maintain sales dashboards showing:

 -Pipeline health

Support sales reps with sequences, templates, and workflow automation



4. Reporting & Performance Tracking

 -Marketing performance

 -Funnel conversion rates

Deliver weekly and monthly performance summaries

Identify bottlenecks in lead flow and sales pipeline

Flag data or automation issues proactively



5. Process & Systems Ownership

Own HubSpot day-to-day operations

Document workflows and automation logic

Maintain SOPs for campaigns, pipelines, and reporting

Ensure smooth handoffs between marketing and sales teams

Coordinate with leadership on priorities and execution timelines



Required Skills & Experience



Technical Requirements

 -Proven hands-on experience with HubSpot (Marketing, Content, and/or Sales Hubs)



Experience building:

 -Workflows and automations

 
 campaigns and templates

 -Dashboards and reports

Professional Skills



-Highly organized and detail-oriented

-Strong written English (for
s, forms, and content)

title: Video Games | Influencer Lead Generator
description:
We are currently searching for a self-starting and results-driven Influencer Lead Generator. Our agency is a small team with a strong passion for games and making indie games successful. We have a very diverse team of international employees working remotely.



We strive to always go through all depths to ensure all our clients are fully taken care of. Our vision is to be the go-to agency for indie game’s needs in Community Management, Social Media Management, Marketing, and the like.



We have worked with games such as Black Mesa, Escape from Tarkov, KovaaK’s, Deceit, Paint the Town Red, Walkabout Minigolf, and many others we are proud to continue to support.



As an Influencer Lead Generator, you would be responsible for the gathering and maintenance of game’s press and influencer (YouTube, Twitch, etc.) contact lists, executing mass
 sendouts, supporting Team Leads with meeting client coverage KPIs, and more.





Influencer Lead Generator Job Responsibilities:



* Conduct research to identify new influencer and press contacts, and upcoming game coverage opportunities.

* Create and review press and influencer lists for each title regularly, working with the Head of Operations to find areas of improvement to strengthen game outreaches.

* Source new press and influencer contacts through social media, website, and game streaming channels, keeping your lists up-to-date and ready for using.

* Spend time researching the latest influencer trends, features, and topics of conversation, as well as game releases, to find ways we can pitch our titles to press and influencers.

* Attend a weekly meeting with the Head of Operations to go through work performance and strategy.

* Organize regular meetings with Team Leads to establish weekly list KPIs and get feedback.



This role is fully remote, and the right candidate is expected to work full time while managing their schedule of 40 hours per week.



Influencer Lead Generator Qualifications / Skills:



* Motivation for perfection

* Prospecting skills: be able to identify potential press/influencer contacts and build lists quickly.

* Meeting the client and Team Lead’s needs: You do not try to make a list that the client does not need, but instead, you identify the type of press/influencer asked for first and offer just that.

* Google Sheets: You are a spreadsheet whizz, and know how to build your lists as quickly, and efficiently, as possible.

* Influencer knowledge: You are a gamer by night and spend hours during the day working or learning about the video game industry and the leading content creators.

* Communication skills: presenting your lists to both the Head of Operations and the Team Leads

* Energy level: Building lists can be repetitive to some, but this prospect thrills and motivates you. Efficient, yet eager each day.

* Professionalism: you uphold yourself to the highest standard across all our channels, do not engage in negativity, and continue to push through with a great attitude.

* Strong command of writing and speaking in English.



We are looking for a self-driven, self-starter and never settle for a lesser type of unicorn!



Education and Experience Requirements:



* While traditional education is admirable, we want to see research, data gathering and lead generation experience more than anything.

* Some experience in a PR/video games/agency or administrative position, doing similar tasks, preferred.

* Other experiences in video game development, influencer management, or marketing are a major plus as you will be more knowledgeable of the gaming influencer and press publications.



Does this sound like you? Let’s talk further! Use the link below to apply: 
/to/XW7XP9YZ

(Applications NOT submitted via the above link will NOT be considered)

title: Shopify Store Setup Specialist (Google Merchant Center Compliance)
description:
ABOUT THE COMPANY



BJ-Ecom B.V. is a fast-growing e-commerce company running multiple Shopify stores across Europe and North America. We're a fully remote team of 20+ people, and we're scaling fast toward 2026.



We need someone who can build the foundation of every store we launch — accurately, consistently, and on schedule.



-----



THE ROLE



This is NOT a general Shopify, CRO, or marketing role.



Your one job: Build new Shopify stores from scratch that are 100% ready for Google Merchant Center (GMC) approval.



You'll use our templates, SOPs, and checklists. You'll build 5-7 stores per week. Every store must be compliant, complete, and error-free.



If you love structured work and take pride in getting every detail right, this role is for you.



-----



WHAT YOU'LL DO



- Build new Shopify stores from scratch using our templates

- Set up store structure, pages, navigation, policies, and settings based on our checklists

- Ensure every store meets Google Merchant Center requirements

- Prepare stores for GMC submission with zero missing elements

- Follow SOPs exactly and document your work

- Run quality checks before handing off each store



-----



WHO WE'RE LOOKING FOR



- You're extremely detail-oriented — you catch mistakes others miss

- You follow instructions, templates, and checklists precisely

- You're fast, but never at the cost of accuracy

- You work well independently in a remote setup



-----



REQUIREMENTS



- Experience setting up Shopify stores from scratch

- Strong knowledge of Shopify settings, pages, policies, and structure

- Familiarity with Google Merchant Center requirements

- Ability to deliver error-free work consistently and at scale



-----



PERFORMANCE EXPECTATIONS



- 5-7 fully built Shopify stores per week

- Every store passes internal compliance checks

- Every store is GMC submission-ready with no issues



-----



WHAT WE OFFER



- 100% remote position

- Long-term work with a growing company

- Competitive pay based on experience and performance



-----



HOW TO APPLY



Please include:



1. Your resume

2. A short note on why detail-oriented, structured work suits you

3. Examples of Shopify stores you've built (if available)

4. Your expected salary (monthly, in PHP or USD)



-----



If you enjoy building things correctly, consistently, and by the book — we want to hear from you.

title: Digital Marketing Assistant - Facebook/Meta Ads
description:
We’re an eCommerce company based in the US looking to hire a Digital Marketing Assistant to support the execution and day-to-day operations of our paid advertising across multiple platforms like
 and 
. This role focuses on accurately launching and managing ads, maintaining trackers and reports, and handling supporting tasks that keep our ad accounts running smoothly.



You won’t be creating strategy or optimizing performance — your role is to execute launches, updates, and changes cleanly and accurately based on documented processes.



What You’ll Be Doing 

Paid Ads Execution & Account Support

- Execute ad launches, updates and duplication across Meta 
) Ads Manager and AppLovin based on documented SOPs. Ensure settings, budgets, creatives, links, and naming conventions are applied accurately.



Reporting & Tracking

- Maintain daily and weekly reports, update internal trackers, and support basic performance monitoring using Google Sheets and internal tools.



Ongoing Marketing Operations

- Handle recurring operational tasks that support the paid ads workflow, such as account hygiene, checks, submissions, testing, and coordination tasks, as assigned.



Process-Based Execution

- Follow instructions and SOPs precisely, communicate clearly, and consistently double-check work to avoid errors.



You’re a Great Fit If You

- 1+ year of recent, hands-on experience launching
 ads (confident navigating
 Ads Manager without guidance) 

- Reliable internet speed and computer (downloading and uploading creative files) 

- Extremely detail-oriented and double check your work (budgets are live, mistakes can be costly) 

- Able to execute tasks quickly and accurately (can follow instructions exactly without improvising 

- Are reliable and consistent week after week

- Communicate clearly in English and don’t need to be chased (enthusiastic and positive attitude) 



What We Offer

- Fully remove, long-term role 

- Flexible hours as long as work is completed 

- Clear SOPs + Loom videos for every task

- No pressure to “figure things out” — execution > strategy

- Long-term role with growth potential if you want more responsibility



Application

Note: Applications will only be reviewed if all requirements are fulfilled. 

Start your response with “MARKETING!” to show you’ve read through the whole job post

Include your CV 

Brief answer to the following questions; 

1) Tell us about your most recent job. What did you mainly work on and what were some challenges you faced? 

2) Have you worked in accounts with high daily ad spend? (Yes/No - explain briefly) 

3) Tell us about the campaigns you handled, tools you used, your process



Shortlisted candidates will need to complete an online task that should take no more than 30 minutes.  



If you like structured work, clear instructions, and being trusted with important tasks — we’d love to hear from you.

title: Property Management Administrative Assistant
description:
A Real Estate looking for an organized and proactive Property Management Administrative Assistant to support our property management operations. This role centers on managing maintenance requests, coordinating with vendors, and keeping our property operations running efficiently using AppFolio CRM.



Your Core Responsibilities:



Primary Focus - Property Management (80% of your work):



– Manage maintenance requests and work orders through AppFolio CRM

– Coordinate with vendors and contractors for timely property repairs

– Schedule maintenance appointments and track completion

– Communicate professionally with tenants via AppFolio messaging and WhatsApp

– Maintain organized records of all property management activities

– Handle day-to-day administrative tasks for property operations

– Respond to emergency maintenance situations when they arise (including outside regular hours - paid separately)



Secondary Focus - Real Estate Support (20% of your work):



– Assist with marketing property listings

– Support lead conversion activities using GoHighLevel (training provided)

– Help maintain communication with potential clients and tenants



We're Looking for Someone Who:



– Has working experience with AppFolio CRM (basic level is fine)

– Communicates clearly and professionally in English (written and spoken)

– Stays organized and pays attention to important details

– Can handle unexpected situations proactively

– Works well in a fast-paced property management environment

– Is available for emergency on-call situations outside regular hours



Bonus Points For:



– Previous experience in property management or real estate administration

– Familiarity with GoHighLevel platform

– Comfort using WhatsApp for business communication

– Understanding of maintenance coordination and vendor management



About us:



We're a full-service real estate and property management company based in Virginia Beach, serving the Hampton Roads region. We handle everything from property sales to comprehensive property management, including tenant services, maintenance coordination, and property operations. Our team is professional, collaborative, and focused on delivering quality service to property owners and tenants.



Why This Role Matters:



Property management success depends on reliable systems and responsive service. You'll play a key role in ensuring maintenance issues are resolved quickly, tenants are well-served, and property operations run smoothly. Your work directly impacts property values and tenant satisfaction.



Why You'll Love Working Here:



– Work with an established property management company with solid operations

– Gain valuable experience in the US real estate industry

– Enjoy part-time flexibility with clear working hours

– Remote work with a supportive team

– Build practical skills in property management and real estate operations



Ready to bring your AppFolio experience and organizational skills to our property management team?

Apply now and help us deliver excellent service to our property owners and tenants.

title: Paralegal / Legal Assistant – Property, Tenancy & Dispute Support (Sydney-Based Business)
description:
We are a Sydney-based Australian property, real estate, and finance business seeking a reliable and detail-driven Paralegal / Legal Assistant to support a range of practical legal matters.



This role involves assisting with day-to-day legal work across property, tenancy, contract, and dispute matters. You will help prepare documents for NCAT and the Local Court, as well as assist with lease documentation and sales-related agreements.



This is not a theoretical or academic role. You will be working with real matters, real deadlines, and real consequences. Precision, structure, and professionalism are essential.



SCOPE OF WORK



You will assist with basic legal matters, including but not limited to:



Residential tenancy matters (leases, notices, breaches, disputes)



Disputes with contractors and third parties



NCAT and Local Court preparation support



Drafting and organising documents in the format required by courts and tribunals



Preparing document bundles (indexed, paginated, compliant)



Drafting and reviewing leases and sales-related agreements



Reviewing contracts, notices, and legal correspondence



Legal research and summarising findings clearly



Managing deadlines, follow-ups, and case file organisation



You will not be providing legal advice. Your role is support, preparation, structure, and execution.



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE (NON-NEGOTIABLE)



Proven experience as a Paralegal or Legal Assistant



Strong written English with professional legal formatting



Hands-on experience preparing legal documents



High attention to detail and document accuracy



Ability to follow instructions exactly and meet deadlines



Comfortable handling confidential and sensitive material



HIGHLY REGARDED



Experience with property law, tenancy, or real estate matters



Experience assisting with NCAT, Local Court, or tribunal-style matters



Familiarity with Australian or common-law legal systems



Law degree, JD, or currently studying law (with practical exposure)



WORK CONDITIONS



Remote role supporting a Sydney (Australia) based business



Part-time to Full-time (initially 4–6 hours/day, with scope to increase)



Long-term position for the right candidate



Clear instructions, systems, and expectations



High trust, high accountability — no micromanagement



COMPENSATION



Pay depending on experience and capability



Increases based on performance, reliability, and quality of work

title: Medical Records Specialist
description:
Description

We are looking for a Medical Records Specialist to assist with managing and processing requests for patient medical records in compliance with HIPAA and organisational policies. Ensures timely, accurate, and confidential handling of all records requests.



Key Responsibilities:

Receive, verify, and process medical records requests from patients, providers, and insurance companies.

Retrieve and securely transmit records internally and externally.

Maintain accurate documentation of all requests and communications.

Ensure compliance with HIPAA and privacy regulations.



Requirements:

High school diploma or equivalent; healthcare or health information experience preferred.

Knowledge of HIPAA and patient privacy practices.

Strong organizational and communication skills.

Attention to detail and ability to manage multiple requests.



Minimum Technical and Work Environment Requirements:



Internet Connection:

Primary internet connection with a minimum speed of 15 Mbps.

Backup internet connection with at least 10 Mbps.

Backup connection must be capable of supporting work during a power outage.

Primary Device:

Desktop or laptop equipped with at least:

Intel Core i5 (8th generation or newer), Intel Core i3 (10th generation or newer), AMD Ryzen 5, or an equivalent processor.

A minimum of 8 GB RAM.



Backup Device:

Must meet or exceed the performance of an Intel Core i3 processor.

Must be functional during power interruptions.

A functioning webcam.

A noise-canceling USB headset.

A quiet, dedicated home office space.

Peripherals and Workspace: A smartphone for communication and verification purposes.

title: Administrative Support and Specialist
description:
We’re looking for an Administrative Agent to help support our sales and recruiting teams. This is an entry-level position that is eligible for promotion after 12 months of tenure.



***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********



You will fail the application process if you don't read the entire job description.



***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********





About Us



Started in 2017, and we're growing like crazy.

We expect to hire at least 4 salespeople, 3 admins, and 3 marketers in 2026.

Growing FAST - We sold 2663 lessons in 2025 and we're on pace to sell 3328 lessons in 2026

A small team of 1 American and 10 Filipinos.

We sell manual transmission driving lessons in the United States. Yes, really.

100% inbound leads from Organic Search (SEO). We don’t do cold calling.

No competition - in 90% of the markets we serve, we have no competitors. Because of this, our sale is pretty easy to make.





Compensation and Benefits

Competitive commission package - $3.50 per hour

Paid 5 Sick Days - Effective on day 1

Paid 10 days vacation - Prorated

Paid 14 Bank holidays - (Legal and religious Holidays are country-specific)

Paid Birthday Off - you pick a day off

Business Continuity Plan - In cases of calamity $40 hotel accommodations are permitted to ensure work will continue



Type of Employment

Full Time

40 hours per week

Schedule - 9 AM to 5 PM EST



Benefits to be provided after completion of 3 months:

Health Insurance

Office equipment, home office furniture, and anything else you need for work

Learning books, courses, training, or coaching that you want



Benefits to be provided after completion of one year:

Paid two weeks off for the Christmas Season



Entry Level Details

Note that this is an entry-level job.

We do NOT expect you to have any prior sales experience.

If you’re looking to switch careers and get your foot in the door, this could be great for you.

This is a great opportunity for anyone with a background in any of the following areas: Customer Service, VA Admin, Admin Data Processing, Clerk,
 Communications, General VA, Admin Support, Sales and Admin Specialist, Administrative Support, Operations Admin, Executive Admin Assistant, Sales Assistant.





Duties and Responsibilities

New Orders - Processing Product Order (Gift Certificate)

New Orders - Initial Order Confirmation (Level 3)

Instructor Onboarding, Offboarding and Reonboarding

Reactivate Unavailable Instructor

Secret Message: When you apply, under the section that says "Is there anything else you'd like to write or include?", write the word PINK ELEPHANT. This will show us that you read the entire job description.

Duplicate Record Check

Updating the "Daily Tracking" Process

CTM Prospect Staging





Qualifications

At least 2-3 years of minimum work experience in a relevant or equivalent role

Comprehensive background in Customer and Administrative support

High level of accuracy and attention to detail

Excellent English communication and comprehension

Proficiency in using and managing Google applications - Gmail, Calendar, Documents, Drive

Preferably with knowledge in using cloud-based CRM

Organized and has careful attention to detail

Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively

Strong Problem-Solving skills

Customer Service Oriented and the ability to adapt/respond properly to different types of scenarios

Equipped with good skills in office/admin management, and can suggest process improvements

Must have your own computer, reliable high-speed internet, and a good quality headset and microphone.





What's Hard About This Job

Working Remotely - We're a remote-first company, and we never want to have an office. This is great if you like working by yourself in the quiet, but it can be terribly painful if you need the energy of coworkers nearby.

Our Cultural Values - We're an American company with an incredibly unusual culture. Even by American standards, our 7 cultural values are highly unusual. Our culture is challenging for people accustomed to corporate culture and especially difficult for people who grew up in Confucian cultures. It's a great culture for people who speak directly and have a great deal of self-confidence and ownership. If you identify as a misfit, you'll do well.

Multiple Software Systems - You're going to need to learn how to use 12 different software systems. This is great if you want to get exposed to and experience lots of technology, but it can be tough if you have a hard time learning technology. Secret Message - When you apply, you'll see a box that asks if you want to add anything else. Type in PINK ELEPHANT in all capital letters exactly as we've shown it here.





Cheat Code for getting a job with us:

1) Our application comprises the majority of our recruiting process. Because of that, we suggest that you give us thoughtful responses and rich stories. We typically only interview applicants who give rich and detailed answers to our questions. If you write short responses so that you can hurry up and finish the application, you will not get interviewed.

2) Tell us stories about how your actions match your beliefs and values. For example, if I say I value health and fitness, you don't know if I'm telling you the truth or if I'm just telling you what sounds good. But, if I tell you things I've done, I can illustrate my values of health and fitness with proof. For example, I go to the gym 4 days per week, I've done 6 triathlons, including an Ironman, and I can swim 3000 meters in one hour. My examples of things I've done prove that my actions match my values system.

3) Be vulnerable and honest. We take very detailed notes during the interview process, and we conduct extensive background checks. If the stories you tell about yourself don't match what your references say, we will not hire you. We'd rather hire a C student who is honest about being a C student than someone who is a C student but tries to pass themselves off as an A student. Remember, this is an entry-level job. We're not looking for perfect. We're looking for an excellent cultural fit.





How to apply: Please click on the link: 
/work-opportunities/administration-agent

title: Virtual Executive Assistant
description:
I'm the founder of a digital growth marketing company that helps mission-driven founders scale their businesses with more ease & less overwhelm - and I'm looking for a small team of highly-skilled Executive Assistants to help take over the marketing and management tasks that make a huge difference in the lives of the people that hire us.



I'm looking for a max of 5 amazing executive assistants available for part-time (potential for full time) with a salary starting at $500 USD per month and with long term success and robust training, moving up to $700 USD per month as an emerging leader in the company.



If you have the following skill sets, I encourage you to apply:



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:

- Minimum of 3–5 years of experience in Digital Marketing, Video Editing, Social Media Management, Content Creation, and Executive Assistant Work (Administrative Tasks, Calendar &
 Management, etc)
