title: Virtual Appointment Setter/CEM
description:
This is a pivotal, non-sales role at the heart of our patient journey. As our Virtual Appointment Setter, you will be the first point of contact for leads who have already expressed interest in our services. Your mission is simple, important, and rewarding: guide warm leads to book their initial consultation with ease and professionalism. **No cold calling and no medical knowledge required.**



*Join Our highly focused team of Sparkling White Dental operating from 3 locations in Queensland, Australia: 

*Virtual Appointment Setter*



*Location:* Remote (Work from Home)

*Position:* Virtual Appointment Setter (Part-Time)

*Compensation:* Competitive Hourly Rate + Performance Bonus on successfully booked client with confirmation of attendance





**Your Core Responsibilities:**

*   Make **100+ outbound calls daily** to warm leads who have inquired about our services.

*   Professionally guide conversations using our proven, patient-friendly script.

*   Help potential patients feel heard, supported, and excited about their visit by answering basic, non-clinical questions.

*   Efficiently schedule consultations into our calendar system.

*   Accurately log all call details and outcomes in our CRM (training provided).

*   Send follow-up SMS and
 confirmations to ensure patients are well-informed.

*   Consistently track and report your daily key metrics:

    *   Number of calls made

    *   Number of people spoken to

    *   Number of consultations booked



**What We’re Looking For (Our Ideal Candidate):**

* Speaks clear, fluent English with a friendly and confident phone presence

*   A reliable well mannered friendly communicator** with a clear, warm, and professional phone presence. People enjoy talking with you

*   Results-driven**and organised**, with a natural focus on efficiency and meeting daily goals.

*   A compassionate listener who can make patients feel comfortable and valued.

*   Tech-savvy and able to learn new software (CRM, scheduling platforms) quickly.

*   Self-motivated and disciplined to work effectively in a remote setting.

*   Previous experience in appointment setting, customer support, or a similar role is a plus, but not required—we provide full training.

* Bonus if familiar with Australian time zones or scheduling systems





**What We Offer:**

*   A straightforward, script-supported role with a clear purpose.

*   The satisfaction of helping people take the first step toward improving their health and confidence.

*   Comprehensive training on our systems, scripts, and practice ethos.

*   Stable hours and a supportive team environment.

*   Competitive compensation package with bonus potential based on performance.



**Ready to Make a Meaningful Impact?**

If you are a friendly, reliable, and goal-oriented professional who excels at connecting with people and organising schedules, we would love to hear from you.



**To Apply:**

To Apply (Please Follow These Steps):

Submit your proposal with a brief summary of your experience

Include a Loom video (2–3 minutes) introducing yourself.

 ?In the video, tell us:

 ?• Your name and where you’re based

 ?• Why you’re a great fit for this role

 ?• How you approach outbound calls or appointment setting



Important: We will assess your tone, clarity, and energy in the video—just as we would with our patients.





*We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our team.*

title: Email Marketing Assistant (Klaviyo Flows Setup) – E-commerce
description:
We are looking for a detail-oriented
 Marketing Assistant to help set up and manage
 flows in Klaviyo for our own e-commerce stores and for client stores.



This role focuses on implementing proven
 marketing systems. You will work closely with me to duplicate, localize, and set up
 flows such as Welcome flows, Abandoned Cart, Post-Purchase, and other automated sequences.



This is a long-term opportunity for someone who wants to grow within e-commerce
 marketing.



What you will do

- Set up and duplicate Klaviyo
 flows across different stores

- Update
 templates with correct branding, images, and store information

- Replace logos, headers, footers, links, and product blocks

- Localize flows for different countries/languages when needed

- Test flows before launch (links, timing, triggers,
 display)

- Maintain structure and organization inside Klaviyo accounts

- Follow step-by-step SOPs and Loom training videos

- Suggest improvements when you notice mistakes or opportunities



Who we are looking for

- Experience with Klaviyo or
 marketing platforms is a strong plus

- Experience working with e-commerce stores preferred

- Strong attention to detail

- Good written English communication

- Comfortable following structured processes and SOPs

- Reliable and consistent worker

- Basic understanding of
 layout and design tools (Canva experience is a plus)

- Ability to work independently after training



What we offer

- Long-term collaboration in a growing e-commerce business

- Direct collaboration with the business owner

- Step-by-step training via Loom videos and SOPs

- Clear and repeatable workflows

- Opportunity to grow into higher responsibility roles 
 marketing specialist or account manager)

- Stable workload as we scale to more stores and clients

- Competitive compensation based on experience



How to apply

- Send a short message including:

- Your name

- Your experience with Klaviyo or
 marketing

- Any e-commerce experience

- Your availability (hours per week)

- Examples of flows or
 work you have done (if available)



Please start your message with FLOW so we know you have read the full description.

Shortlisted candidates will receive a small paid test task.

title: Digital Marketing Builder: GoHighLevel + Display Ads (Part-Time, Long-Term)
description:
About the Role

I run a U.S.-based local marketing business focused on direct mail + digital campaigns for home service businesses. We’re looking for a hands-on digital builder who can take proven print ads and turn them into effective digital campaigns.

This is not a strategy or client-facing role.

 It is an execution role for someone who enjoys building clean pages, ads, and automations that convert.

This is a long-term, part-time opportunity with variable workload.



What Success Looks Like

Within 60–90 days, you can independently:

Turn direct mail designs into display ads

Build clean, conversion-focused landing pages

Design and deploy
 campaigns

Set up basic automations and workflows

Execute tasks from a short brief with minimal oversight



Core Responsibilities

Display Ads

Convert print ads into display ads (multiple sizes)

Maintain brand consistency while adapting for digital formats

Export and organize assets correctly





GoHighLevel / Impact Pro

Build landing pages inside GoHighLevel

Design and build
 campaigns (broadcasts + simple sequences)

Set up basic automations (tags, triggers, sequences)

Assist with light funnel or workflow setup as needed

General

Execute from clear direction without micromanagement

Ask smart clarifying questions when needed

Work asynchronously with a short weekly check-in



Required Skills (Non-Negotiable)

Strong experience with GoHighLevel

Proficiency with at least one design tool (Canva, Figma, Adobe, etc.)

Ability to translate print ? digital without reinventing designs

Solid layout and conversion-focused instincts

Reliable communication and deadline discipline



Nice-to-Have (Not Required)

More advanced GHL automations

CRO or landing page optimization experience

Experience with local service or lead-gen businesses



Workload Expectations (Average)

Display ads: ~2 per week

Landing pages: ~4 per month

s: ~2 per month

Automations: ~4 per month

Work volume will fluctuate. There are no guaranteed minimum hours or tasks.



Compensation (Task-Based)

We pay per completed deliverable, not hourly. All work is scoped and approved before starting.

Display Ads (from existing print designs)

Single display ad (1 size): $8–$10

Ad set (3 sizes): $15–$22

Ad set (5 sizes): $22–$30

Includes clean export and minor layout adjustments for digital.



Landing Pages (GoHighLevel / Impact Pro)

Basic landing page: $25–$35

 (Hero, CTA, form, simple layout)

Standard landing page: $40–$60

 (Multi-section layout, mobile optimization, conversion-focused structure, 1-2 simple automations)

Advanced landing page: $65–$90

 (Multi-step forms, lead magnets, conditional content, more than two complex automations)

Rates assume copy, assets, and goal are provided. Copywriting is priced separately if required.



 Builds (GoHighLevel)

Single broadcast
: $12–$18

3
 sequence: $30–$45

Includes layout, links, tags, and basic triggers.



Automations & Workflows

Simple automation: $20–$30

 (Basic triggers, tags,
 actions)

Multi-step workflow: $40–$60

 (Branching logic, waits, multiple actions)



Notes on Pay

Final pricing is confirmed before each task begins

Scope changes may require adjusted pricing

This is a long-term relationship, not one-off gigs

Strong performers will see increased task volume and rate flexibility over time



This Role Is NOT a Fit If:

You are an agency or juggling many clients

You prefer strategy over execution

You need constant step-by-step instructions

You dislike task-based work



Application Instructions (Required)

To apply, please answer the following in order:

How long have you been using GoHighLevel, and what do you use it for most?

Which design tool do you prefer, and why?

Share 2–3 examples of landing pages or funnels you’ve built (screenshots or links).

Describe a time you converted an existing design (print or web) into digital assets.

What does “conversion-focused design” mean to you?

What is your weekly availability?

Applications that skip questions will not be reviewed.



Optional Paid Test Task

Shortlisted candidates may be asked to complete a small paid test task, such as:

Converting a print ad into multiple display sizes, or

Building a simple landing page in GoHighLevel from a reference

title: Customer Support Specialist (Email Only) – Dropshipping
description:
I am looking for an experienced Customer Support Specialist to handle
 support for my dropshipping stores.



This role is NOT for beginners.

You must already have experience handling customer support for dropshipping stores and understand how to communicate clearly, accurately, and professionally with customers.



Role Overview:



- You will be responsible for handling customer support via
 only.

- Your work will include:

- Responding to customer
s using:

   - Existing templates and

   - Custom responses when needed, using ChatGPT

- Handling common dropshipping situations such as:

   - Order delays

   - Returns & refunds

   - Size and product questions

   - Delivery issues

- Knowing when to escalate instead of guessing

- Following SOPs and approval rules for non-standard cases



Important:

You must be comfortable using ChatGPT as a work tool and understand that accuracy, consistency, and correct tone are important.

If you tend to guess or rush responses, this role is not for you.



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE



You must have:



- Previous experience in customer support for dropshipping stores

- Strong experience with
-based customer support

- Basic to intermediate knowledge of ChatGPT (required)

- Familiarity with:

   - SOPs & workflows

   - Shopify (basic level is enough)

   - Common dropshipping customer issues

- Experience in fashion dropshipping is a plus, but not required.



Availability & Schedule:



- Available to work any of the 7 days of the week

- Final workdays and schedule will be defined together

- Must be willing to work EU time zone hours

- Starting as part-time (2–4 hours/day) with the possibility to move to full-time



Work Requirements (MANDATORY):



You must confirm:



- You have your own PC or laptop

- You have stable and fast internet

- You have a quiet, personal workspace

- You can work focused and without distractions



What I Expect From You:



- You follow instructions and SOPs carefully

- You use ChatGPT correctly to draft professional responses

- You escalate when unsure instead of guessing

- You double-check
s before sending

- You understand that mistakes in dropshipping customer support cost money

- You are detail-oriented, calm, and reliable



APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS (READ CAREFULLY):



Applications missing any item below will be ignored.



Please include:



- Your experience in dropshipping customer support

- CV

- Portfolio (if available)

- Your available days of the week and working hours

- Confirmation if you are currently working with other clients

- Confirmation that you are willing to:

   - Start part-time (2–4 hours/day)

   - Move to full-time later

- Confirmation that you have:

    - Your own PC/laptop

    - Reliable internet (include speed test screenshot)

    - A personal workspace

- A Loom video explaining:

    - Why you want this role

    - Your experience with dropshipping customer support

    - Your experience using ChatGPT for work



Compensation:



Starting rate: $2.00 USD/hour (during the trial period)

Raises and bonuses available over time for the right candidate

Long-term opportunity for growth



Final note:

This role is ideal for someone who already understands dropshipping customer support, knows how to use ChatGPT responsibly, and prefers structured workflows with clear expectations.

title: Operations Manager / ClickUp System Architect
description:
We’re looking for an experienced Operations Manager with deep ClickUp expertise to design, build, and implement scalable operational systems—not to chase daily tasks.



Your role is to act as a system architect, ensuring our operations can run smoothly through well-designed processes, clear accountability, and strong documentation, while coordinating with our Team Manager and execution staff.



This role allows the founder to focus only on outcomes, not day-to-day operations.



Scope of Work

Architect and set up ClickUp from scratch (spaces, folders, lists, workflows, statuses, dashboards)

Design scalable operational systems for execution, QA, reporting, and accountability

Create clear, repeatable SOPs for core workflows

Build tracking and reporting systems (ClickUp dashboards, Google Sheets, Airtable)

Define quality-control and escalation flows

Coordinate with the Team Manager to ensure systems are followed

Train the Team Manager and tea
mbers on using the systems correctly

Ensure operations run independently without founder involvement



Important Notes

This is not a daily execution or task-follow-up role

You will build systems, document them, and hand over execution to the Team Manager

Success is measured by clarity, scalability, and operational independence



Engagement Type

Contract to start

Potential to move to part-time or full-time based on performance and needs



Requirements

Proven experience setting up ClickUp from scratch

Strong operations and systems-thinking mindset

Ability to design workflows, not just manage tasks

Clear SOP documentation skills



Experience working with remote teams and managers



Comfortable coordinating through managers rather than direct execution

title: SDR / Sales Assistant / Caller
description:
Sales Prospecting + Calling / Dialing (30–40 hrs/week),

Build and maintain lead lists (research, enrichment, dedupe) aligned to ICP + intent signals, then load into dialer/CRM.

Execute outbound calling via parallel dialer to hit weekly activity targets and generate Qualified Connections (45s+ + required notes).

Hand off qualified prospects to Manager (or set appointments in Phase 2) with clean notes, context, and next-step recommendations.



Monthly base salary: $500/month 

Weekly list output bonus (accepted leads):

200/week = +$25

title: Social Media Strategist + Content Partner
description:
Arete Artistry by Tracie Fearing



Read this first



This is not a typical social media job.



This role is for someone who genuinely cares about art, creativity, and making the world a more beautiful place. Skill matters, but alignment matters more.



If you are just looking for another client, this is not for you.

If you get excited about helping an artist stay in her creative zone while her work reaches the people who need it most, keep reading.

Tracie’s Story



Tracie Fearing has been an artist for as long as she can remember.



When she was five years old, walking to kindergarten, her dad asked what she wanted to be when she grew up. Her answer came instantly. An artist. She never wanted to be anything else, and she never stopped choosing it, even when it wasn’t the practical path.



For Tracie, art isn’t about filling wall space. It’s about how people feel in their homes and in their lives.



When she paints, time disappears. It’s where she feels most alive, most grounded, and most herself. That depth shows up in her work. Her art brings calm, joy, and presence into the spaces people live in every day.



She believes real art carries energy that washes the daily stress and noise of life off our souls.



This isn’t about selling paintings. It’s about making the world a little more beautiful and a little more happy.

The Mission



Our goal is simple.



Help Tracie’s art reach more people without pulling her out of her creative flow.



That means building a consistent, thoughtful social media presence that feels authentic to her work and values, not trendy, flashy, or generic.

The Role



We are looking for a Social Media Strategist and Content Partner.



This is not just posting pretty images. You will help guide, shape, and execute the content strategy from start to finish.



You will work closely with Tracie so she can focus on creating art, while you focus on turning that process into meaningful content that connects with the right audience.

What You’ll Be Responsible For



• Helping guide what content to film and how to film it

• Turning raw video into engaging short form content

• Editing videos with music, pacing, and polish that fits Tracie’s aesthetic

• Writing captions that feel human and aligned with her voice

• Posting consistently across platforms

• Understanding timing, trends, and basic algorithm behavior

• Engaging with comments and helping maintain 
ntum

• Bringing creative ideas and direction, not just execution



Tracie’s only responsibility will be filming while she paints. You handle the rest.

What This Role Is Not



• Not a one off posting job

• Not just scheduling content

• Not someone who needs constant direction

• Not “whatever is trending” content

• Not rainbow, bubblegum, overly polished influencer aesthetics



Authenticity matters here.

Who This Is For



You’ll be a great fit if you:



• Love art, creativity, and storytelling

• Care about beauty, meaning, and emotional impact

• Enjoy helping creatives stay in their zone

• Are proactive and bring ideas to the table

• Understand social media strategy and execution

• Want to be part of a mission, not just a paycheck

Time & Budget



This is a monthly role.



Budget range is approximately $500 to $1,000 per month, depending on experience and fit.



The right person matters more than the lowest price.

Application Process (Important)



To apply, you must complete all of the following. Incomplete applications will not be considered.



Step 1

Record a short video of yourself answering these two questions:

Introduce yourself and tell us a little about you

Why do you want to be part of Arete Artistry and this mission?



We want to hear your heart, not a script.



Step 2

 the following to 



• Your video (or a link to it)

• A link to your portfolio or examples of your work



Subject line: Social Media Partner Application

Final Note



This role is for someone who wants to help spread more joy, beauty, and presence through art.



If you read this and thought, “I want to be part of that,” we’d love to hear from you.

title: Performance Media Buyer & Tracking Specialist
description:
ABOUT INUMIN MEDIA

Inumin Media is a digital marketing agency helping businesses grow through paid ads, content, and website systems. Our clients run Google Ads and
/Instagram Ads. You will manage campaigns, handle tracking setups, fix attribution issues, and deliver clear performance reporting.



This role requires strong technical skill, clear thinking, and fast execution. You must be comfortable working inside Google Ads, Meta Ads Manager, GTM, GA4, and GSC.



––––––––––

ROLE OVERVIEW

You will own ad strategy, campaign setup, technical tracking, optimization, creative direction, and reporting. You must understand how traffic, tracking, and conversions work together. You will support both Inumin Media and our clients across various industries.



You must be comfortable working during Alberta, Canada business hours for alignment calls.



––––––––––

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



CAMPAIGN STRATEGY

• Build advertising strategies based on client goals

• Break down campaigns into simple actionable plans

• Conduct keyword research, audience research, and competitor analysis

• Proactively recommend improvements to performance, tracking, and funnels



CAMPAIGN SETUP

• Launch and manage Google Ads, Meta Ads, and IG campaigns

• Set up campaign structures, budgets, targeting, placements

• Write headlines, descriptions, and primary text

• Build custom audiences, remarketing audiences, and lookalikes

• Create ad variations and request creative assets when needed



TECHNICAL SETUP & TRACKING (CRITICAL DUTY)

You must fully own all tracking and event configuration:

• Build and configure new GTM containers

• Set up GA4 events, parameters, conversions

• Configure Google Ads conversion tracking

• Implement Meta Pixel and CAPI

• Build custom event triggers (form submissions, button clicks, add-to-cart, checkout steps, lead forms, quizzes, scroll depth)

• Use DebugView, GTM Preview, and Test Events to confirm functionality

• Connect GA4, Google Ads, GTM, and GSC

• Build Looker Studio dashboards

• Troubleshoot attribution discrepancies

• Maintain documentation for each client setup



OPTIMIZATION

• Review performance daily

• Optimize bids, budgets, keywords, audiences

• Split test creatives, headlines, hooks, and angles

• Fix weak links in funnels (landing pages, load speed, messaging)

• Improve CTR, CPA, ROAS, and overall conversion flow



REPORTING

• Build weekly performance reports

• Provide clear explanations and next-steps

• Highlight what worked, what failed, and what needs improvement

• Present results internally or to clients when needed



COLLABORATION

• Work with the creative team when new visuals or videos are required

• Provide clear instructions and samples for ad creators

• Communicate with the team using Loom videos, messages, and meetings



––––––––––

REQUIREMENTS



EXPERIENCE

• 2+ years running active Google Ads and Meta Ads campaigns

• Strong hands-on experience with GTM, GA4, conversion events, and debugging

• Experience managing budgets of at least $1,000–$10,000 per month

• Experience handling multiple accounts at once



SKILLS

• Strong analytical skills

• Good ad copywriting

• Good creative judgment

• Fast and organized workflow

• Strong English communication

• Ability to work without micro-management



TOOLS

• Google Ads

• Meta Ads Manager

• Tag Manager

• GA4

• Search Console

• Looker Studio

• Canva (or similar tools)



WORK STYLE

• You communicate clearly

• You ask questions early

• You take initiative

• You show your work with screenshots or Loom videos

• You document setups

• You move quickly during setup and optimization

• You can work during Alberta (Canada) time zone for meetings



––––––––––

WHAT YOU WILL NOT DO

• You will not wait for Gerald to figure out tracking

• You will not leave conversion events undone or untested

• You will not delay tasks without explanation

• You will not guess or assume—always ask

• You will not require constant reminders



––––––––––

TO APPLY

Send the following:

	1.	Resume/CV

	2.	1–2 minute video introducing yourself

	3.	Short breakdown of your experience with Google Ads, Meta Ads, GTM, and GA4

	4.	Internet speed test link

	5.	Portfolio (screenshots of ads, dashboards, results, etc.)

	6.	Your location and confirmation you can work Alberta business hours

Hours

Flexible schedule with clear deadlines

Opportunity to grow hours over time if it is a good fit

Prepare content for posting on platforms such as
 and Instagram

Applications without sample work will not be considered.

title: Design & HubSpot Marketing VA
description:
About the Role



We are looking for a virtual assistant to support our marketing initiatives and operational needs. In this role, you will create on-brand marketing assets, build and maintain HubSpot landing pages, and assist with day-to-day marketing and administrative tasks.



You will work closely with our team to ensure all marketing materials and campaigns are clean, professional, and aligned with our brand guidelines. In addition to marketing tasks, you will help manage book inventory, coordinate orders for our online store, and handle simple administrative duties.



This role requires someone detail-oriented, organized, and adaptable, with the ability to follow instructions and contribute to multiple areas of the business. There is also opportunity for additional responsibilities and growth based on performance and available hours.



Key Responsibilities

• Design marketing handouts, PDFs, and simple digital assets

• Build and update landing pages in HubSpot

• Set up HubSpot forms and CTAs (basic level)

• Follow provided brand colors, fonts, and layout guidelines

• Make revisions based on feedback

• Organize and maintain design files in shared folders

• Support marketing campaigns as needed

• Maintain and monitor book inventory and manage communication related to orders and logistics 

• Manage the online apparel store, ensuring inventory management, order processing, and customer experience.

• Handle simple day to day administrative tasks

• Opportunity for additional responsibilities and growth based on performance and available hours



Required Skills & Experience

• At least 3 years of virtual work experience

• Experience using HubSpot (landing pages, forms,
s)

• Strong design skills (Canva, Adobe, or similar)

• Experience creating marketing handouts or landing pages

• Experience optimizing landing pages for conversion

• Basic understanding of marketing funnels or lead generation

• Ability to follow brand guidelines and follow instructions

• Strong attention to detail and organization

• Clear written communication



Tools You’ll Use

• HubSpot

• Canva (Adobe is a plus)

• Google Drive

• Required to have a Gmail account

• Asana (or willingness to learn)

• Missive (for communication)



Work Details

• Part-time with potential to transition to full-time

• Remote role, US-based (Central time)

• Paid hourly

• Start: Immediate work availability 



How to apply?

Please submit your job application through this platform and include a Google Drive folder link named:

Job Role_Full Name_Date You Applied



Your Google Drive folder should contain the following:

1. Introduction Video

     - A short video explaining:

           • Why you’re interested in the position

           • Why you’re qualified

           • Ideal number of hours

           • Your available date to start

           • Your preferred hourly rate range

     - Keep the video under 5 minutes

     - File name: Introduction Video_Full Name

2. Resume

title: Customer Success Specialist (Inbound Sales & Chat Support) – Remote
description:
We are a growing digital agency expanding our international support team. We are looking for a dedicated Customer Success Specialist to manage client communications and drive retention.



In this role, you will act as the first point of contact for our customers. You will not just answer questions; you will build relationships. We are looking for someone who understands "Consultative Sales" – you recognize customer needs before they do and can guide them to the right purchase decisions via chat and
.



This position is ideal for candidates with a background in BPO, text-based support, or sales who are looking for a stable, long-term career with high earning potential based on performance.



Responsibilities:

•?  ?Manage high-volume inbound inquiries via chat and
 systems.

•?  ?Build rapport with customers to ensure high satisfaction (CSAT) and retention.

•?  ?Identify opportunities to upsell services/products based on customer interactions (Soft Sales).

•?  ?Maintain detailed records of customer interactions in our CRM.

•?  ?Work independently while meeting daily KPIs regarding response time and conversion rates.



Requirements:

•?  ?Excellent Written English: Native-level fluency is required. You must understand nuances, slang, and context.

•?  ?Sales Mindset: Experience in up-selling, cross-selling, or retention is a huge plus. You understand the psychology behind a purchase.

•?  ?Emotional Intelligence: You are empathetic and can adjust your tone to match the customer’s mood.

•?  ?Reliability: This is a full-time commitment. We require punctuality and a professional work ethic.

•?  ?Tech-Savvy: Fast typing speed and ability to navigate multiple browser tabs/CRM tools efficiently.

•?  ?Availability: Willingness to work 6 days a week (rotational shifts may apply).



What We Offer:

•?  ?Stable base pay with a lucrative bonus structure for top performers.

•?  ?Comprehensive training on our products and communication style.

•?  ?A supportive, remote team environment.

•?  ?Growth opportunities: We promote from within (Team Lead positions available).



How to Apply: We pay attention to detail. To apply, please send your resume and a brief cover letter explaining why you are good at sales. Please include the phrase "Digital Growth" as the very first word of your application subject line or cover letter so we know you read this entire post.



Applications without this code word will not be considered.

title: Video Editor
description:
Video Editor – High-Volume Comparison Videos (Client Work | Part-Time ? Full-Time)



Our client is looking for a reliable video editor to support ongoing client comparison video production. This role involves structured, repeatable editing tasks — not creative or cinematic editing.



Responsibilities (repeatable workflow):



Remove dead air / long pauses from talking-head videos



Place the talking head video centered on screen



Merge a walking character video with a looping background scene



Remove the background from the walking character (green screen or cut-out)



Create split-screen layouts when required



Assemble multi-layer video projects (background + character + talking head)



Adjust audio levels for clarity:



Reduce background noise



Balance volume levels



Light bass boost / voice enhancement for clear speech



Editing scope (important):



? No intro



? No outro



? No flying text



? No motion graphics



? No music



This is clean, consistent assembly, not creative editing



Background footage is looping



Only one voice track is used (spoken dialogue)



Software requirement:



Must be comfortable editing multi-layer video timelines



iMovie is not suitable for this workflow



Preferred tools: Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, DaVinci Resolve, or similar



Volume & workload:



High-volume output: 10–20 videos per day



Same format used repeatedly (fast once learned)



Clear reference examples and instructions provided



Position details:



Part-time to start, with opportunity to move to full-time



Long-term client work available



Paid test task required



Ideal candidate:



Fast and detail-oriented



Comfortable with repetitive, production-style editing



Follows instructions exactly



Experience with background removal and audio cleanup



Question: 



What editing software do you use, and do you have experience working with multi-layer video projects (talking head + background + cut-out subject)?

title: Expainer Video Creator
description:
???? Freelance Video Content Creator (Explainer & Social Videos)



Location: Remote

Basis: Freelance / Ongoing Project Work

Salary/Rate: TBD



About Us



We are a Quantity Surveying (QS) company based in Surrey, UK, working with both contractors and homeowners. Our work often involves explaining costs, processes, and decisions that can feel complex or overwhelming — and we believe clear, well-made video content is the best way to do that.



The Role



We’re looking for a freelance Video Content Creator to produce engaging, easy-to-understand videos that explain:



What we do as a QS company

How we support contractors and homeowners

Common questions around construction costs, budgets, and processes

These videos will be used across our website, social media, and client-facing content.



What You’ll Be Doing



Creating short-form and long-form explainer videos

Turning QS and construction concepts into clear, client-friendly content

Writing or refining scripts and outlines

Filming, editing, and delivering polished videos suitable for web and social platforms

Advising on video formats and styles that perform well online

Making revisions based on feedback



What We’re Looking For



Proven experience creating explainer or educational video content

Strong storytelling and communication skills

Ability to simplify technical or professional topics

Experience creating content for websites and social media

Confident working independently and meeting agreed deadlines



Nice to Have



Experience working with construction, property, or professional services

Understanding of UK construction or QS-related topics

On-camera presence or animation/motion graphics capability



What We Offer



Flexible freelance arrangement

Ongoing work for the right person

Clear briefs and collaborative working style

Opportunity to help shape how homeowners and contractors understand QS services



How to Apply



Please send:



A short introduction

Examples of relevant video work (portfolio or links)

A brief note on how you’d approach creating explainer videos for a QS business

title: B2B Sales Executive (Industrial Sector)
description:
NOTE: IF YOU DO NOT HAVE ANY EXPERIENCE WORKING IN INDUSTRIAL SECTORS/BUSINESS, DO NOT APPLY.



Summary

We are a fast-growing industrial supply and e-commerce company seeking results-driven B2B Sales Executives to join our team. Our business spans across manufacturing, construction, aerospace, defense, chemicals, pharmaceuticals, energy, utilities, transportation, logistics, machinery, equipment, metal fabrication, welding, electronics, textiles, automotive, mining, and packaging industries.



Responsibilities

- Drive inbound and outbound sales efforts to generate qualified leads and close deals.

- Manage a structured inside sales process with 100–200 calls daily to prospects and clients.

- Consistently meet and exceed sales quotas while maintaining high-quality customer interactions.

- Build and maintain strong relationships with industrial sector clients.

- Adapt quickly to changes, follow best practices, and deliver results under deadlines.



Requirements

- 2+ years of inbound and outbound sales experience, with a history of carrying and exceeding quota.

- Comfortable with high-volume calling as part of a structured inside sales process.

- Strong communication and negotiation skills.

- Ability to thrive in a fast-changing environment, meet quotas, and hit deadlines.

- Experience in the industrial sector/businesses is required (manufacturing, construction, aerospace, defense, chemicals, energy, logistics, etc.).

- Self-motivated, disciplined, and goal-oriented.



Preferred Qualifications

- Prior experience in international sales or cross-border B2B transactions.

- Familiarity with CRM tools and sales automation platforms.

- Remote work experience with proven ability to manage time and productivity independently.

title: General Virtual Assistant / Marketing Coordinator
description:

A background in marketing, social media, or website management is a plus but not required.

 and CRM

Support internal teams with client-related tasks

IMPORTANT: A marketing background is a plus. Please have relevant 2-3 work samples ready for review during the initial interview.

title: Senior AI Agent Engineer (LLM Systems & Autonomous Agents)
description:
We are seeking a highly experienced AI engineer specializing in the design, development, and deployment of LLM-based agents and autonomous AI systems.

This role is not focused on web development, SEO, UI, or general software engineering. It is a deeply technical position for engineers whose core expertise is AI agents, reasoning systems, and large language model orchestration.



Role Overview

You will design and build production-grade AI agents capable of executing complex tasks with minimal supervision. This includes single-agent and multi-agent systems with structured reasoning, memory, tool use, and robust failure handling.



Key Responsibilities

Architect and implement LLM-driven autonomous agents

Build multi-agent systems with coordination, delegation, and feedback loops

Design structured reasoning pipelines (planning, execution, reflection)

Implement long-term and short-ter
mory mechanisms

Integrate tool calling, function execution, and external APIs

Develop Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems using vector databases

Debug and mitigate hallucinations, looping behaviors, and reasoning failures

Optimize systems for reliability, latency, cost, and scalability



Required Technical Expertise

Advanced Python engineering (clean, modular, production-ready code)

Deep hands-on experience with OpenAI / GPT-4 / GPT-4.1 / o-series models

Strong understanding of LLM prompting at a system and architectural level

Practical experience with agent frameworks, such as:

LangChain / LangGraph

AutoGen

CrewAI



or equivalent custom implementations



Expertise in embeddings, semantic search, and vector databases:



Pinecone, Weaviate, FAISS, Chroma, or similar



Experience designing and evaluating RAG pipelines



Familiarity with LLM evaluation, observability, and agent debugging



Strongly Preferred Qualifications



Experience deploying AI agents in real-world or production environments



Ability to reason about failure modes, edge cases, and system behavior



Comfort designing AI architectures without reliance on templates or tutorials



Strong understanding of LLM limitations and trade-offs



Ability to clearly explain technical decisions and system designs



What This Role Is Not



Not web development (frontend or backend)



Not SEO, marketing, or automation scripting



Not prompt-only experimentation



Not entry-level or exploratory AI work



Application Requirements



Applicants should submit:



A summary of AI agents or LLM systems they have built



Relevant code samples, repositories, or architecture diagrams



A brief explanation of a challenging AI system problem they encountered and how they solved it

title: Facebook Ads Media Buyer - You'll Love Working Here!!!

My name’s Julien, founder of Home Run Marketing. We’re a tight-knit, fast-moving team of high-performers scaling quickly in the painting industry.

We help painting companies become the go-to choice in their market through:

- Owner-generated ads on
 and Instagram

- Sales coaching and business guidance to ensure they win

In the first 3 months, our average client generates an 11.2x ROAS (50?ove market average), and I need YOU to help us continue delivering these amazing results!



**Your Role**

Your role is to support a marketing strategist by executing their strategies with accuracy and attention to detail so campaigns run smoothly, data stays clean, and clients get consistent results.

If you love structured tasks, clear expectations, and being the person everyone can count on, you’ll love this job.

Your main day-to-day tasks will be:

- Launch and manage Meta campaigns.

- Set up new clients inside our systems (GoHighLevel, Google Sheets, ClickUp)

- Handle the creative process from requesting client content to collaborating with the creative editor to turn the content into converting creatives.

- Analyze all sorts of data (lead quality, geographic data, engagement, cost per appointment, cost per sale, ROAS) and generate reports.

- Documenting test results and other client information.



**Requirements (Deal Breakers)**

- Flawless spoken & written English. (Improper written English is a deal breaker)

- Great process adherence. Can reliably follow SOPs and procedures without mistakes.

- Excellent communicator & team player.

- Extremely fast learner.

- Strong time management & prioritization.

- 1y+ experience of
 ads (Knows how to set up campaigns, launch ads, run split tests, spot ad fatigue, spot performance issues, etc.)



**Details**

- Salary: Starting $1,100 USD/month (potential to earn up to $1,500 USD/month within 1 year)

- Schedule: 40 hours, Monday to Friday, 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern time

title: Commercial Finance / FP&A / Accountant for B2B Ecommerce
description:
Overview  

We’re seeking a Commercial Finance Analyst / FP&A Accountant to manage end-to-end financial processes, deliver strategic insights, and drive profitability through data-driven analysis. This role requires strong analytical skills, business acumen, and the ability to collaborate cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, Product, and Leadership teams.



The ideal candidate will ensure accurate financial reporting, support decision-making, and identify opportunities to improve efficiency through automation and process enhancement.



Key Responsibilities:

- Analyze financial, sales, marketing, and product data to identify revenue opportunities and margin improvements.

- Evaluate pricing models, unit economics, customer-level profitability, and cost structures.

- Collaborate with functional leads to implement corrective actions.

- Build dashboards and analytical tools to support management decisions.

- Lead month-end close (reconciliations, journal entries, variance analysis, reporting).

- Prepare budgets, rolling forecasts, cash flow projections, and financial models.

- Deliver monthly management reports with insights and recommended actions.

- Support leadership with scenario planning and strategic initiatives.

- Oversee daily financial operations across WooCommerce, 
, and QuickBooks Online.

- Partner with operations/tech teams to automate recurring processes.

- Maintain high-quality financial data through reconciliations and audit checks.

- Identify and implement process improvements using automation tools.

- Stay updated on industry standards, automation tools, and AI-driven finance advancements.

- Recommend system enhancements to increase efficiency and accuracy.

- Demonstrate a proactive, growth-oriented mindset in a fast-paced environment.



Qualifications:

- Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business, or related field.

- 3–6 years of experience in FP&A, Commercial Finance, or Accounting.

- Strong analytical and financial modeling skills.

- Experience preparing management reports with actionable insights.

- Proficiency in QuickBooks Online, 
, and advanced spreadsheets.

- Strong attention to detail, data validation, and problem-solving skills.



Preferred:

- Experience in eCommerce, technology, or high-growth environments.

- Familiarity with BI tools (Power BI, Looker, Tableau, Data Studio).

- Experience with automation tools (Zapier, Make, scripting languages).

- Understanding of financial workflows and system integrations.

title: Credit Repair Sales Specialist
description:
POSITION OVERVIEW

We are seeking a results driven Credit Repair Sales Specialist who understands both effective sales strategy and credit fundamentals. This role focuses on converting warm leads generated through paid advertising into enrolled clients primarily through direct message communication, with occasional phone calls when appropriate.



The ideal candidate is organized, confident in reading and interpreting credit reports, and capable of identifying opportunities based on a prospect’s credit profile and stated financial goals. This role is performance based with a minimum expected conversion rate of thirty percent.



This position begins with a thirty day trial period to evaluate performance, consistency, and overall fit, with clear opportunities for long term growth within the company.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Follow up with warm leads via direct messages on
 and Instagram

Convert conversations into enrollments using a consultative sales approach

Review and interpret consumer credit reports to identify service opportunities

Educate prospects on credit repair solutions clearly and ethically

Maintain accurate lead tracking and follow up sequences within CRM systems

Schedule calls when necessary and close sales via phone

Communicate with internal teams using Slack and ClickUp

Track daily activity, objections, conversions, and outcomes



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Proven sales experience with an understanding of conversion based communication

Working knowledge of credit reports including collections, charge offs, late payments, utilization, and inquiries

Ability to confidently recommend services based on credit analysis

Strong organizational and follow up skills

Comfortable communicating through direct messages and phone calls

Professional written and verbal communication skills



TOOLS AND PLATFORMS USED:

GoHighLevel

Client Dispute Manager

 and Meta Business Suite

Slack

ClickUp



PERFORMANCE EXPECTATIONS:

Maintain a minimum conversion rate of thirty percent

Demonstrate consistent follow up and accurate CRM tracking

Represent the brand professionally and ethically at all times

Show measurable improvement in engagement and enrollment metrics during the trial period



TRIAL PERIOD:

Thirty day evaluation period with performance review upon completion



WHO THIS ROLE IS FOR:

This role is ideal for someone who values structure, understands the psychology behind effective sales, and takes ownership of their results. We are seeking a candidate who is committed to growth, consistency, and producing measurable outcomes within the credit repair space. It's important that you show up on time and are very proactive. This position is for someone who is capable of taking ownership in this position and developing structured follow up systems in order to excell.

title: B2B Email Marketing Specialist
description:
As the
 Marketing Specialist, you will be responsible for shaping and executing our
 marketing strategies to engage our audience, drive customer acquisition, and increase brand loyalty. This leadership role requires a blend of strategic thinking, creativity, and data-driven decision-making to maximize the effectiveness of our
 campaigns and achieve business objectives.



Key Responsibilities:



•
 Marketing Strategy: Develop and implement comprehensive
 marketing strategies aligned with business goals, audience segmentation, and customer lifecycle stages. Identify opportunities to optimize
 performance and drive engagement.

• Campaign Planning and Execution: Lead the planning, creation, and execution of
 marketing campaigns, including promotional campaigns, newsletters, drip campaigns, and transactional
s. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure timely delivery and alignment with marketing objectives.

• Design according to our brand guidelines

• Audience Segmentation and Personalization: Segment
 lists based on customer demographics, behaviors, and preferences to deliver personalized and relevant content. Utilize dynamic content and A/B testing to optimize
 performance and increase engagement.

• Content Development and Optimization: Oversee the creation of compelling
 content, including copywriting, design, and visuals, to effectively communicate brand messaging and drive desired actions. Continuously test and refine content elements to improve campaign performance.

•
 Automation and Workflow Management: Implement
 automation workflows and sequences to streamline customer communications and nurture leads through the sales funnel. Monitor and optimize automation workflows for efficiency and effectiveness.

• Performance Monitoring and Reporting: Monitor key
 marketing metrics and performance indicators, such as open rates, click-through rates, conversion rates, and revenue generated. Analyze campaign results and provide insights to inform optimization strategies and future planning.

• List Growth and Management: Develop strategies to grow
 subscriber lists organically and manage subscriber acquisition channels, including website sign-up forms, lead magnets, and partnerships. Ensure compliance with
 marketing regulations and best practices.

•
 Deliverability and Inbox Placement: Monitor
 deliverability rates and inbox placement to ensure that
s reach subscribers' inboxes and avoid spam filters. Implement best practices for improving deliverability and maintaining a positive sender reputation.





Experience:

- 2+ years of proven experience in creating high impact and unique
 marketing campaigns for E-commerce brands.

- 2+ years of marketing work experience with a background in e-commerce lead generation, customer acquisition using creative
 campaigns.

- Knowledgeable in different copywriting strategies that will be used to promote the product.

- With excellent communication and writing skills.

- Hands-on experience in e-commerce marketing automation platforms.

- Professional copywriting skills are essential. You must be able to consistently match our brand’s voice and deliver professional and engaging copy writing.

- Very high attention to detail to uphold writing and design against our brand standards.

- Serve as a true marketing subject matter expert

- You have a heart for meaningful impact and believe you can make a difference

- Take ownership, pride, and aggressive attitude to growing the company and being a high achieving tea
mber.

- We only want A-Players.
